loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy R., age 48, is a widow and a housewife. She has four children, two of whom work in construction and together earn about $10 per day. One child works as a waiter, earning about $60 per month, and one child is married and no longer lives at home.

Suy would like to borrow $800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use as their transportation to work and to dig a well to serve as her family’s water source. They currently do not have running water.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to use as their transportation to work and to dig a well to serve as her family’s water source.

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nancy is thirty years old and married with two children. Her two young girls are already in school at ages three and five. Nancy is just starting her own business, selling women's and children’s clothing door-to-door.

Nancy has taken great care in choosing to begin her business by catering to women and children. She explains that given the expenses she will incur in purchasing her inventory, Nancy wants to be sure her products will sell and she believes women and children represent the greatest potential market. To minimize her costs and maintain a high profit margin, Nancy plans on using her loan to buy clothing in bulk, focusing on jeans and blouses for women. Nancy hopes that her nascent clothing enterprise will someday grow into a full-size family clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase of women's jeans and blouses in bulk

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Taaitulagi Chung

texts.en: Taaitulagi is an old member of SPBD that supports her family through running her vegetable garden from the loan that she received from the SPBD Program. She is a young woman of 24 years of age and has five kids. She goes to the market once a week and she earns about $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD). Her first and second loan were use to buy stock for her vegetable garden, but to maintain and enlarge the garden is the reason she is applying for another loan. Also she plans to fix the floor of her house and to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Nabaziza C Group

texts.en: Cathy has a stone quarrying business. Sarah is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to bring more chicks. Gladys wants to buy a fridge for her hotel. Angel has a bar and intends to buy more furniture with the loan. With the extra business profits, Cathy wants to start up a market stall.

loans.use: To buy more land for stone quarrying

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Previously, Maritza sold beauty products by catalog. Nevertheless, at 45-years-old, she decided to start a business selling food. Always thinking about the well-being of her two children, she started to buy what was necessary for her restaurant along with her sister.

Little by little, they first invited their family members to the restaurant, then their close friends, who recommended their place. In this way, and thanks to their good service, they started to become known, and now they don't lack clients. On the contrary, sometimes she needs help keeping her supplies stocked, especially on weekends. Now, after 4 years, the dining room in her house is very small. With the goal of opening a location on the second floor of her house, Maritza and her sister work and even take orders because they need to gather a large sum of money.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Anteriormente, vendía productos de belleza por catálogo. Sin embargo, un día, a sus 45 años, Maritza decidió ingresar al negocio de la venta de comidas. Siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus dos hijos, junto con su hermana, empezó a comprar lo necesario para su restaurante. Poco a poco, primero fueron invitando a su restaurante a familiares, luego a sus amigos cercanos, quienes a la vez, recomendaban el lugar. Fue así y además, gracias a su buen servicio, que se iban haciendo conocidas y ahora no hay día que le falten clientes. Por el contrario algunas veces necesita ayuda para abastecerse, en especial los fines de semana. Luego de cuatro años, el comedor de su casa ya queda muy chico. Con el propósito de abrir un local en el segundo piso de su casa, Maritza y su hermana trabajan incluso a pedido pues necesitan reunir una suma fuerte de dinero.

loans.use: To fix up the second floor of her house as a bigger location for her restaurant

loans.name: Shahrinisso

texts.ru:
Shahrinisso N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 43 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has a High School education. She is self employed. She sells household items from her own house. She sells laundry detergent, soap and other cleaning supplies. This business is the main source of income for her family. Her turnover, however, is relatively small and does not allow her to increase the variety of goods she has for sale. The profit from the business is just large enough to feed her family. Shahrinisso wishes to see her business grow and generate more and more profit. For this reason she wishes to obtain a loan, which will allow her to diversify her selection of goods up for sale. In addition to that, the loan will allow her neighbors, who are also Shahrinisso's main clients, to purchase more goods close to home without having to travel to the market. The client plans to repay the loan in a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur. Kiva volunteer

Назирова Шахриниссо живет в городе Вахдат. Ей 43 года Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Она закончила среднюю школу. Нигде не работает, но занимается частным бизнесом в сфере торговли . Торгует из дома продовольственными товарами. Торгует порошками , мылом и другими моющими средствами. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Но у нее не очень большая оборотная сумма. Которая не позволяет ей увеличить ассортимент товара. Доход от ее нынешней торговли хватает только для того , чтобы прокормить семью, а клиентка хочет , чтобы все-таки ее бизнес развивался и приносил большую прибыль. Для этого клиентка планирует получить кредит. Получив дополнительные средства у нее появится возможность разнообразить ассортимент товара. Кроме того соседи , которые являются основными ее покупателями получат возможность иметь больший выбор и им не придется ездить за покупками на рынок. Погасить кредит клиенка сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Diversify goods offered for sale

loans.name: Maura Eudelia

texts.es:
Maura Eudelia R. C. is 41 years old and she studied two years of high school. She has 3 children, but only one is dependent on her.

She lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paiján, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

She began her business by selling soft drinks and sweets. Her neighbors wanted to purchase a variety of products which she did not carry so she decided to save, and with much effort was able to slowly build a store with an extensive supply of products. Currently, she carries a variety of products including basic products, soft drinks, beer and some desserts.

She obtained her first loan of S/.300.00 from the communal bank called “Manos Unidas” and bought 44 lbs of rice, 10 lbs of sugar, noodles and a “little bit of everything” to add variety to her store.

With the S/.1,000 loan that she will repay in 6 months, she plans on purchasing: one sack of rice and one of sugar, cooking oil, 10 cases of beer and some cases of soft drinks.

Maura Eudelia is the president of the Mother’s Club “Maria del Carmen.” Her biggest dream is to expand her business and have the resources to help her son get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maura Eudelia R. C. tiene 41 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos,pero solo uno aun depende de ella.

Vive en Chongoyape en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio lo empezó vendiendo un poco de gaseosas y golosinas, sus vecinos querían comprar otros productos pero no contaba con estos productos, decide ahorrar y con mucho esfuerzo poco a poco fue ambientando una bodega en la que cada día la fue surtiendo mas. Actualmente tiene variedad productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, cervezas y algunos postres.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” compro 20 kg. de arroz, 10 kg. de azúcar, fideos y de todo un poco para tener variedad en su bodega.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, aceite, 10 cajas de cerveza y algunas cajas de gaseosa.

La señora Maura Eudelia es presidenta del Club de madres “Maria del Carmen”, su mayor sueño es ampliar más su negocio y obtener más utilidades para sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucia Gabriel

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old and originally from Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo. Lucia is married and has 5 children aging 15 to 1 years old. Lucia studied until 5th grade and stopped after the Mozambican civil war started, never returning to school again.

Lucia has been working selling products for many years now. Since 2000 she has had a small stand at the Boane’s central market where she sells food, such as tomatoes, onions, garlic, peanuts, coconut and basic products such as oil and soap. Tomatoes and oil are Lucia’s best products. She buys the products in Maputo, going 3 times a week by public transportation. Lucia buys a box of tomatoes for MTn 250 and sells 4 for MTn 5. Lucia makes around MTn 800 per day, at the end of the month she makes up to MTn 1,200 in a single day. Lucia’s husband works at their own machamba (small agricultural field) and helps with the household expenses and the children’s school fees.

This will be Lucia’s third loan with Hluvuku and first one with Kiva. The first MTn 5,000 was used to buy merchandise and increase the products sold at the stand, attracting more clients and increasing her daily sales. The second MTn 10,000 was used to buy cement to keep helping with the construction of her new house. Lucia currently lives at a small house with her family, but is already building a bigger house on land they have recently bought. Lucia intends to use this MTn 10,000 to buy merchandise, possibly diversifying the products offered at her stand, and if money allows buy some bricks and more cement to continue the construction of her house.

In the future Lucia would like to build a small henhouse at her new house’s backyard so that she can raise chicks and sell them, improving her household income.

The picture shows Lucia with her 6-year-old daughter Francisca and her youngest son, Luciano, 1 year old.

loans.use: Buy products to increase inventory of stand

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira G. is 49. While she does not have children of her own, Mohira lives happily with her brother and his six kids. She raises livestock and sells milk for a living, which helps her brother's family. Mohira has a cow and sells the milk wholesale at the market. She would like to purchase another cow in order to increase the yield of milk. This will help Mohira make more money. In order to buy the cow, Mohira decided to apply for a loan, which she can repay within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

 Гулова Мохира -49 лет. Детей не имеет. Живет с братом у которого шестеро детей. Не смотря на это они живут дружно и весело. Занимается она животноводством и продажей молока. Этим она помогает семье брата. Имеет корову . которая дает молоко и продает оптом на рынке. Хочет купить еще одну корову для того , чтобы увеличить количество молока. Это поможет заработать больше денег. Для того , чтобы купить корову Мохира решила получить кредит . Погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Fatoumata Modibo

texts.fr:
Fatoumata S. is 43 years old and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She lives with her husband and their children, renting in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having worked in a lot of businesses unsuccessfully, she got started six years ago in this business, purchasing and selling beauty products and various items. She works at the grand marketplace of Sikasso. To offer a varied range of products to her customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. She has been making voluntary savings deposits at Soro Yiriwaso for two months, and she is on her first PIC (individual commercial loan).

With this loan, she intends to buy 5 boxes of hair cream of different grades, 5 women's handbags, 10 coolers, 5 dozen coffee mugs, 5 boxes of bath soap, and 5 pairs of shoes. She gets her inventory in Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso), and often Lomé (Republic of Togo). With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 125,000 francs CFA, which will serve to cover the loan interest, to help with family expenses, and to invest in her business. She now wants to make the most of this Soro Yiriwaso loan to become a major merchant in the marketplace where she operates, in order satisfy her customers, most of whom are women.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Fatoumata S. a 43 ans et mère de cinq (5) enfants (2 garçons et 3 filles), vit avec son époux et leurs enfants en location à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des produits de beauté et divers il y a maintenant six (6) ans. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso. Pour proposer une gamme variée de produits à sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle éffectue des dépôts d’épargne volontaire à Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux (2) mois et elle est à son premier prêt individuel commerçant (PIC)..

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5 cartons de pommade de qualités différentes, 5 sacs à main pour les femmes, 10 glacières, 5 douzaines de bole à café, 5 cartons de savon de toilette et 5 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (répulique du Burkina Faso) et souvent à Lomé (république du Togo). Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 125 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les interets du pret, à contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché où elle opère afin de satisfaire sa clientèle dont la plupart sont des femmes.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and kitchen utensiles

loans.name: Mary Busingye's Group

texts.en:
Mary B. is the leader of a group of 5 women. She is 45 and married with 3 children, who are 20, 12, and 10 years old. All of her children are in school. Mary lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Mary has been a midwife in the Kiwunya Zone for the past 22 years. The market for her business is good; however, she faces the challenges of high taxes, women who don't pay, and high transportation fees.

Mary plans to use this loan to purchase medicine for her patients. Since she began working with MCDT, Mary has been able to expand her business to include a laboratory. In addition, she has been able to use her profits to educate her children.

Mary hopes to one day be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase medicine

loans.name: Some

texts.en:
Some N., 45, a grocery vendor and mother of four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, earns about $1 in profit each day. Family income is supplemented by her husband’s job as a garment factory worker. 

Some is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase yams in bulk for sale, which will help double the family’s income. 

Some's mother is pictured because Some and her husband were unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase yams in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: Fermina tiene 55 años, es soltera, vive en su casa sola, ya que no tuvo pareja ni hijos.  Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace 10 años, trabajando para el negocio familiar, pero hace 5 años decidió independizarse y poner tu propio negocio.  Fermina vende su ganado en la plaza del distrito de Taraco, los años de experiencia, hacen que realice su trabajo con muchas ganas y alegría, pero en su calidad de mujer, a veces el trabajo se le hace muy fuerte, ya que hay que trasladar a los animales, y eso se le hace complicado, pero eso no le importa, porque ella quiere mucho su trabajo.  Su deseo es ser una mujer exitosa y por eso trabaja arduamente.  Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de animales para la mejor productividad de su negocio, espera en el futuro que su negocio crezca, así como sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Fermina is 55-years-old, is single, and lives alone since she doesn't have a husband or children. She buys and sells livestock, an activity that she has done for 10 years as part of the family business. Five years ago, she decided to become independent and start her own business. Fermina sells her livestock in the plaza in the district of Taraco. Her years of experience make her carry out her job with a lot of eagerness and happiness. Sometimes her work makes her strong as a woman since she has to transfer the animals, and this is complicated. But it doesn't matter because she loves her job. Her dream is to be a successful woman, so she works very hard. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase a larger quantity of animals to improve the productivity of her business. She hopes in the future that her business will grow along with her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her quantity of livestock

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Yawovi S. est un meunier résidant à Wome, à environ 130 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise. Marié et père de 3 enfants, Yawovi est âgé de 35 ans. ayant servi son employeur durant plus de 5 ans, et maîtrisant tous les rouages du métier, il décide d’acquérir son propre moulin afin de gagner plus d’argent pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawovi S. is a miller residing in Womé, located about 130 km from the Togolese capital. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of three. Having served his employer for over five years, and mastering all the ins and outs of his work, he decided to acquire his own mill to earn more money to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milling machine

loans.name: Erede

texts.en: Erede U. is 53 years old and married with 8 children. She is an LAPO client. She sells food spices like ginger, pepper, onions, etc. The demand for her food spices is high. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more food spices to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en: Zulfa S.M. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a shop at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of items among which cereal crop products are the dominant commodities. She purchases the business items from Kariakoo city market and sometimes direct from the producers. She has been running the business for four years. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. O. is a 28-year-old man living in the Nyalenda neighborhood in Kisumu, Kenya with his wife and two children. George moved to Kisumu after the post-election violence in the Central Province of Kenya displaced him from his home there. He has been living in Kisumu for one year and has recently started a poultry business.

George is a boda-boda driver, which means he is the driver of a bicycle taxi (a common, inexpensive mode of transport in Kisumu). Looking to increase his income, George wanted to start a small business that would be easy to maintain while he continued his boda-boda work. He decided on a poultry business, since after feeding and giving water to the chickens he would be free to work during the day.

A new member to the K-MET network, George was interested in becoming one of K-MET’s Community Health Workers so that he could “help the people near him who need assistance.” He also found out about K-MET’s micro-finance program and is now applying for a loan of approximately 150 USD in order to expand his poultry business.

George has 15 chickens at present and sells the eggs to his neighbors. He would like to use the loan money to purchase about 150 chickens. After expanding the number of poultry, he will be able to expand his sales, perhaps getting a stall in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to raise

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a 47-year-old married man with three children who lives in Tarik A. Jadidah in Beirut. When he was 27, he started working in a detergent manufactoring plant. In 2001 he opened his own shop, where he manufactures detergents and sells them to the nearby supermarkets. Majed wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy more raw materials for his business, so that he can increase his production and sales.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Elizabeth Antonia

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth T. cuenta con 29 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante, “compra y venta de ropa típicas para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 6 años en el comercio su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuipachec del Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is 29 years of age, is married and has commercial premises from where she buys and sells traditional women’s clothing. She lives together with her 3 children and they all work together in the business, as they have done for 6 years, which is in their home on Chuipachec Place in the Juchanep region, situated in the department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. Now the demand from her customers has increased but the financial conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason she approached the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan with the intention of buying merchandise. In this way she will be able to increase her weekly sales and also hopes to be able to offer more opportunities to her children and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her women's clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more things for her shop

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S. is thirty years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. The oldest two children have already started in the primary school. Mariama lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer and she is a trader of smoked fish. Mariama buys smoked fish from markets in nearby communities and sells them at a stand in the local market. Mariama also owns a provision store. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy larger quantities of smoked fish. She hopes to provide her children with the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of smoked fish to grow her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.
Elsa es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Elsa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, 4 veces por semana, en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra animales menores y quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Elsa sueña con tener un carro para transportar sus productos y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Elsa is a partner in the La Kantuta Community Bank. She is 27 years old and married, with two children. Elsa travels to various markets in the region four times per week. There she sells a variety of clothing and buys small animals and cheeses to sell in the city market of Ayacucho. Elsa needs a loan of 2100 soles, which she'll invest in pants and jackets. She dreams of having a car to transport her products and of having a stable store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Rosalina Fernando

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Rosalina Fernando D.
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo) 18491
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:20.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de potes
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/08
Dêscription (Historial


Rosalina nasceu em gaza tem 40 anos de idade e casada e mãe de cinco filhos com idades compreendias entre 5 e 23 anos de idade, quatro dos filhos e que vão à escola a mais velha já esta empregada.
Rosalina sai de Gaza quando seu irmão mais velho convida lhe para morar com ele na cidade capital com objectivo de custear os seus estudos. Chegado a capital continua com os seus estudos e teve que interromper na 6ª classe, pois ela fica grávida do seu namorado e seu tio expulsa lhe de casa alegando que não podia responsabilizar se por ela e do seu recém nascido. A vida fica difícil ela consegue arranjar um emprego como empregada domestica onde trabalhou durante três anos, com fundo coletado ela inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de potes adquiridas em Maputo e revendidas em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Suazilândia onde conhece o seu actual esposo que reside naquele distrito.
 Anos depois ela junta se com seu esposo e passa a viver juntos e assim tornou mais fácil o seu negocio. Hoje é proprietária de uma banca de potes no mercado informal que funciona duas vezes por semana (quartas e sábados). Graças a Hluvuku e Kiva tem feito duas viagens em cada semana para reforçar o seu stock. Tem como melhor pote o de numero 1x20 e 4x20. Compra cada a 120.00MT e 250.00MT e revende cada a 270.00MT e 350.00MT consecutivamente. Rosalina, com o empréstimo da hluvuku viu seu negocio crescer e tem de um lucro mensal no valor de 7.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT porque para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus sogros que vivem com ela em sua casa. Encontra se também a mobiliar a sua casa.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Rosalina Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. Os dois primeiros foram usados para reforçar o seu negócio de potes e pede este terceiro para aumentar o volume do seu stock e está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento estável para a revenda dos seus potes.
texts.en:
Rosalina was born in Gaza, she is 40 years old, she is married and has five children who are between 5 to 23 years old, 4 of her children go to school and her oldest if pregnant. Rosalina left Gaza when her oldest brother offered her to live with him at the capital city in order to pay for her studies. When she arrived to the capital she studied but interrupted her studies when she got pregnant with her boyfriend. Her uncle turned her away saying he couldn't be responsible of her and her new born. Her life turned difficult and she was able to get a job as domestic assistant where she worked for 3 years, with the money she saved, she started her own business selling pots bought in Maputo and sold in Namaacha a village near the frontier with Suazilandia where she met her current husband who lived in that district. Years later she moved in with her husband and life and business turned easier. Today she owns a spot to sell pots at the market that works twice a week (Wednesdays and Saturdays). Thanks to Hluvuku and Kiva she has been able to travel twice a week to increase her stock. Her best pots are the numbers 1x20 and 4x20. She buys them at 120mt and 250mt and sells them at 270mt and 350mt respectively. Rosalina watched her business grow with the loans obtaining a monthly income of 7.000mt and gaining a profit of 1.000mt. Besides her two children she is responsible for her parents in law who live with her at home. She is also looking to buy furniture. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first two were used to increase her business and she is requesting the third to increase the volume of her stock, she is confident she will pay it back on time and will request a new loan to build a stable store to sell her pots.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 40 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 18,14 y 12 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en el establo que implementó en su misma casa; todos los días su esposa y sus hijos lo apoyan en el cuidado de sus animales en cuanto a la limpieza del establo y la alimentación. Después de varios meses de crianza Jorge y su familia van a la feria ganadera de su localidad para vender sus toros, obteniendo un buen precio por ellos. Adicionalmente, vende la leche que extrae de sus vacas y cultiva algunas chacras de papa y maíz. Para un futuro cercano, Jorge desea un establo más grande y mejorarlo en cuanto a su infraestructura. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y él es uno de los miembros de su banco comunal más comprometido y que participa activamente por el bienestar de su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de una vaca de una buena raza.
texts.en:
Jorge is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children (ages 18, 14, and 12) in a house that they own. He tends to the cattle housed inside the barn built next door. Every day, his wife and children assist him with the care of the animals by feeding them and cleaning the stalls. Once the calves are weaned after several months of nursing, Jorge and his family go to the local livestock fair to sell the bulls, getting a good price for them. In addition, he sells the milk from his cows, as well as the potatoes and corn grown on his farm. In the near future, Jorge would like to build a larger barn and make overall improvements around his farm.

This is his third loan with MFP. Jorge is one of the more committed members of his communal bank and actively looks after the best interests of his group. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase a cow of good breed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Moang

texts.en: Moang L. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a shop near her house. Moang is 39 years old and is widowed. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop near her house

loans.name: Krey

texts.en:
Mr. C. Krey, 26, is single and lives with his parents along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. C. has one sister who is a garment factory worker. His parents are farmers.

He has been a construction worker since 2006. The walls of his house break down and it’s difficult for his family to live, especially when the rainy season comes. Therefore, C. is requesting his first loan of $500 in order to buy wooden materials to repair the wall and fill up the land of his house.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials to repair the walls of his house.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: Tajik housewives are usually also active in helping their husbands by earning more income. There are many occupations that were traditionally male dominated but are now done by women. Dilfuza’s is an example. Dilfuza has been farming cattle for the past five years. Her earnings even surpassed her husband's who works as a farmer. Dilfuza, with the support of her daughter (pictured), is doing well in her business. With a loan from IMON International she expects to buy young cattle. She really hopes that she can produce more cows to be sold so she earns more than last year. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more calves to expand her business

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: For 12 years, Tahir A. has dedicated himself to raising cattle to support his humble and reliant family. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his dearest parents. The agriculture business is labor intensive and demanding because it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Tahir has turned to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan of 2000 USD to purchase calves to raise.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is thirty-six years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Naomi is a trader. She is involved in a local soap production business. She sells at the local market and supplies to other retailers in her community. She buys her goods such as soda ash, palm oil, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy raw materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy soda ash and palm oil for her soap production busines

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Q. sells fresh and frozen fish at the Elmina sea shore.  Mary has a senior high school educational background.  She is a widow. Mary has been selling fresh frozen fish since 1999. She is responsible for paying her utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell.

Mary hopes to save the new profits from her business to one day build her own house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia L. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban Mis. Occ.. She is 35 years old. Claudia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Claudia owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products like shampoo, toothpaste, rice, sugar and other basic needs. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Claudia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional goods to sell. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Claudia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lord Of Lord Group

texts.en:
A. is 31 years old, married and the father of two children, both of whom are in school. He makes a living selling oranges and smoked fish. He started this business three years ago at local community market. He buys his fish in the Accra region of Ghana and is known for the quality of his products, which is why many people buy from him. Demand for his products has increased, but he lacks capital to meet that demand. He is applying for a loan to increase his output. His dream is to give his children a quality education from the proceeds from the business, and he would be grateful for your support.

A. leads a trust bank group called ‘Lord of LORD' and is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and farmers. They guarantee each others' loans, and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as oranges, smoked fish and dried fish.

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.en: Gervacio Gutierrez Montiel is married and owns his own home. A blacksmith for 20 years who has built up a loyal clientele, he owns a workshop where he sells chalk, paint, and tin and provides repair and building services.  His two grown children help him in his workshop, and he has all the tools to do his work well. Gervacio will use his loan to purchase iron, paint, and finish and will invest in offering a delivery service for his customers.

loans.use: Materials for his business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con estudios primarios completos. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 meses atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región como papa, habas, chuño, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su capital propio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II”. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Celia is 48 years old and a single mother of three children. She has an elementary school education and earns a living buying and selling grain.

Celia has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 months. Her Communal Bank provided her first loan in the amount of 500 soles, which she used to buy grain. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase grains and dry goods from the region such as potatoes, lima beans, chuño (dehydrated potatoes), etc. Her desire for the future is to acquire her own capital. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains & dry goods

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a 46-year-old woman who is married and blessed with eight children. They are living in Dalig, Antipolo City, which is in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is a woman who has big dreams to overcome all challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. She and her husband have worked very hard to raise their big family. Despite the many hardships she encountered, she was able to send all of their eight children to school.

She joined Ahon SA Hirap Inc. (ASHI), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2001. For almost eight years in ASHI, she has shown good performance, so she is being trusted by the institution for further loans.

She runs a variety store with a little carenderia (stall selling foods ready to eat). She started her variety store based on her idea of dealing with customers. Her business is growing because the members of the community in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store instead of going to other places. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos as her eleventh loan from ASHI to pay for items including sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, brown sugar, cigarettes, canned goods, candies, soft drinks, and cooking oil.

She dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store. Her children are her motivation to continue in her business. She dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that they will complete a degree in college. Iluminada now feels very happy about her work and the service of ASHI and Kiva. Now, the couple is enjoying seeing that the loans from ASHI change their lives and give them bigger chances of making their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, brown sugar, cigarettes, canned goods, candies, soft drinks, cooking oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Backatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de beignets appelés « KLUKLU » faite à base de farine de blé, d’huile et de sucre, ce beignet est très apprécié au Togo et est utilisé pour boire de la bouillie. Les matières premières qui interviennent dans la cuisson de ces beignets sont épuisées. Elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite son premier crédit pour l’achat de 10 sacs de farine de blé, 05 bidons d’huile, 04 sacs de sucres.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son époux est un instituteur.
texts.en:
This woman's business consists in selling fritters called "KLUKLU" and made out of wheat flour, oil, and sugar. This kind of fritters is very much appreciated in Togo, where they are used to drink porridge. Her stock of fritters ingredients has run out. She would like to resupply and she's seeking her first loan in order to buy 10 bags of wheat flour, 5 cans of oil, and 4 sacks of sugar. She's married and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of wheat flour, 5 cans of oil, and 4 sacks of sugar

loans.name: Jacktone

texts.en: Jacktone is a married man with two children who are both in school.  He has a hardware shop, which he has been running for two years. He sells paint.  Previously, he used to sell kerosene but currently he earns extra income from his retail shop.  He intends to boost his paint business with a loan of Kes.40,000.  In the future, he would like to open a workshop for vehicle body parts.  Jacktone describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: Add to his stock of paint

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa A. D. H. D. 50 años D. edad,resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como profesor D. educación física. DesD. hace 10 años que María posee una comercial, en el cual venD. productos para el hogar como muebles, electrodomésticos y otro productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor variedad D. productos, ya que cuenta con muy buenas ventas y con mucho clientes lo cuales por sus precios bajos, prefieren esta comercial. Para María es muy importante poder crecer más como comerciante, ya que ha sido gracias a este, como ha podido seguir adelante durante mucho tiempo, razón por la que espera poder incrementar su inventario y así mejorar sus ventas, las cuales le permitan mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Teresa A. D. H. is 50 years old and a resident of the Department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband who works as a physical education teacher. For the past ten years, María has managed a business in which she sells products for the home such as furniture, appliances, and other items.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a wider variety of products. María already generates good sales and has many customers who prefer to shop at her store because of the low prices. For María, it is important to grow as a businesswoman because she expects to continue working for a long time. She hopes to increase her inventory and grow her sales so that she can improve the financial stability of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture & appliances

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie, 36, has businesses in rice farming and hog raising located in Banga, South Cotabato. The eldest of her three children is 13 years old. To help finance her business, she is making a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since it provides the lowest interest rate as compared to her previous experience from others, and lessens her financing charge. This loan will help her purchase farm supplies and carabao.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jaime Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime nacio el 27 de julio de 1979 en santa cruz, pero vive en la localidad del Torno ( El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas. De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.
Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.
La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino).
El Sr. Jaime viene trabajando con EMPRENDER hase 2 años, el primer credito fue para comprar un terreno en la Localidad de  San Luis, en la cual el esta trabajando  y el esta en proseso de comprar 2 hectareas  mas, con el dinero del credito el comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa y despues comercializarlo en el mercado de la zona, el espera pagar este credito y sacar otro mas grande. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgaciondle credito.
texts.en:
Jaime was born on July 27 of 1979 in Santa Cruz. He lives in a town called El Torno. El Torno is the fourth municipal section of the province of Santi Ivañez, of the Departament of Santa Cruz. It is divided into four cantons with 65 farming communities. According to the last census from 2002, the town of El Torno has 40,000 inhabitants. It is a young population, made up of migrants from the country's interior. From the west, Quechuas and Aymaras; from the east, and also people native to the area. In Santa Cruz there are large social differences that inhabit the same space. Next to the great "quintas", the properties of landholders and people with bigger purchasing power in Santa Cruz, live the residents of the area themselves. They live in houses that are mainly of simple construction (adobe and roofs thatched with palm). There is a difference between the towns of Santa Rita and Santa Marta 1 and Santa Marta 2. These are found next to the old highway to Cochabamba. There you will find homes made of brick and tile next to the simplest homes. The farming communities are towards the mountains' interior. These are all made of adobe and thatch and of much humbler conditions. Water and electricity services aren't available there. These towns are at a distance of between 5 and 20 kilometers from the interior (the pastoral area that volunteers must attend). This pastoral area is made up of 9 communities, accessed by dirt roads on which wagons sometimes pass to be able to access them. The town's economy is based on fish farming and fruit growing. It is also based on the extraction of stone, gravel and sand from the Piraí river that encircles the town. There is also a lot of commerce, especially in the town of El Torno, where there is a market where agricultural workers' products are sold. Jaime Has been working with EMPRENDER for 2 years. The first loan was to buy a lot of land in the town of San Luis. He has been working this land and is in the process of buying 2 more hectares. With the money from the loan, he will buy seed to plant potatoes and later sell them in the area market. He expects to pay off this loan and take out a larger one. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in him in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed to plant potatoes

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 54 years old and is married with four children who are 16, 18, 21 and 23 years old. Dina is a proven entrepreneur dealing in the sale of clothing items: mainly fabrics for clothes and some other items needed in sewing various styles of clothes. She has been in this business for about fifteen years and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Dina is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by adding more clothing items for sale which, hopefully, will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. Through this satisfaction, she will continue paying school fees for her children and providing more food for them. In addition, she will keep making some savings for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other items needed for sewing clothes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Ekua sells onions and palm fruits at Akotokyire. Her husband is a security man.  Ekua uses the income she acquires from her sales to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Ekua will add the loan to her original income to buy extra vegetables and palm fruits for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy extra vegetables and palm fruit for sale

loans.name: Kaïraba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAÏRABA du Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE est composé de 7 femmes toutes mariées et mères d'au moins 4 enfants. Le groupe a été créé en octobre 2002 en même temps que le Banc Villageois sous l'influence de leur affinité et de leur proximité. les membres sont animés d'un même esprit, c'est-à-dire renforcer la solidarité qui existe déjà entre elle, de développer des activités génératrices de revenus afin de mieux faire faces aux difficultés économiques que rencontrent leurs familles respectives.

Madame Aïssatou C., est une femme très engagée et a une bonne culture de l'esprit de groupe. Elle est âgée de 39ans et mère de 06 enfants qui fréquentent l'école. Comme activité commerciale elle vend du sucre, du thé, de l'huile, du riz et d'autres divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à leur santé.

le prêt actuel permettra au groupe de mieux s'approvisionner à partir des marchés hebdomadaires en marchandises, à savoir: du riz, du sucre, de l'huile de palme et/ou végétale et leur lieu d'écoulement en général c'est à domicile, dans le village.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Kaïraba of the village loan group of Terembasse is composed of 7 women, all of whom are married and have at least 4 children. The group was created in 2002, at the same time as the village loan group, due to social and regional proximity. The members are driven by the same mindset, which is to strengthen the solidarity that already exists among them, and to develop their businesses in order to better deal with the economic difficulties that their respective families face. Ms. Aïssatou C., one of the members, is a very committed woman and has a good group-oriented mindset. She is 39 years old and has 6 children who attend school. As a commercial activity, she sells sugar, tea, oil, rice, and various other food products. Her goal is to participate in paying for the health and education of her children. The current loan will allow the group to better supply themselves with goods at the weekly markets, namely rice, sugar, and palm and/or vegetable oil. Their sales locations are generally at home and in their village.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the self-financing capability of the group

loans.name: Silvia Leonor

texts.es: Silvia Leonor A. D. de 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 18 y 13 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a un sobrino, con los cuales reside en Ilopango, departamento de San Salvador. Silvia es una madre soltera, la cual trabaja muy duro con el enorme deseo de salir adelante junto a su familia, la cual depende por completo del trabajo de ella, en el cual debe buscar diferentes alternativas para mejorarlo y poder brindarle estudios, alimentación, hogar y todo lo necesario con lo que un niño debe contar. Silvia trabaja comercializando perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo y el cuidado del cabello, así mismo vende maquillaje, su venta esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, y así mismo en algunas ocasiones sale a ofrecer sus productos haciendo visitas de casa en casa, todo con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos, en diferentes marcas y de esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, todo con el deseo de poder contar siempre con las ganancias necesarias para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia Leonor A. D. is 37 years old. She lives with her three children; ages 16, 18, and 13. They go to school. She also lives with a nephew. They live in Ilopango in the San Salvador department. Silvia is a single mother. She works very hard with an enormous desire to get ahead with her family. They are completely dependent upon her work. She needs to look for different ways to improve her work and to be able to provide an education, food, a home, and all of the necessities that a child should have. Silvia works selling perfume, body creams, and hair care products. She also sells make-up. Her business is located in her house. She sometimes sells door to door. She does all of this with the desire to be able to improve her sales. She is requesting a loan from Integral in the hopes of being able to buy a greater quantity of different brands of products. That way she can offer different prices. This is all with the wish to be able to always count on the earnings that are needed to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg N., age 44, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, called a ger, on a small plot of land which they own. Her two daughters are both university students and her youngest son is in middle school. Her oldest son is currently unemployed and helps his parents with the family business.

Since 2005, after moving from the countryside, Oyunchimeg and her husband, who work well together, have been operating a clothing and shoe repair business out of a rented room. She makes and sells a variety of clothing items and her husband repairs shoes.

Oyunchimeg has many plans to expand her business in the future. She plans to purchase another three sewing machines in order to make her business more efficient and keep up with the growing demand.

Oyunchimeg is an open minded and generous woman. “We are trying our best to make more profit by working overtime so we can grow our business,” she says with a smile. She is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase three new sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase three new sewing machines

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Estelita is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Estelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Estelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pasaquiquim 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Gregoria H. G. ,  su estado civil es soltera, por lo que es una persona con visión, porque se dedica a la confección de playeras, y cuenta con sus maquinas para realizar esta actividad, elabora 2 docenas de playeras al día, este producto es enviado al norte del país de Guatemala, en el departamento de Quiche, y Alta Verapaz,  ella se dedica también a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como Ganado porcino y vacuno, y lo vende en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el alto del departamento de Totonicapán, y ella colabora con el gasto familiar, también aportan un granito de arena al desarrollo del país de Guatemala, por lo que se acercaron para solicitar un segundo crédito  así poder aumentar el capital de trabajo que tienen, juntamente con el grupo.

Este grupo de personas, del Paraje Pasquiquim, de la Aldea San Antonio Sija  del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del  departamento de  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Gregoria H. G. is single and a person with vision. She manufactures shirts and has the machines that are necessary for this business. Juana produces two dozen shirts per day and ships them to the northern part of Guatamala, specifically the departments of Quiche and Alta Verapaz. She also raises domesticated animals, such as pigs and cows, and sells them at the municipal market in San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán. She contributes toward the family expenses and does her small part in supporting the development of the Guatemalan economy. Juana and the rest of her group are requesting a second loan so that they can increase their operating capital.

These ladies are from Paraje Pasquiquim in the neighborhood of San Antonio, Township of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anurathan's Group

texts.en:
Anurathan K. has two children, in the sixth and eighth grade respectively, and leads this loan group. Her husband makes a living by selling cattle, and recently went into business on his own. Anurathan helps her husband by handling the sale of cows in the local market. The success of this business has allowed them to start building their own home, and they are working hard to finish construction. Anurathan has applied for this loan to buy more cows to raise and sell.

Anurathan’s partners are:
Karamat S., 40, has three children and helps her husband make a living selling cattle. They plan to use this loan to buy two cows, and hope some day to buy a van to help transport their small herd. 

Aizada K., 37, has three children and makes a living selling watermelons, which she brings from neighboring villages to the local market. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy more watermelons to sell, and pay to transport them to the local market.  

Aizada T., 36, has two children. Her husband has a truck and makes a living shipping goods while she sells cattle. Her husband helps her transport these cows from neighboring villages to the local market. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy more cattle, and do repair work on their house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: King Of Kings-Lugazi Group

texts.en: Running any kind of business is not for the faint-hearted. From the threshold, constant challenges can ominously look one in the face and if one does not have that strength of character, everything may go up in smoke. One lady with a wealth of good will who has withstood enormous operating cost challenges in her retail shop business in Buziika- Lugazi over the course of the last 12 years is 34-year-old N. Fatuma, a happily married mother of five. Her reputation, she says, was once at stake, given the bad rapport she had with relatives who often wanted free goods from her shop, against her will. She almost closed her shop and was thinking of relocating. This is a chequered passage anybody who operates a business will face. This business was setup with savings from her farming business. Weekly, her business generates 80,000 shillings, and with this loan, she reckons she will be able to make her business expand by leaps and bounds through the purchase of more goodies for her shop. She is looking at buying more cooking oil, tomatoes, soap and onions to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, tomatos, soap and onions to resell

loans.name: C 4346 Urumuli Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 26 years old and she is married with three children.  Clementine is the leader of a group called Urumuli and this group is commonly known for selling timbers.  This is their 8th successful year in this business, which they operate from 8 am until late in the evening hours.

Clementine and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow them to expand their business by purchasing more timber for sale.  With the use of this loan to expand their business, they really hope that their sales as well as profits will increase.  If successful, this group will keep reinvesting in their business until they become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. sells onions, salt, tomatoes, plantain and cassava in Elmina. She is single and uses her income to pay for her accommodation and utility bills. Maame has been through junior high school. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest in the sale of other varieties of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya.  He has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years and produces tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. His mixed farm also produces beans and Napier grass, which he sells locally.

Samwel is 41 years old. He is married with five children who are all adults. His youngest child attends school.

Samwel has requested this loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a good quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. He will therefore be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and increase the family's income through the sale of milk.

His primary challenges are diseases and high market competition. In the future, he would like to acquire three quality dairy cows and plant Napier grass on a large scale. He also hopes to continue partnering with Juhudi because it has helped him to access loans cheaply.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 10,000 PHP will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan that Imelda has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lolita is married and has 2 adult and 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of goods in the local community. She just started this business.

 In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used as additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 32  años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa D. sus familiares. DesD. hace 3 años tiene su botica, su profesión es química farmacéutica y decidió tener su propia fuente D. ingresos ejerciendo D. manera independiente. D. esta manera esta atenta y servicial al requerimiento D. sus clientes, sobre cierto producto medicinal que necesite, además siempre procura abastecerse D. variedad y calidad D. productos, siempre pensando en la economía D. sus asiduos clientes. Su mayor deseo es tener una sucursal más y con el tiempo seguir creciendo en su negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. medicamentos permitidos en su establecimiento D. ventas.
texts.en:
Noemí, age 32, lives with her husband and their two children in their relatives’ house.  She has had a drug store for three years.  She is a pharmacist, and she decided to have her own source of income by practicing her profession independently.  That way she is attentive to her customers’ needs, and she can help them with the medicinal products that they need.  Also, she is always stocking up on a variety of quality products.  She is always thinking of her regular customers’ savings.

Her greatest wish is to have one more branch, and, in time, to keep growing in her business.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  At the same time, she is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very helpful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy medicine that is allowed to be sold in her establishment.

loans.use: To buy medicine to stock her establishment

loans.name: Georgina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgina es una mujer trabajadora conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Vilma del Socorro Z. Meneses de 28 años comercializa ropa interior desde hace tres años de manera ambulante en la actualidad tiene un local en la ciudad de Granada.  Ella tiene dos hijos por los cuales labora arduamente e  invertirá el crédito mercadería aprovechando la época navideña. 
Z. ha participado del proceso de capacitación en género y empresarialidad  las cuales considera buenas y de gran ayuda ya que le permitió superarse y ver cómo invertir sus ganancias. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Petrona Rodríguez Alemán quien desde 1990 tiene un pequeño taller de costura y Heydi Raquel H. de 25 años quien comercializa cosméticos y sandalias.
texts.en:
The Georgina group is comprised of three hard-working women.  One of them is Vilma del Socorro Z. Meneses, age 28.  She has been selling underwear in an itinerant manner for three years.  She currently has a place in the city of Granada.  She has two children for whom she works arduously.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to take advantage of the Christmas season.

Z. has participated in the process of general training and entrepreneurship.  She feels that they are good and a big help because they allowed her to improve and see how to invest her earnings.

Petrona Rodríguez Alemán is another member of the group.  She has had a small seamstress shop since 1990.

Heydi Raquel H. is the other member of the group.  She is 25 years old, and she sells cosmetics and sandals.

loans.use: Underwear

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old. She raises dairy cows for milk and chickens for eggs. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy feeds for her animals like bran, vitamins, layers mash, growers mash, and dairy meal. She is a member of God's Favour SHG and the loan is guaranteed by the group. 

Mary is married and is a mother of five --  four of them are in school. She describes herself as hardworking and honest, and hopes to buy a pick-up truck in the future to transport her products to the market.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a red brick house. Her husband is a carpenter, but he works only in summer time. Her eldest son, Batenkh, studies at the university, and her youngest daughter, Batchimeg, attends a local secondary school. 

Enkhjargal operates a grocery store on their plot of land. She used her earnings to pay for her son’s tuition fees and to purchase items for her store, such as a refrigerator. She is an open-minded person who has very good communication skills. She says, "the most important thing to me is provide a good education for my children." 

She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and inventory.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and inventory

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdentsetseg is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a studio apartment, which they rent. Her husband Nasantogtokh works along with her. She operates a paper and book shop near the college and school area. Her regular customers are all students. She has been operating this business for nine years and has gained a lot of experience. Erdenetsetseg is planning to purchase her own studio apartment with her savings. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment and more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and more products

loans.name: Ndiang Mbambodj Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NDIANG MBAM. vient d'être inauguré et de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF le 21 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 48 femmes issues du même groupement féminin et du même village. 

Madame AMINA S. debout en premier position à partir de la droite sur la photo et mise en médaillon est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle est couturière de profession. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce ce métier. Elle est détentrice d'un atelier de couture où elle confectionne des vêtements.

Son nouveau financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de couture et accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The recently created Ndiang MbaM. Banc Villageois has just received its first financing from Caurie-MF on December 21, 2010.  It is made up of 48 women who are all from the same group and the same village. 

Mrs. Amina S., standing, at the far right of the photo, and shown in the inset, is President of the Banc Villageois. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children.
