She is  a seamstress by profession, an activity she has carried out for more than 10 years. She owns a workshop where she makes clothes. This new loan will allow her to expand the business and increase her revenue. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. N. is 37 years old with 1 child.  Being a farmer, her main activity is growing rice and vegetables to sell wholesale. Every day, she can get 80,000 VND profit from her sales. Joining the credit program in 2004, she has received 8 loans and invested effectively in expanding her farming.

Currently, she wants to buy more kinds of vegetables with high productivity to prepare for the next crop, as well as fertilizer. Therefore, she wishes to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to put her plans into practice.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en: Sourng S., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a housewife while her husband is an accountant, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay for the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fee

loans.name: Zissi

texts.fr: Dame Zissi a 4 enfants et âgée de 41 ans.  Elle est mariée. Elle vend les pagnes et  perles . Elle s’approvisionne à Accra au Ghana et au grand marché à Lomé. Elle revend à son domicile  et cumule 5 ans d’expérience. Elle demande un crédit pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Zissi has four children and she is 41 years old. She is married. She sells lengths of African-print cloth and beads. She buys her stock in Accra (Ghana) and at the Grand Market in Lomé. She sells out of her house and has five years of experience. She is asking for this loan to replenish her stock and better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: purchase of lengths of African-print cloth and beads

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta city. She is 37 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling delicacies of food in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, lechugas entre otros, la socia vende las verduras en el mercado de Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the community bank Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa, located in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Paulina is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with a business that sells vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, and others.  She sells vegetables in the market in Urubamba.  She works from 7:00am until 4:00pm.  This business is helping her improve the lives of her children.  She is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables at wholesale.

She is happy with this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She takes care of her family with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. Their dream is to construct rental houses. She operates a retail shop and has been in business for seven years with minimal hardships. Her initial capital was 1,000,000, but her business has steadily grown so that she now boasts of 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her desire is to own a wholesale shop. Robinah needs this loan to buy salt, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 40 years old and married, with 2 children.  Noralyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell in her general store.

Noralyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Noralyn aspires to save enough money so she can rent a space in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti, 46 years old, is married to Zakarias, 50 years old, who works in a private company. They are blessed with 4 children: Murny, 27 years old and married; Sitti, 25 years old and married; Muhammad, 22 years old and graduated from senior high school; Afliana, 8 years old and in 2nd grade. 

Siti has been running her business as a seamstress for years. She learned the skill from her mother when she was young and has continued running the business to generate daily income. Siti's main business challenge is her competitors, as she lives in the middle of town. This situation never makes Siti gives up. She tries her best to keep her sewing of high quality in order to maintain her customers and to attract more customers. Currently her business is running well but she wants to improve it by adding a new sewing machine. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Hafswa has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Hafswa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hafswa hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Hafswa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her access to capital, which has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina has operated a poutry business for the past five years, selling both wholesale and from door to door to her neighbors. Her customers include hotel businesses and butcher shops. Georgina's primary business challenges are the high cost of chicken feed and the outbreak of disease. She dreams of expanding her business to better meet her customers' needs. 

Georgina and her husband have four sons, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Georgina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 70,000 loan, she plans to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila  vive e Tecpatan Chiapas, es madre soltera con dos hijos a su responsabilidad  y son: Aricel de quince años y el más pequeño es Roimer Iván de diez años de edad.

    Ella invierte  el préstamo en la compra   de artículos para carros, en donde lleva ocho meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ella está trabajando y sacando adelante a su pequeña familia ya que sus hijos solo dependen de ella.

    Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue como ella podía trabajar de otra manera  así mejorar su calidad de vida para sus hijos que a un están creciendo.

       Su más grande deseo es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda  lograr tener sus propios  ahorros para salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos a que terminen la escuela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila lives in Tecpatan Chiapas and is the single mother of two children, Aricel, 15, and the youngest, Roimer Iván, 10.

She plans to use the loan to buy car accessories.  Having been involved in the business for eight months, she claims it is going well and has allowed her to provide for her small family which is totally dependent on her.

What motivated her to start this business was finding a way to improve the quality of life for her sons who are still growing.

Her greatest desire is to be able to save enough money to get ahead and support her sons for them to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy car accessories.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and married has one child. He lives with four family members. One of the family members works.

Ali is a spice dealer. In 2005, he opened his store where he sells herbs, spices and perfumes. He has experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to rebuild and renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild and renovate his store.

loans.name: Nyabukara Banywani Group

texts.en: Mustafa is a 38-year-old married man with four children. His family lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the responsibility of looking after his family. His dream is to educate his children to the university level. He has been a carpenter for 18 years; the income from his business has enabled him to keep his children in school. He has challenges paying the high cost of electricity for his business. His dream is to set up a modern workshop. Mustafa needs this loan to pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: To pay his child's school fees.

loans.name: Naight

texts.en:
Naight is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has seven children. Five of her children are currently in school.  Naight has small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for over 10 years.  She owns rental houses as her second business. 

To help expand her business, Naight has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Naight hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Naight hopes to expand her business. Naight is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Angel Klever

texts.es:
Angel de 47 años empezó con reparaciones de motocicletas y como sus clientes le sugerian que venda los repuestos de los mismos se animó y así lo hizo. Con su esposa atiende el local desde las 8h00 hasta las noche. Le satisface el poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus dos hijos de 2 y 17 años por los que lucha cada dia. El vende bujias, llantas, aros etc. El vive en una zona periurbana( perimetral)en la que los caminos aun son de tierra. 
Está tramitando un préstamo para comprar repuestos para incrementar la mercaderia de su negocio y con los ingresos y utilidades adecuar mejor su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ángel, 47, started out repairing motorcycles and since his customers recommended that he sell parts for them he was encouraged to do so.  He tends to his shop daily with his wife from 8am until night. 

It pleases him to be able to satisfy his children’s needs.  They are 2 and 17 years old and he strives for them daily.  

He sells spark plugs, tires, rims, etc.  He lives in a periurban zone (beltway) where the roads are still unpaved.  He is negotiating a loan to buy replacement parts and to increase stock merchandise in his business and to use income and profits to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy parts and tools.

loans.name: Ruth Idania

texts.es:
Ruth, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 5, 6 y 8 años de edad, ella administra una joyería, ofrece a los clientes oro y plata, además repara prendas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra joyas como cadenas, aretes, anillos, pulseras, estos productos son los necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes, ya que las joyas son el objetivo del negocio.
El objetivo de ella es tener otras sucursales, surtidas del producto, también mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth lives with her husband and her three children aged 5, 6 and 8.  She runs a jewelry store where she sells her customers gold and silver jewelry and also repairs jewelry.

Ruth is requesting this loan to buy jewelry such as chains, earrings, rings and bracelets.  She needs these products to sell to her customers as jewelry is the aim of her business.

Ruth's goal is to own other well-stocked branches and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items such as chains, earrings, rings and bracelets

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena cooks Konkonte, a powdered cassava that has been prepared in a Banku form.  It is normally served with groundnut soup.  She has been in this business for about two and a half years.  

Mena is married and lives with her husband.  

Her loan will be used to buy cassava to process into powder for the preparing of Konkonte. She plans to reinvest the profit into her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava to process into powder for the Konkonte.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school.  The other one is too young for school. Her husband is a matatu driver and helps provide for the family's basic needs. Mariamu lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and business premises rent.

She has operated a vegetable and fruits stall for the past year.  Her customers are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where the demand is high during the end of the month. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, pasteles y refrescos, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 28 años de edad, ella se dedica al negocio desde hace 4 años, todos los días realiza las ventas y trabaja de las 3:00pm en adelante.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gas, quesillo, aceite, estos productos son utilizados a diario para la preparación de las pupusas y pasteles, esta será una gran ayuda para mantener todo lo necesario para preparar los productos.
Su aspiración es que el negocio crezca, apoyar a su familia y ser una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Ana sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), "pasteles" (fried meat pies), and soft drinks.  She is a single mother with a 28-year-old daughter.  She has had her business for four years, and she sells and works every day from 3 p.m. on.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy corn, gas, soft cheese, and oil.  These products are used daily to make pupusas and pasteles.  This will be a great help to have all the necessities to make the dishes.

Her goal is for the business to grow, to support her family, and to be a good customer.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, soft cheese, and oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive con su hijo. Ella posee un comedor y pupuseria es muy conocida en la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues los platillos que prepara en su negocio son exquisitos, cocina de todo tipo de comidas sopas, carnes con arroz, ensaladas, pupusas entre otros y todo lo vende a precios accesibles además el lugar es muy higiénico; Elizabeth es una mujer amante de la cocina por eso le encanta su trabajo, para ella el secreto del éxito está en el amor que le pones a tu labor, quiere alcanzar varias metas y una de ellas es hacer crecer el negocio, por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, carnes, granos básicos, verduras, bebidas entre otros. Elizabeth tiene fe que con su duro trabajo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 58, lives with her son.  She has an eatery and pupusa shop that’s very well known in her community.  She’s acquired quite a few customers because the dishes she prepares at her business are exquisite.  She cooks all sorts of dishes: soups, meats with rice, salads and pupusas, among others.  She sells everything at affordable prices and her place is very hygienic.  Elizabeth loves cooking so she thoroughly enjoys her work.  For her, the secret of success is in the love one puts into work.  She wants to reach several goals.  One of them is to make the business grow so she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fried pork, cheese, meats, basic grains, vegetables and soft-drinks, among others.  Elizabeth has faith that with hard work she will accomplish providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, meats, basic grains, beverages and vegetables.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and father of two children.

Karim has owned a shop since 2008, selling old and used electrical items, clothing and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2100 in order to build an outdoor ceiling, advertising board and to increase inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, advertising board and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident and farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with 3 children aged between 15 and 2 years. He has been farming for 8 years and produces milk, tomatoes, and eggs for the local market with the help of one farmhand on his farm.

Charles has requested a loan of 46,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his milk production and income and in turn make the needs of his family a possibility. He also wants to venture into cereal processing in the local market for more income, as well as increase his stock of dairy cows to five.

He sees the frequent occurrences of diseases as the main undoing in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Moka Olie Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Moka Olie Group in Western Kenya! Concalata is the facilitator of the Moka Olie group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Concalata takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Concalata had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Concalata was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Concalata and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Concalata will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Moka Olie group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Naadgai

texts.en: Naadgai is 69 years old and lives with her daughter, a nurse, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Naadgai started her business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her products are stylish, high quality and relatively cheap. Her business income has, however, remained the same ever since she started her business, so she has just rented another counter in the market. She doesn't have enough inventory to supply another counter; therefore, she's requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 31 years old and has 3 children aged 6 months to 10 years.  She also adopted another child whom she cares for. She sells sorghum in a shop she has run for 5 years. Olive would like a loan to buy more sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She would like to one day own a cow to provide nutrition for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married mother of two and owns a salon which has been in operation for three years. She lives in Kongowea, Kenya. Julia joined Milango to access credit. 

She is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase beauty products in order to open another salon.

Her main challenge is the high cost of products. She will save the income obtained from this loan in order to build her house, to cut the cost on paying for house rent.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité "Primavera" esta en 2º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, esta integrada por 21 señoras. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad en el grupo para llegar al nivel máximo. Muchas señoras lograron iniciar y aumentar sus actividades, gracias a la oportunidad brindada y mediante la confianza.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cynthia, quien nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y cuenta que le va muy bien, por que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, lo que leo trae muy buenos ingresos. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande donde poder ofrecer la leche que vende.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación para la compra de leche y de esa forma poder abastecerse y tener para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" ("Spring") is in its second year of the program of communal banks of female entrepreneurs, and it is composed of 21 women.  The goal of the entrepreneurs is teamwork, fostering the spirit of solidarity, and maintaining group unity in order to reach the highest level.  Many women were able to create or improve their business, thanks to the opportunity provided and through trust.

One of the members is Cynthia, who tells us that she works every day beginning very early in the morning.  She sells milk, and she tells us that the business is going well because she already has many customers, which brings her a good income.  Her dream is to be able to have a big business where she can offer the milk that she sells.  

She requests help from Kiva and from the Foundation to buy milk, stock up, and, in doing so, meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Kotognokontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  KOTOGNOKONTALA 4sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NAGALA un des villages de Dogo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  GNINE, 1ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  NAGALA après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old, single with one child.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, candies, bread and other snack foods.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from food vending and buy and sell jewelries.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, candies, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo has 10 years experience repairing all kinds of shoes, sewing suitcases, bags and anything made of leather. He learned this trade with a friend when he was 17 years old. He worked for him for 3 years, then he switched to work for a company for 5 years. Later on, Eduardo couldn’t find a job so he ventured back to his old activity as a shoe repairer with a friend, and little by little he became more independent, got married and his shoe repairing skills is what he has been using to support his household.

Eduardo rents a place and his business is open 7 days a week, from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. His children help him when he has to run some errands. With the income from his business, he has been able to support his family and have a house – his most precious possession.

He would like to take a loan because his clients are asking him for new shoes and he doesn’t have the capital needed to buy the material for the shoes nor to exhibit his products. He has a demand for what he could offer and believes that he will do very well.

Eduardo is 37 years old, has 5 kids and has been separated from his wife for a couple of years now; they intend to get back together, but at the moment he is in charge of their children. Presently, they are helping each other; they have their own house and they are remodeling it.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 10 años de experiencia reparando todo tipo de calzado; también cose maletas, bolsos todo lo que es de cuero. Aprendió esta actividad con un amigo cuando tenía 17 años y trabajó para él 3 años. Luego se cambió de línea de trabajo y estuvo 5 años en una empresa. Como después no pudo encontrar trabajo, volvió a su oficio anterior (zapatero) con un amigo y poco a poco se fue independizando, se casó y eso le ha servido para sostener su hogar.

El alquila un local y atiende todos los días de la semana de 8:00 AM hasta 8:00 PM y sus hijos le ayudan cuando él tiene que salir. Con los ingresos generados del negocio él ha podido sostener la familia y tener su casa, que es su bien más preciado.

Eduardo desea el préstamo porque los clientes le piden zapatillas nuevas y él no tiene un capital para poder comprar el material y exhibir sus productos, tiene demanda y siente que le va a ir muy bien.

Eduardo tiene 37 años, tiene 5 hijos, con su esposa están separados ya un par de años; esperan volver, pero por el momento él está a cargo de sus hijos. Actualmente ellos se ayudan mutuamente, tienen casa propia y la están remodelando.

loans.use: Compra de cuero y adornos

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells a variety of fruits such as oranges, pineapples, apples, grapes, etc. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to enable her buy enough fruits for sale.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Malomon

texts.fr:
Born in 1953 in Aklakou, Malomon F. still lives in the same village with her family. With four children, she became a widow ten years ago. Since then, she has applied herself to weaving mats, using traditional methods, making on average two to three mats per week. Her very popular mats are sold, after being woven, to customers from the city. In order to increase her mat production, she wants to stock up on more adapted materials. For this reason she asks for a loan of $900. The realization of this project will allow her to have a consistent and permanent income to meet her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1953 à Aklakou, Mme F. Malomon réside aujourd’hui dans le même village avec sa famille. Avec quatre enfants, elle est devenue veuve il y a 10 ans. Depuis lors, elle s’est donnée au tressage de nattes qu’elle fait de façon traditionnelle avec en moyenne deux à trois nattes par semaine. Les nattes très appréciées sont commercialisées après tressage aux clients venus de la ville. Pour accroître sa production de natte, elle a voulu s’équiper en matériels plus adaptés. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit de $900. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir un revenu consistant et permanent pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia A. Orihuela, divorced and mother of three children, makes wedding gowns and gala dresses to earn a living for her family. She is the owner of a boutique located in the 16 de Julio area of El Alto, where she exposes and sells her creations, according to the occasion. During the last national holidays, for instance, she made school uniforms, parade costumes and gowns for local schools promotion celebrations. Silvia is presently in need of money to invest in the acquisition of equipment, like an overlock machine that would allow her to start working with lycra fabrics, satisfying thus the demands of her clients and generating a better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia A. Orihuela, divorciada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la confección de vestidos de novia y de gala, para la subsistencia de su familia. Es dueña de una boutique en la zona 16 de Julio de El Alto, en la que vende y expone sus trabajos, los que vende según la temporada. Por ejemplo, en estas últimas fiestas patrias, realizó la confección de uniformes escolares, trajes de desfile y trajes para promociones de colegios de la zona. Actualmente Silvia precisa de dinero para poder invertir en la compra de maquinaria para confección, como por ejemplo una máquina Overlock, para poder comenzar el trabajo en telas licradas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con el objetivo de generar mejores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: purchase of production equipment (such as an overlock machine)

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is a young, 29 year-old woman who is married with five children. Two of her children are in secondary school and the others are in primary school. She runs a small hotel in Kayunga, Uganda and has been in business for seven years.

She is a very hard-working woman and a committed, trustworthy member of the Bwetyaba Development Group. Her first loan was for $175.00 USD and she did not have any problem paying it back on-time.

She is experiencing an increase in customers at her hotel. She would like to use the money from a new loan to buy additional furniture and hotel equipment. The community would also benefit from the tourism business that guests would generate from shopping and restaurant businesses.

loans.use: To buy more furniture and equipment for her hotel

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
The people that come to the market every day recognize Hermelinda as an excellent cook, and above all, a selfless mother. She prepares the dishes in her restaurant daily, thanks to the fact that she learned the secrets of cooking from her mother. This now lets her contribute to her family. She makes this effort to help her five children and to offer them well being through her work. Nevertheless, there are difficulties in their home because her 24-year-old son is an alcoholic, and as a mother, she is very worried and sad because she has tried to help him in many ways. But she is convinced that he needs professional help to free himself from this difficult illness. For this urgent reason, her wish is to expand and to fix up her restaurant properly so she can increase the number of clients so she can keep helping her children and start her son's treatment. Let's make this request possible so this sacrificing mother can enjoy the happiness of her 24-year-old son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Las personas que acuden al mercado diariamente, reconocen en Hermelinda a una excelente cocinera y sobretodo una abnegada madre, ella prepara los platos en su restaurante diariamente, gracias a que desde niña aprendió los secretos de cocina de su madre y ahora esto le permite contribuir con su familia.Realiza este esfuerzo para ayudar a sus cinco hijos a quienes les brinda bienestar a través de su ocupación; si embargo existen muchas dificultades en el hogar debido a que su hijo de 24 años es alcohólico y como madre está muy preocupada y triste porque ha tratado de ayudarlo de muchas formas pero está convencida que necesita ayuda profesional para liberarse de tan penosa enfermedad..Por esta urgente razón su deseo es ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su pequeño restaurante a fin de incrementar el número de clientes para que pueda seguir apoyando a sus hijos e iniciar el tratamiento de su hijo. Posibilitemos esta petición para que esta sacrificada madre pueda gozar la alegría de su joven hijo de 24 años.

loans.use: Improving her small restaurant to increase her sales and the comfort of her clients.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: My name is Rehana K., a resident of Lahore. My husband is a tailor and he creates readymade garments. I have three children, two girls and a boy. My elder daughter is studying in grade five and my son is in grade two. I need a loan of $250 to purchase a sewing machine and cloth for my husband’s garment business. I know that my children would be able to get better education if we are able to generate more income.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and cloth for the business

loans.name: Oyinade

texts.en: Oyinade W. is 40 years old, married with four children and lives in the town of Shibiri in Lagos state, Nigeria. Since 1997, she has helped support her family by selling food and drinks from a stall in a local market.  Oyinade has been a LAPO member for three years, and has requested a new loan of $450 to by more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Usumacinta 2 Group

texts.es:
Two years ago, Josefa started a small grocery store in her house, where she sells rice, sugar, oil, cookies, soft drinks, pasta, etc. With her loan, she will invest in purchasing more products to stock her store and thus be able to satisfy her clients. She is 48-years-old and has 4 children. She is a member of the Usumacinta 2 group. The other members are doña Dolores D. Pérez, who sells food; Rosa R. D. and Esperanza de Jesús C. R., who sell clothing; and Rosalinda C. R. and Manuela A. Pérez, who are seamstresses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

JOSEFA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS INSTALO EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE ARROZ, AZUCAR, ACEITE, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, PASTAS, ETC. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTOS PARA ABASTECER SU TIENDA Y DE ESTA FORMA PODER SATISFACER A SUS CLIENTES. ELLA TIENE 48 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS Y FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO USUMACINTA 2, JUNTO CON DOÑA DOLORES D. PÉREZ (VENTA DE COMIDA), ROSA R. D. Y ESPERANZA DE JESUS C. R. (VENTA DE ROPA), ROSALINDA C. R. Y MANUELA A. PÉREZ (COSTURERAS).

loans.use: Grocery store

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru:
Kahramon Shukuorv is 35 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Kahramon has a high school education. He has been purchasing and selling livestock for more than 8 years. He purchases and sells livestock at the local market, at neighboring markets and sometimes in Uzbekistan. He earns an additional income from farming where he also gets feed for his livestock.

Every year, in the spring, Kahramon sells his winter livestock and spends half the proceeds to purchase wheat seeds and the other half he spends on new livestock to fatten. Kahramon has a big yard for livestock and during the day he and his neighbors give their livestock to a shepherd that takes it out to feed in the fields and mountains of Shahristan. One head of livestock costs 1 somoni per day and the shepherd is responsible for the livestock. Kahramon and his family work in farming and he will use his loan to purchase a new type of feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шукуров Кахрамон Мардонкулович - 35 лет. Женат. 4 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент купле продажей скота занимается более 8 лет . Он покупает и продоет скот в рынках скота с в местном , соседних сел и иногда с респ. Узбекистан. Доплнительный доход получает от дехканства,откуда так же берет сухой корм для скота.Каждый год он весной продает зимний скот откормленный и половину денег он тратит на закупку зерна для посева -пшеницы и на остальную часть снова покупает скот на откорм.У нег дома есть большой двор для скота а днем он и все в его махале отдают скот пастуху и он весь день пасет их на полях и горах Шахристана. Одна голова скота стоит 1 сомони в день и он отвечает за сохранность скота. Кахрамон со всей соей семьёй трудиться по дехканскому хозайству и он хочет получить сумму на покупку нового вида корма для скота.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for livestock.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 50 years old and lives in Ticuantepe, an area outside Managua that is known for agricultural production. He lives with his wife, who works as a cook, and their son, who is pursuing his studies.

Francisco works in agriculture and fruit sales. For 19 years he has planted 2.5 manzanas (more than 4 acres) of pineapple. His experience has helped him improve his product. He is requesting a loan to buy the supplies his crops need to remain healthy. Because of the high cost of these products, he has always bought them using credit and, in doing so, has ensured a good harvest. The harvest in turn allows him to pay back the money he has borrowed.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Don Francisco de 50 años de edad, habita en Ticuantepe, un fresco lugar de características agrícolas, vive acompañado de su señora quien trabaja como cocinera, y un hijo quien aun se encuentra estudiando.

Don Francisco se dedica a la Agricultura y el comercio de frutas, siembra 2 ½ manzanas de piña desde hace 19 años, su gran experiencia le ha ayudado a ir mejorando su producto. Solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos que su cosecha necesita para mantenerse sana, por el alto costo de éstos siempre los ha comprado por medio de créditos y así ha garantizado su cosecha; y su cosecha a la vez garantiza el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain a healthy pineapple crop

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi L., 38 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. Before, her main activities were working on the rice field and breeding animals. After borrowing and saving money, she is able to buy a rice-husking machine. Her average income is 130 USD/month from husking the rice. Since buying the husking machine, Mr. Duc, her husband, does not have to work in Hanoi anymore. He now stays at home and helps her. This time she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy new motor and diesel engine to accommodate local people.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Lọc, 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc trước đây của chị Lọc là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Qua các vòng vốn chị đã tích cóp và mua được máy xát gạo. Trung bình một tháng chị Lọc thu 130USD từ dịch vụ xay xát. Từ khi có thêm việc, anh Đức, chồng chị không đi làm cửu vạn ở Hà Nội nữa mà ở nhà hỗ trợ vợ. Vòng vốn này chị Lọc đề nghị xin vay 575USD để đầu tư thay mô tơ mới và mua thêm máy nổ phục vụ bà con thôn xóm.

loans.use: Buy new motor and diesel engine

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha S., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokny S., who live about twenty kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one daughter.

Mr. Vutha S. has been motor taxi driver for a few months, while his wife Mrs. Sokny S. sells rice soup and Khmer noodles at the village market. Before he started this business, Vutha was a garment factory worker. His motorcycle is very old and is now broken so he needs some money to buy a new one. Vutha is requesting a loan for the amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one, so that he can continue  his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace his broken one

loans.name: La Nueva Luz (The New Light) Group 1

texts.en:
Jose has a small house in El Seibo and another in the countryside where he raises and milks cows. He currently has 6 cows. Jose sells their milk to local cheese makers. He lives with one son, although he has three in total, ages 21, 24, and 26. Jose is the proud grandfather of a six-year old little boy. Jose has only had a high school education and he really wants his children to be able to continue with their studies and go to college so that they can have professional careers.

Business can be hard because there is no electricity out in the country yet and he has to travel on dirt roads to and from his farm to sell the milk. Jose has successfully repaid 5 loans and is now requesting his 6th. With the loan money, he plans to buy more grain to feed his cows and also to invest it in agriculture on his farm.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: To buy more grain to feed his cows and to invest in agriculture on his farm.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji*, wife of M., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children who are too young to attend school.Shahnaz baji is a housewife who takes care of her children. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives his own auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle, similar to a "tuk-tuk"). Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She wants to buy another auto-rickshaw to increase their profits.

She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy groceries (wheat, rice, sugar) for her grocery shop. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy stock animals (cows, goats) for her meat business. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy ingredients for her food business. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her clothing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*"Baji," which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Bakhtawar

texts.en:
Bakhtawar baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. None of her children go to school. Bakhtawar baji's husband is a milk seller with thirty years of experience in the profession and a good reputation in the community. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Bakhtawar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
Sigifredo es casado y tiene 3 hijos: Carlos de 23 años, Annye de 15 años y Julio Daniel de 2 años. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. El inicio el negocio porque necesitaba contar con un empleo para poder sacara delante a su familia. Comenzó hace 6 años vendiendo abarrotes en su casa, al principio contaba con muy poca mercancía pero gracias a su esfuerzo logro establecer mejor su tienda y hacerse de clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Sigifredo is married and has 3 children: Carlos, 23 years old, Annye, 15 years old, and Julio Daniel, 2 years old. His wife helps him with the business. He started the business because he needed a job in order to push ahead for his family. 6 years ago he started selling general goods from his home. At first he had very little merchandise, but thanks to his efforts he succeeded in establishing a stronger store and clientele. He needs a loan of US $425, that he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and be able to respond to the needs of his clients. With your help he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 40 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos que estudian y su esposo quien la apoya incondicionalmente. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace un año atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, ya que ellos son el factor principal de su negocio. Esta bodega le es rentable porque es la única persona  en  su zona que vende estos productos. Lo difícil para ella, son los cambios climatológicos que afectan su negocio cuando llueve fuertemente, pues no tiene venta. Este es su préstamo nº 7. Con el dinero quiere acondicionar mejor el espacio de su tienda, para así ampliar su negocio y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives with her two children who study and her husband who supports her unconditionally. She has sold groceries and basic goods for a year. What she likes about her job is giving good care to her customers, since they are the main factor of her business. The winery is profitable because she is the only person in her neighborhood who sells these products. The difficult part for her is that climate changes affect her business when it rains heavily, and then she does not have sales. This is her seventh loan. With the money, she wants to acquire a better retail space to improve her business and provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and improve the location of her wine business

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento Loma Linda, está integrado por socias que viven en el barrio Loma Linda de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Actualmente esta en su 3 er cilco de crédito y está compuesto por 15 personas, Se fundo el 05 de Diciembre del 2007, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras,como presidenta tenemos a la señora Lidia M. R., la tesorera es la Sr Angelica L. Mejia y la Secretaria es la Sra. Adriana Apiransay S.; en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrote, Panaderia, y la mayoría tiene su tienda general. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias viernes a horas 15:00 PM en la Agencia Sur de Emprender. Las señoras estan conformes de trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar y a compartir con sus amigas cada 14 dias. El grupo en sus inicios Se conformo con con 12 personas de las cuales 2 se retiraron por motivos personales e ingresaron otras 5 nuevas y el grupo hasta la fecha ha sido muy cumplido.

La Sra Lidia M. R. es la Presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero, lleva 3 años con esa actividad; le dedica 8 horas al dia a su trabajo, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que todavia estan en la escuela. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo, ella es unas de las fundadoras y lider del grupo.

La Sra Angelica L. Mejia es la Tesorera del B.E. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y vende Ropa, tiene 4 años de antiguedad en este rubro, trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es realizado en su domicilio. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Tiene domicilio propio y vive hace 4 años en la zona, tiene 3 hijas que ya estan en la universidad y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en sustento del hogar.

La Sta. Adriana A. es la Secretaria, tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio y tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero su trabajo es mayormente en su domicilio, vive en alquiler y tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
The Banco de Emprendimiento Loma Linda (“Loma Linda Undertakings Bank”) consists of members who live in the Loma Linda neighborhood of the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. They are currently in their third loan cycle and have 15 members. The bank was founded on December 5, 2007 by a group of women which included the president, Mrs. Lidia M. R., the treasurer Mrs. Angelica L. Mejia, and the secretary Ms. Adriana A. S.. The women in the group work selling cosmetics, food, groceries and bread, and most of them have general stores. They meet on Fridays at 3:00pm at the Emprender South Agency. The women are happy to work with Emprender because they have learned to save money and are able to get together with their friends every two weeks. When the group was started, there were 12 people. Two of the members left for personal reasons, and then 5 more members joined, and the group until now has been fulfilled.

Mrs. Lidia M. R. is the president of the group, and works making homemade bread. She has done this work for three years and works 8 hours a day. She has 3 children who are all still in school. She is a very responsible woman and is fulfilled in the group, and she is one of the founders and the leader of the group.

Mrs. Angelica L. Mejia is the treasurer of the Banco de Emprendimiento. She has a grocery store in her home and sells clothing. She has 4 years of experience in this trade and works 6 days a week and 8 hours a day from her home. She is also very responsible and fulfilled in the group. She has her own home and has lived in the neighborhood for 4 years. She has three children who are studying at the university and the income she receives helps maintain her household.

Ms. Adriana A. is the secretary and has a small store in her home. She makes homemade bread and for the most part works from home. She rents her home and also studies at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang O. is 30 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, where she earns a living by selling Khmer fritters to her neighbors, since 1988. She can earn around of $5 each day to support her family's expenses. She is married and has six children, five of whom are single, and one is married. Three of her daughters are employed as garment workers, and they currently get a salary of $240 a month to help meet the family's needs, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Lang O. needs for her son to have a job, thus she would like to apply for a loan to purchase fishing tools such as nets, traps, and a fish boat for her son to begin a new business as a fisherman.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
GLADYS D. A. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en el Jr. Cajamarca N° 148 D. Distrito de Callería tiene 49 años de edad, 05 hijos, su esposo es chofer.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró maderas cortas de cedro y caoba, confeccionó colgadores de ropa, cuadros, repisas para adornos de diferentes tamaños, su esposo le ayudaba en sus momentos de descanso.

Con el desembolso que recibió de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, compró madera como cedro y caoba, laca, 01 balde, clavos de 1”, 1 ½”, 2”, 2 ½”, sin cabeza un kg., de cada uno, cola 1 kg., lijas de todos las medidas para confeccionar roperos, colgadores, diferentes adornos.

Está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Gladys D. A. P. belongs to the "Women Leaders" Community Bank, located in the Callería neighborhood. She is 49 years old, has 5 children, and her husband is a driver. The first loan that Gladys received was for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles, which she used to buy cedar and mahogany wood to create clothes hangers, picture frames, and shelves of different sizes. Her husband helped her in his free time. With this disbursement of S/.1,800.00 Peruvian Soles, she will buy cedar and mahogany wood, lacquer, a pail, 1 kg of 1", 1.5", 2" and 2.5" nails, and sanding sheets of all sizes to create dressers, hangers, and different adornments. Gladys is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, a Kiva Partner, for believing in her.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cedar and mahogany wood, lacquer, a pail, 1 kg of 1", 1.5", 2" and 2.5" nails, and sanding sheets of all sizes to create dressers, hangers, and different adornments

loans.name: Sugran Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a 46-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 5 years. Sugran baji is the wife of Mr. Z. I. who has been a cloth merchant for the past 15 years. He buys cloth from the city called Multan and sells it in his native city, Pakpattan. Sugran baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which is located near their house.

Sugran baji is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes to pay the school fees for her kids because her husband pays all the household expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more cloth to expand her husband’s cloth-selling business. She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy material (razors and chairs) for her salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for their  business

loans.name: Viviencia

texts.en:
Vivencia C., even at the age of 66, still struggles to earn a living to provide for the needs of her family. For 30 years she has sold assorted grocery items in their barangay (a Filipino term for a village, district or ward) of Valderama, Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. Her husband is in farming with no fixed income. Her variety store is their primary source of income for the family.

She is grateful to HSPFI for the financial assistance extended to her in the amount PHP10000 to sustain her project. The business responded well and she was able to provide their family's basic needs. She hopes that she would be able to increase the stock of her variety store so that her income would also increase.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Josefa De La Cruz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Josefa de la Cruz M. con gran ahínco se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación donde atiende muy alegremente. 

El motive por el cual ella acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima ya que debe a lo inmediato obtenerlo para así elaborar las tortillas y venderlas en su localidad.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua's capital city of Managua, Josefa de la Cruz M. works with great effort making and selling tortillas. She has her own establishment in her house, where she works very happily. She came to Ceprodel is to procure a loan for the purchase of raw materials, which she needs to make and sell tortillas in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is a 42-year-old  widow with five children. She makes a living selling fresh tomatoes and peppers to her customers. She has applied for a loan to buy more fresh tomatoes and peppers to sell. Ramota thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more fresh tomatoes and peppers.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en:
Felicia L. is a group coordinator for the group called “Mujeres Victoriosas,” which means “Victorious Women.”  Felicia is the owner of a business selling clothing in her local community.  Felicia has four grown children and four grandchildren—three of which live with her.  Felicia’s dream for her business is that of all entrepreneurs: to grow.  She hopes to earn enough profit to provide a better life for her grandchildren and to support them in their studies.  Along with her grandchildren, Felicia lives with her partner, Luis Emilio.  In her free time, Felicia enjoys reading the Bible and biographies as well as swimming in the river that is by her house.

After hearing about Esperanza from a friend, Felicia decided to take out her first loan because of the good testimony she heard.  Felicia wants to thank Kiva lenders for this opportunity and said she wants to develop and grow through this experience. 

On behalf of Felicia L., Mujeres Victoriosas, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thanks for your support!

loans.use: To replenish her stock

loans.name: Girlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Girlyn S., a wife and a mother of 2 children, has a sari-sari store in her village. With the help of her husband, who is an employee of a small entrepreneurial company, they manage to make their small business grow. They cater to the needs of neighbors and new customers. 

Girlyn is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 for additional capital. She and her husband dream of making their business successful.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Name : Jorge T.
Internal Client ID : 18559
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity: HABITACAO
 Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription

Jorge T., de 55 anos de idade, nasceu na cidade vizinha da Matola, casado e pai de 3 filhos menores de 18 anos. Estudou ate quinta classe, tendo terminado devido à insuficiência financeira dos seus pais. Vive com sua mãe idosa na mesma casa.
Funcionário Publica como servente no Instituto Agrário de Boane a mais de 12 anos onde tem como salário mensal no valor de 2.650,00MT. Consegue suportar os encargos familiares e ainda poupar um pouco para momentos de crise.

Já teve outros créditos com outras instituições de credito que operam no distrincia tendo solicitado o primeiro de 2.000,00MT e o segundo no valor de 3.000,00MT. em grupo solidário.
Diz ter tomado conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema logo depois de abrir seus escritórios neste ponto da província do maputo, através dos seus colegas e amigos. Com a hluvuku gosta da metodologia individual que lhe possibilita empréstimos de valores, relativamente, maiores. 
Já levantou o primeiro no valor de 5.200,00MT, o segundo de 7.800,00MT. Esta é a seu terceiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com KIVA, no valor de 10.000,00MT.
Esta construindo a sua casa em fases e pretende terminar num futuro breve para poder materializar o sonho de construir uma mini loja de produtos diversos.
texts.en:
Jorge T. is 55 years old, was born in a city that neighbors Boane called Matola, is married and is the father of three children under the age of 18. He studied through the 5th grade but had to stop as his parents could not continue to afford the costs of his studies. His elderly mother lives with his family. Jorge is a civil servant that has worked at the Boane Institute of Agriculture for the past 12 years where he receives a monthly salary of 2,650.00MT. With his salary he is able to support his family and save a little bit to use in times of crisis. Jorge has received loans from other institutions that operate in the area. The first loan was for 2,000.00MT and the second was for 3,000.00MT and were both taken out as group loans. He says that he first learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through colleagues and friends after he opened offices in this part of the Maputo province. He likes Hluvuku-Adsema because he can take out personal loans (as opposed to group loans) of relatively larger amounts. He has previously taken out loans of 5,200.00 MT and 7,800.00MT. This will be his third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema and his first with Kiva with the amount being 10,000.00MT. Jorge is building his house in phases and hopes to complete construction soon so that he can realize his dream of opening a mini market with various products.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rc Primary School, Pamlap Group

texts.en:
These are the teachers of the RC Primary School in Pamlap village, which is located on the outskirts of Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. RC Primary School was built during the 1973/74 academic year by the local community with help from the Catholic Church, and has a total of 14 staff members and 546 pupils. 

RC Primary School, like many other schools in this country, lacks adequate teaching and learning materials and is very short on accommodations. Despite that, its students do well in National Primary School Examinations. The school has also recently linked up with an English school as part of an exchange program, and organizes annual athletics events for its pupils.

Mosses A. K. (below, second from left) is the head master at the school. He was born in Yele, in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has eight children. One of his children is grown, two are in college, two are in secondary schools and three in primary schools. Mosses has been a teacher for 44 years, and plans to use this loan to pay school fees for his children. “This loan is very big help,” he told me. “It is not easy to get someone to give you a loan in Sierra Leone, and teachers’ salaries are small,” he added. "If I can secure this loan, it will be a big relief for me."

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 26, 17 y 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 26 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, teniendo como productos principales a la papa, el trigo, la cebada, las habas y la linaza, las cuales vende directamente en los principales mercados de su ciudad. De esta manera logra ver los resultados de su arduo trabajo y el de toda su familia. Maria siempre almacena parte de su cosecha para el consumo familiar y la crianza de sus animales menores, como los cuyes que le sirven de alimento. Por eso le es indispensable  administrar bien sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos que tienen, tanto en la educación de sus hijos, como en el pago de sus cuentas. Con esta actividad como fuente primordial de ingresos, se proyectan hacia el futuro para la extensión de sus terrenos agrícolas. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, ella es una socias muy activas en su banco comunal y siempre se compromete en las tareas necesarias para que su grupo salga adelante. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado al pago los sacos de abono que solicitó en crédito para su última siembra.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children (ages 26, 17 and 14). She has been farming for 26 years, growing primarily potatoes, wheat, barley, beans and flax. She sells her harvested products in the major markets in her area. Each season, she can see the results of her hard work and that of her entire family. Maria saves a portion of her harvest for family consumption, and she also raises small animals (such as guinea pigs) for food. It is essential that she manages her income well so that she can cover her living expenses and pay for her children’s education. Since this is her primary source of revenue, she hopes to acquire more land to expand her farm.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with MFP. She is a very active member of her communal bank and always undertakes the tasks necessary for her group to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the sacks of fertilizers she acquired on credit from the previous harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the sacks of fertilizer she bought on credit

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is a 36-year-old resident of Guintubdan, Brgy. Ara-al, La Castellana, Negros Occidental, who is married with two school-age children and earns a living by operating a convenience store.

When Elizabeth started her business, she just sold coffee and snacks to her neighbors. She then expanded it into a "carinderia" - a small eatery that sold cooked food to her neighbors. After she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 she used her loans to improve her business, expanding her operations to sell groceries and other goods that her neighbors might need - almost like a 7/11 store.

Elizabeth also used the loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon to improve the construction of her store which was originally built from bamboo and other light materials. She slowly reinforced the building using hollow blocks and cement for a more permanent structure. The income from her business enables her to continue fixing and improving her house as well as pay for the education of her two young children.

Now on her 15th loan, Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can restock her convenience store and have more working capital to use in her eatery business.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital in her expanding business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 62-year-old married man and father of four children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1970 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. After this long experience, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a new car in order to continue his work.

loans.use: Buy a new car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de poisson

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida E. sells groceries like milk Milo sugar ECT at Elmina near Terterim.  Vida has received senior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a plumber. Vida has been selling groceries since 2005. She supports the husband in the house keeping. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Las Divninas De Chalco Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Angelica vive en Valle de Chalco Solidaridad en el Estado de México que es una zona semiurbana, tiene  24 años es casada y esta en espera de su primer bebe lo cual espera con ansias por lo que en este momento tambien le ocasiona una preocupacion por los gastos que ha de tener y no poder cubrirlos,  en alguna ocasion ella trabajo como costurera y su inquietud es comprar una maquina de coser y elaborar prendas para venderlas y generar ingresos que le ayudara a cubrir las necesidades basicas para su bebe y asi  no descuidar la atencion para su bebe y su esposo por esta razon solicita un credito atravez de Fundacion Realidad por lo que se reune con varios vecinos de su comunidad y forman el grupo Las Divinas de Chalco.

Doramaria G. D.:   Compra de baterias de cocina, vajillas y licuadoras
Paulina Angelica R. M.:  compra de una maquina de coser (es la segunda persona de izquierda a derecha)
Miriam R. G.: Compra de cosmeticos y fragancias
Luz Gabriela M. E.: Tiene una taqueria
Maria del Socorro D. R.: Compra de dulces
Veronica Natalia R. G.: Compra de  lenceria 
Maria Esther G. D.:  Compra de cosmeticos, fragancias  y tratamiento fragancias
Teresa G. H.: Compra de cosmeticos, lociones y ropa por catalogo 
Martha Guadalupe Rodrigues H.: Compra de una una maquina de coser 
Ceferino Javier R. H.: Compra de material para construccion 
Angelina E. L.: Compra de una maquina de coser
texts.en:
Paulina Angelica lives in the semiurban municipality of Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, located in Mexico State, Mexico. She is 24, married, and expecting her first baby. Her pregnancy causes her some anxiety due to her preoccupation with the expenses she has and is not able to cover. She has worked as a seamstress and would like to buy a sewing machine to make clothing items to sell. This would allow her to generate income to help her to cover basic necessities for her baby without neglecting her baby and husband. For this reason she is seeking a loan through Kiva field partner Fundacion Realidad ("Reality Foundation") in conjunction with various neighbors from her community who together form the group Las Divinas de Chalco. Doramaria: Purchase of pots and pans, dishes, and a blender. Paulina Angelica: Purchase of a sewing machine (the second person in the photo, left to right). Miriam: Purchase of cosmetics and fragrances. Luz Gabriela: Funds for running a taco stand. Maria: Purchase of sweets. Veronica Natalia: Purchase of lingerie. Maria Esther: Purchase of cosmetics, fragrances and aromatherapy treatments. Teresa: Purchase of cosmetics, lotions and catalog clothing. Martha Guadalupe: Purchase of a sewing machine. Ceferino Javier: Purchase of construction materials. Angelina: Purchase of a sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una maquina de coser

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Talata

texts.en:
Talata is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family.

Talata is a trader. She sells all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Talata has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Flores” esta representado por la señora Carmen Rosa  y conformado por 13 miembros de gente trabajadora y capaz, todas cuentan con negocio propio la mayoría se dedica a vender productos cosméticos, otras venden comida, otras como la presidenta se dedica a el servicio de estilismo a domicilio y algunas a la venta de flores. La competencia en estos días esta mas difícil por la misma situación del país por lo que las socias deben esforzarse mas para llevar el pan de cada día a sus hogares. El  crédito esta destinado a adquirir más ebriedad de productos y para aumentar sus herramientas para un trabajo más eficiente. Su expectativa para el futuro es mejorar en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias. Algunas ya tienen experiencia con este tipo de créditos otras están conociendo por primera vez la modalidad de grupos solidarios pero se encuentran entusiasmadas por trabajar juntas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Las Flores Group, represented by Ms. Carmen Rosa, is comprised of 13 hard-working and capable members. They all run their own businesses. The majority sells cosmetics, but others sell fast food. Other members, like the president, provide in-home hair styling services, while others sell flowers. Competition is stiffer these days because of the situation that the country is in, which is why the group members have to work harder to bring home the daily bread. The loan will be used to obtain a greater variety of products and to increase their work tools so that the group members can do their job more efficiently. Their hope for the future is to improve their businesses and provide a better quality of life for themselves and their families. Some of the members have experience with these types of loans, while others are learning to work in solidarity groups for the first time. However, they are all very enthusiastic about working together to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Excel Group

texts.en: Regina is married with a child. She is 48 years old. Her child is currently in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. Regina is leader of a trust group called Excel and a food vendor. She sells kenkey. The members of the group are mostly food vendors and traders. They buy their stock from the big markets in Accra and sell at the market square in their community. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen de ella y cuenta con estudios secunadrios completos.
Norma trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y además a la venta de queso, chuño, papa, etc.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró animales: chanchos y ovejas.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en un viaje a Arequipa en donde venderá chuño,papas y otros.
Su visión hacia el futuro es mejorar su calidad de vida y progresar cada vez más.
Lo que màs le gusta de su banco comunal son las reuniones, las charla y el préstamo que la salvò de algunos apuros.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in the Pilcuyo district of the El Collao province. She is a 31-year-old married woman, has 3 children who depend on her and has completed her secondary school studies. Norma has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years; she works in the business of buying and selling cattle as well as cheese, "chuño" (a type of dried potato), potatoes, etc. She tells us that she bought animals--pigs and sheep--with her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles. She is requesting a loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, which she will invest in a trip to Arequipa where she will sell chuño and potatoes among other things. Her future goal is to improve her quality of life and make even more progress. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings, chats and the loan that got her out of a tight spot.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chuño, potatos, cheese

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: F. Fati has an auto repair business. At this moment, you can see in the picture how Fati repairs the inside of this car. He has been in this business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his auto repair business. Fati is 27 years old. He is single. He lives in Fuzuli region.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a vegetable farm; after harvest, she takes the vegetables to the market to sell to vegetable sellers. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.
