loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 25 years old and is single. She is a hardworking businesswoman running a dry cleaners and has been in this business for about three years. She employs four people from her community and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Odette, after those three years of experience in preparing (washing, drying, etc.) clothes of her customers, is still missing some equipment like a dryer to replace the old one. She also needs to buy some other materials to use in her business. To this end, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.

With this loan, she hopes to improve the service to her customers as well as to earn more profits. These profits will allow her to build her future and help some family members who are in need.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S., age 42, is pictured with her husband, Mr. Sokhom Cheng, age 50. They have been married since 1985 and have five children: four daughters and one son. One of their children is married, three attend school, and the other one helps on the family farm. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sok and her husband have been farming for almost ten years. They grow many kinds of vegetables such as salad greens and cauliflower on the farm near their house. Sok is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build a concrete room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete room under her wooden house

loans.name: Douglas Ignacio

texts.es:
En municipio de Nagarote, el señor Douglas C. es propietario de una pulpería que atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, es una persona trabajadora dedicada a su negocio.
Está solicitando el crédito para compra de los productos de la pulpería como: granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, café, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. Con este crédito logrará obtener mayores ventas y utilidades para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Douglas C. has a grocery store in Nagarote. He is open for business from 6am until 6pm; he is a hard-working, dedicated person. He is requesting funding to buy stock items for the store like: basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, coffee, toilet paper, among other products. This loan will make it possible for him to increase his sales and profits for his family's support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Petrona María

texts.es:
Petrona M. tiene 62 años y viven en la Urbanización La Playa de Barranquilla con su hija de 23 años; ella siempre ha sido una mujer negociante,  hace quince años inició su negocio de preparaciòn de alimentos con harina de trigo como empanaditas, deditos; un tipo de pasaboca frita, enrollados en diferentes formas; con los años agregó otros negocios como venta de mercancias  mediante guías especializadas  de productos empresariales; hace siete años adicionò la venta de calzado y el negocio de comidas rápidas hace tres. Últimamente Petrona ha decidido dejar su negocio de pasabocas porque el calor le empezó a afectar sus  manos. Ahora se dedica a los refuerzos académicos de niños y al hospedaje de personas que vienen de otras ciudades a estudiar en Barranquilla.
Su oficio de refuerzo  escolar  de niños, lo realiza de 2 a 6 de la tarde cuando salen de la  escuela, en esta actividad participa su hija. Como tiene una casa propia, la arrienda a estudiantes de otras partes, así que este pensionado es otra fuente de ingresos para ella y su hija. Ahora solicita un crédito con la Fundación por valor de $1.000.000 para hacer inversiones en este negocio especificamente adecuaciones locativas: va a rellenar el patio con el fin de adecuar el desague de lluvias, plantillar el piso, instalar el lavadero de ropas y comprar la canaleta.  
Petrona está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace cinco años y en esta temporada ha tenido siete préstamos, siente que con ellos pudo educar a su hija como ingeniera de sistemas  y que la posibilidad de estudiar esta carrera sucedió a través de la Fundación. A pesar de los desafíos que ha experimentado junto a su hija, como las temporadas de ventas bajas y las limitaciones de su capacidad física y de tiempo, porque viven solas, ha podido seguir adelante y ahora sueña con terminar su vivienda y con tener ingresos que le generen mucha estabilidad en todo sentido.
texts.en:
Petrona M., 62, with her 23-year-old daughter, lives in Urbanización La Playa, Barranquilla. She has always been a merchant and 15 years ago she started a prepared meals business based on wheat-flour items like: empanaditas (little turnovers, deditos (a type of fried snack), and various types of rolls. As time went by, she added other commercial activities, like catalogue merchandise sales. Seven years ago she added shoe sales. With her fast-food business, she now has a total of three. Recently, Petrona decided to abandon her fast-food business because the heat started to affect her hands. Now she is involved in tutoring children and to provide room and board for persons who come from other cities to study in Barranquilla. Her school children tutoring services are from 2-6pm when they get out of school; her daughter participates in this activity. Since she owns her own home, she can rent space to students from other places and this room and board service is an additional source of income for her and her daughter. She is asking the foundation for a loan, valued at $1.000.000, to invest in this last commercial activity; specifically, to make home improvements. She will fill in the patio in order to redirect rainwater drainage, install flooring and a wash stand for laundry and will purchase gutters. Petrona has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 5 years and has had 7 loans during this time frame. She feels that they have made it possible for her to pay for her daughter’s education as a Systems Engineer and that her being able to study this career was due to the foundation’s help. Despite the challenges she and her daughter have faced, like times of low sales and the physical and time limitations they have because they live alone, she has managed to get ahead and now dreams with finishing her house and having income that will provide her with much stability in every sense of the word.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fill in her patio, redirect rain gutters, install flooring, buy gutters and install a wash stand.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: LUIS ES UN CLIENTE QUE CUENTA CON UN SALÓN DE BELLEZA,  TRABAJA EN EL MISMO LOCAL  HACE 06 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO NO CUENTA CON CARGA FAMILIAR VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, NO TRABAJA CON NINGUNA OTRA ENTIDAD FINANCIERA, SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SUS PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA Y ASI AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO YA QUE POR EL BUEN TRABAJO QUE REALIZA  Y EL BUEN SERVICO QUE BRINDA SU CLIENTELA VIENE AUMENTANDO Y NECESITA MAYORES PRODUCTOS PARA PODER OFRECERLES Y PODERLES BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO, EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS, MUESTRA VOLUNTAD Y CAPACIDAD DE PAGO, POR LO QUE SE LE PROPONE EL PRESENTE CRÉDITO.
texts.en:
Luis has had a beauty salon for the past 6 years. He is single and has no children to support; he lives with his parents and does not receive help from any other financial institution. He is asking for funds to buy more beauty products and supplies in order to increase his business since the good quality of work and customer service he is known for has increased his customer base and he needs more products to provide them with proper services. He has good references from residents in his area; he shows capacity and willingness to repay. Therefore, the current loan is proposed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Accion Group

texts.es:
Los socios de Alcancia Comunal Fuerza y acción se dedican a labores de, comercio y producción minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD hace varios años.
Lidia trabaja en el Mercado Central de Lima vende diferentes productos como: Cds, videos Dvd películas al por mayor y menor, con las  ganancias obtenidas puede aportar en casa además desea construir su vivienda para su mayor comodidad, los hijos apoyan a Lidia. 
Dionicia vende productos de belleza por catalogo, esto le ha permitido algunos beneficios ya que mediante las ventas recibe regalos, joyas, y productos del catalogo que ella lo puede vender y generar mayores ganancias para su familia.
Por las noches Marlene se dedica a la venta de comida  como: salchipapas, hamburguesas, pollo broaster, hace 1 año tiene un puesto propio, lugar donde es muy conocida, pero desea emprender un nuevo negocio de día. Con el préstamo otorgado comprara algunos insumos que le falta para sus ventas. Todo este esfuerzo es por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Fuerza y Acción" (Force and Action) communal bank work in retail trade and production. They have worked with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for several years. Lidia works in the Central Market of Lima selling different products such as cds, videos and dvds of films both wholesale and retail. With the profits she earns she can contribute at home. In addition she wants to build a home that is more comfortable. Her children support Lidia. Dionicia sells beauty products from a catalogue. This has given her some benefits as through the sales she receives gifts, jewelry, and products from the catalogue that she can sell and generate greater profits her family. In the evenings Marlene sells food such as: salchipapas (sausage and fries), hamburgers and broaster chicken. She has had her own stall for 1 year, a place which is very well known, but she wants to launch a new daytime business. With the loan she will buy some consumables that she needs for her sales. All this effort is for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La joven Ana es madre soltera de tres  hijos. De edad de 29 año, pues ha sido difícil su situación económica pues solo su mama la apoyado siempre.
Ha logrado hacer su casa, ya que ahora es difícil ya que los materiales de construcción están caros,  con ahorros y financiamiento ha avanzado mucho. Su trabajo es como domestica lleva ya varios años laborando, cansado y aun que su salario es bajo tiene un trabajo seguro para poder dar lo necesario a sus hijos. Con este financiamiento comprara zinc para mejorar el techo, puertas que no pudo comprar ya que le falto dinero el cual las tiene tapando con zinc lo que le resulta inseguro por la robadera que se da en el barrio. Sus planes es lograr dar todas las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is the single mother of three children. She is 29 years old, and her economic situation has been difficult. Only her mother has always helped her. She was able to make her house. Now it is difficult because the construction materials are expensive. With savings and loans she has greatly advanced. She has worked for several years as a domestic employee. It is tiring work. Even though her salary is low, she does have secure work to be able to give her children the necessities. She will use this loan to buy zinc to improve the roof and to buy doors. She could not buy these due to lack of money. She has been covering the areas with zinc. This does not work well as protection from robbery, which exists in the neighborhood. Her plan is to be able to make all of the improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and doors to finish the improvements on her house

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea T. is a 35 year old married woman and lives in Samar village in Kandal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Phon Tonh, is a construction worker. With both of these positions they are able to earn a small income to support their family's living conditions. Aside from working in construction, Mr. Phon Tonh is also a farmer and owns a piece of land to grow crops. Mrs. Kea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support her husband's farming. The couple (pictured together) has three children, all of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba F. est membre à la caisse de liberté 6 depuis le mois d'Aout 2009 elle habite non loin de la caisse la cinquantaine elle  sollicite un deuxième crédit d'un montant de 400 000 F CFA pour acheter une machine a coudre, des tissus et de la teinture (thioup) pour  attirer la clientèle et mieux vendre ses produits
texts.en:
Mrs. Coumba F. has been a member of the Liberté 6 bank since August 2009. She does not live far form the bank. She is in her fifties and is requesting a second loan in the amount of 400 000 Francs CFA to buy fabric and dyes in order to attract customers and to better sell her products.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and dyes.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Yvette est mariée à KOTIN Célestin, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a une trentaine d’année que Yvette s’est installée au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Yvette apporte une aide financière à son mari dans les dépenses familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Yvette vend en effet, des tissus, des produits cosmétiques et des bassines et seaux en plastiques, par le système de distribution. Yvette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est depuis une dizaine d’année que Yvette mène cette activité, et elle a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la concurrence, Yvette sollicite un troisième crédit pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. H. Yvette is married to Mr. KOTIN Célestin, a mechanic. The couple have three children, who are all in school. About thirty years ago, she settled in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou. She lives together with her husband and children. She helps out her husband financially in meeting family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. Yvette basically sells cloth, cosmetics, and plastic tubs and buckets through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and has been in this business for about ten years. She has already had two loans from ALIDé that she repaid. With the goal of elevating her level of business and to cope better with the competition, Yvette is requesting a third loan to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and plastic tubs and buckets

loans.name: Tupelele

texts.en:
Tupelele K. is 30 and married with 7 children.  She is starting a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Tupelele needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tupelele joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Tupelele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
From the town of Banga, Erlinda G. is 60 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She prays for good health so she can sustain her family by working hard.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new one, her second, of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 28-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with two children: Kevin Mwangi, 12, and Cindy Waithera, 4, who are both in school.  

She operates Wamwesh Salon in an-open air market called Kawangware Market.  She has two employees whom she pays on commission.  She has been engaged in the business for seven years.  She was previously selling second-hand clothes.  

She is happy with the current business because she does it as a hobby and she earns better income. She hopes to expand her business and open a cosmetic shop in the future.    

Salome joined Umoja B group under Faulu Kenya three years ago.  Through the group, she is requesting 40,000 KES to rent a spacious business premises and to add to her stock of hair braids, weaves and shampoo.

loans.use: To rent a spacious business premise and add hair braids, weaves and shampoo.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren has a mixed farm which produces tea, pineapples and milk, all of which she sells at a local market. She has been practising mixed farming for 4 years in Litein, Rift Valley, Kenya. Carren is 23 years old and the mother of 2 children who are currently attending school.

Carren has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says that she will not always struggle to provide for her family since the extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees and buy food for her family.

Carren's primary challenge is lack of enough animal feed and diseases which reduce her output. She hopes that in five years' time, she will have increased her dairy farming by increasing the number of dairy cows to three. She is grateful to Juhudi for the trainings they occasionally offer to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mirta

texts.en:
Mirta is a 60-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband and two children in La Valencia, San Rafael, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Mirta has a business selling catalogue items such as clothing, shoes, cleaning products and kitchenware, amongst various other items. In the evenings, Mirta offers services in clothing repairs and alterations to members of her community. Mirta plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of inventory items (clothing) that she can sell via catalogue in her community. At the moment, she has no working capital and the only inventory she has in stock is cleaning products. She would like to diversify her inventory stock in order to attract more customers and more revenue. 

Mirta wakes up early every morning in order to carry out her domestic tasks. During this time, clients arrive at her house to buy various catalogue items. When she is done sewing, Mirta leaves her house and continues to sell her products door-to-door in her community. Mirta´s goal is to one day own a famous store in a centralized location from which to sell her various products.

loans.use: For the purchase of various catalogue items such as clothing and shoes

loans.name: Camino Al Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Camino al Cielo lo conforman Ana María Garmendia H., Johana del Socorro F. García y Azucena del Carmen M.. Ana se dedica a la elaboración de Nacatamales todos los viernes, ella inició este negocio desde hace 13 años elaborando apenas unos pocos productos, hoy elabora 2 o 3 veces más de lo fabricaba en un principio.

Johana tiene un ventecita en su casa de habitación, ella con apenas 23 años está incursionando en el mundo de los negocios pues apenas hace 4 meses que inició este proyecto. Azucena se dedica a la venta de pollo, carnes y gaseosas en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 1 año, cuando decidió dejar de trabajar como empleada doméstica.
texts.en:
The Camino al Cielo solidarity group consists of Ana María Garmendia H., Johana del Socorro F. García and Azucena del Carmen M.. Ana makes Nacatamales (Nicaraguan corn tamales, that are larger with more filling than Mexican tamales) every Friday; she started her business 13 years ago with few sales. Today, she makes 2 or 3 times as many products as she did when she first started. Johana opened a small store in her home 4 months ago. Just 23 years old, this is her first venture into business. Azucena sells poultry, meat and sodas. It has been more than a year since she left her job as a domestic helper to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: En cerdo, maiz, cebolla, chiltoma, especies

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Wella P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 31 years old. Wella is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Wella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena de 33 años de edad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que labora como docente de secundaria, ella tambien ejerce la misma actividad de docencia en le Esc. Deylin Olivas desde hace 3 años trabajo en el cual se ha destacado por su responsabilidad, no tienen hijos todavia ya que piensan acondicionar primero la vivienda.  

Solicita su primer crèdito y lo invertira en  compra de materiales de construcciòn para construir una habitaciòn y asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, dos hermanas de Maria Magdalena son clientes de AFODENIC quienes son excelentes clientes de la instituciòn y segun referencias comerciales, laborales y personales es una docente bien cumplida con sus compromisos.

su mayor sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 33, can count on her husband’s support.  He works as a secondary school teacher, as she herself has done for the last 3 years, at Deylin Olivas School.  She has stood out as being very responsible.  They have no children yet because they want first to prepare their home.

She is asking for her first loan that will be used to buy building materials and supplies to build a room so that their home will be more comfortable.  Two of María Magdalena’s sisters are excellent AFODENIC clients and according to commercial, employment and personal references, she is a committed teacher.

Her greatest dream is to finish getting her Bachelor of Education degree and to improve her home’s infrastructure.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. Kil N. (55) is a mother who is blessed with six children: three are married and three are single. Mrs. Kil N. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day by selling Khmer cake. Her husband is a porter. She is requesting a loan to provide additional capital to buy raw material for making Khmer cake.

There are three other members in this group who have requested loans. They are using the loans for the following activities: 
Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. R. is asking for a loan to add more capital to her Khmer cake business.
Mrs. N. is applying for a loan to mend her old house (her husband is pictured instead of her).

loans.use: To buy raw material for making Khmer cake.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha Gómez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora, madre ejemplar de cinco hijos de los cuales el menor es quien esta con ella y estudia ingeniería en sistema.  Esta señora de 53 años se dedica a la  vende ropa interior de damas, caballeros y niños. Ella inicio en 1995 con la venta de granos básicos pero como visualizó la oportunidad de cambiar de negocio el cual era menos cansado y no tan variante con los precios. 
Ella invertirá en ropa infantil y útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Bertha Gómez is a hardworking entrepreneur, and an exemplary mother of five children, the youngest of whom is still under her care and a systems engineering student. This 53-year-old woman sells undergarments for men, women, and children for a living. She started selling staple grains back in 1995, but she got a chance to switch to a business that was less demanding without there being much difference in pay.

She will invest the loan in purchasing children's apparel and school supplies.

loans.use: Purchase children's apparel and school supplies

loans.name: Mauro Eleuterio

texts.es:
Mauro de 34 años, tiene una pequeña farmacia. Trabaja con su esposo desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo medicinas. Escogió esta actividad con ayuda de su padre hace 6 años atrás pero por la diferencias de ingresos él tuvo que separarse de su papa y conseguir un lugar para alquilar y tener sus propios ingresos y así poder mantener a su familia. 

 Con un pequeño capital que tenía comenzó a comprar medicinas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am con ayuda de su esposa vendiendo remedio como apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo etc. El tiene dos hijos de 14 y 10 años que estudian en un colegio fiscal y viven todos en una casa que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en una zona urbana llamada suburbio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo expectorante etc. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para que su esposa lo administre y seguir esforzándose para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mauro, age 34, has a small pharmacy. He works with his wife from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. selling medicines. He began in this business 6 years ago with help from his father, but because of disputes over money he had to separate himself from his father’s business and get a place to rent and to have his own income so that he would be able to support his family.

With the little capital that he had he began to purchase medicines. Currently, he works from 6:00 a.m. with his wife selling remedies such as apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo, etc. He has two children, ages 14 and 10, who study in a public school. They all live in a house that has all the basic services and is located in an urban area called Suburbio.

With the loan he wants to buy medicines such as meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo, expectorants, etc. In the future, he wants to have another business that his wife can run and to continue striving so that his children have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Aku Elom

texts.fr: Elom est âgée de 32 ans.  Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de produits d’alimentation.  Elle a débuté en 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a ouvert une boutique dans son domicile où elle revend les produits. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  5 cartons de pâtes, 10 cartons de tomates, 20 sacs de riz, et 100 cartons de boissons de canettes.
texts.en: Elom is 32 years old and has a revenue-generating business selling grocery items.  She started in 2005 and gets her supplies at the big market of Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Elom opened her store within her home, where she sells these goods.  She is asking for a loan to buy 5 boxes of pasta, 10 boxes of tomatoes, 20 sacks of rice, and 100 boxes of beverages in cans.

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter C. is 30 years old.  He is married to Rodah, who is a famer.  They are blessed with four school-going children between 11 and six years old.  He is a carpenter and has been in this business for five years.  Right now his monthly income from the business is KSH 12,000.

Peter is requesting a loan for Kshs 15,000 and plans to use it to purchase timber and workshop materials. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and farming activity. This is his second loan.  He successfully repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

Peter's hopes and dreams are to educate his children for a better life, and to engage in a bigger business like owning a supermarket.

loans.use: To expand the workshop

loans.name: Sirley

texts.es:
Sirley vive en casa de su padre en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, la señora atiende una librería de barrio,  con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la construcción, cementado de patio en su vivienda.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sirley lives in a house belonging to his father, located in the community of Llojeta in the city of La Pas. She is married and she has two young children. She has a bookstore in her neighborhood and she is able to support her family with this income. 

The loan will be used for the construction and cement flooring for a patio in their home. 

Her socio-economic analysis qualifies her for a new loan.

loans.use: To build a patio in her home.

loans.name: Las Kiwis Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Kiwis se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Sara J. V. va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos y ropa, blusas, pantalones, faldas etc., va a comprar platos, vasos desechables, la señora Margarita T. J. va a comprar zapatos para surtir su pedido, la señora Elizabeth Martínez T. va a comprar cosméticos, zapatos para surtir sus pedidos, la señora María del Refugio T. M. va a comprar abono para abonar su milpa que es de riego, la señora Claudia B. E. va a comprar azúcar, yogurt, queso, refrescos, para surtir su negocio, La señora Claudia B. E. tiene 35 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er, año de secundaria, ella es casada no tiene hijos, ella tiene su negocio de maquinitas de multijuegos , ella solicito su préstamo para comenzar a surtir su tienda de abarrotes va a comprar salchichas, jamón, yogurt, queso añejo, queso de hebra y refrescos y también va a comprar pintura para pintar su casa, su negocio lo inicio hace un año por falta de dinero para que hubiera mas ingresos para su casa, las maquinitas están a comisión le dan un porcentaje, anteriormente vendía picaditas y dobladitas y quiere volver a vender picaditas y dobladitas, su negocio es importante porque le llegan ingresos, tiene dinero para que no le falte nada y su negocio está en su casa y no paga renta, sus clientes son los niños que van a jugar, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de otra persona que tiene maquinitas, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para comprar la despensa, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio poner su tienda de abarrotes y vender picaditas y dobladitas, y lo piensa lograr con los prestamos, este negocio le ha ayudado económicamente, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son ponerle piso a su casa, banquetas, remodelar su tanque de agua, sus planes y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca y ponerle piso a su casa, ella está feliz con este préstamo que le van a dar para que su negocio crezca y se dé a conocer.  Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y Fundación Realidad “Muchas gracias por su ayuda, que baje el interés para que nos alcance y que todo está bien a ver si se puede bajar el interés y que nos sigan prestando”. Jaloxtoc es un pueblo bonito se ve el campo, los cerros, siembran sorgo, maíz, cebolla.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Kiwis' and it is located in Jaloxtoc, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  It has 5 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  They are Sara J. Valentín, who will use her loan to buy shoes and clothes, blouses, skirts, etc. and disposable plates and cups; Margarita T. J., who will buy shoes to fill an order; Elizabeth Martínez T., who will buy cosmetics and shoes to fill her orders; María del Refugio T. M., who will buy manure to fertilize her irrigated fields and Claudia B. E. who will buy sugar, yoghurt, cheese and soft drinks to stock her business.

Claudia B. E. is 35 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and doesn't have any children.  She has a games machine business.  Claudia has requested her loan so that she can start stocking a grocery store.  She will buy sausages, ham, yoghurt, Añejo cheese, Oaxaca cheese and soft drinks.  She will also buy paint so that she can paint her home.

Claudia started her business a year ago as her household needed more income.  She has her games machines on commission and earns a percentage.  She used to sell 'picaditas' (filled cornmeal shells) and 'dobladitas' (a kind of quick bread).  She would like to go back to selling 'picaditas' and 'dobladitas'.  Her business is important because it makes her income.  She has money so that she doesn't want for anything, her business is located in her home and she doesn't pay rent.  Her customers are the children who come to play on the machines.  Her business has competition from another person who has games machines.

Claudia uses the profits from her business to buy food.  She is planning to expand her business, set up her grocery store and sell 'picaditas' and 'dobladitas'.  She hopes to use her loans to achieve this.  Her business has helped her financially.  The improvements she would like to make to her home are to put down flooring, buy some stools and remodel her water tank.  Her hopes are to grow her business and to put down flooring in her home.

Claudia is happy to be receiving this loan which she has been given so that her business can grow and become well known.   The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Many thanks for your help.  Please lower the interest rates so that we can manage and so that all is well.  Let's see if you can lower the interest rates and continue lending to us".

Jaloxtoc is a beautiful village.  From it, you can see the countryside and the hills.  People grow sorghum, corn and onions.

loans.use: To buy sausages, ham, yoghurt, cheese, Añejo cheese, Oaxaca cheese, soft drinks and paint to paint her house

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak L. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is a traditional doctor, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of $700 to pay for the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: L. Srta.  Adeluz   es soltera,  tiene 19 años D. edad,  actualmente es socia  en L. alcancía comunal “Sarita Colonia”  grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Adeluz trabaja en una tienda que lo inaguro hace un mes donD. venD. carmines ganchos collares anillos y a su vez venD. productos D. belleza, este trabajo surge  a raíz D. que Adeluz quería   estudiar pero sus padres no contaban con los medios económicos para solventar sus estudios es así que Adeluz pone su negocio con el fin D. juntar dinero para estudiar y a sus vez brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida  a sus padres. Este es el primer préstamo que Edaprospo le otorga, y gracias a ello comprara mercadería para implementar su negocio. Sabemos que Adeluz cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Miss Adeluz is 19 years old and single.  She is a member of the "Sarita Colonia" communal bank which is comprised of 8 members who are involved in different business activities.  Adeluz has a store that she inaugurated a month ago and she sells lipstick, necklaces, rings and beauty products.  She began this job because she wanted to study and her parents didn't have the financial means to pay for her education.  Adeluz started her business to save enough money to study so she can proviD. a better lifestyle for her parents.

This is her first loan through Edaprospo and because of it she will be able to buy merchandise for her store.  We know that Adeluz will reach her goals through her hard work and the help of the Edaprospo loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 31-year-old married man with 2 young children. He lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with his family.

Eric is a farmer. He plants and harvests rice crops. Eric just finished preparing his land and is now ready for planting rice crops. He has requested a loan which he will use to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Eric hopes for an increased harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.es: Rosinda, de 30 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo José de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Darwin de 7 y Adrián de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. A través de estos años Rosinda ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras, para que sean más productivas. Los productos como la papa, gladiolo y arveja que cultiva, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus chacras.
texts.en:
Rosinda, 30, is a very kind, hard working woman living in her parents’ house with her husband, José, 34, and their two beloved sons: Darwin, 7, and Adrián, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Throughout the years Rosinda has worked very hard to make sure that her crops are of very good quality.  She works her fields every morning so that they will be more productive.  The products she grows, like potatoes, gladiolas and peas, are sold at Tarma’s wholesale market where she gets the best prices.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years and what she considers to be the most difficult part of it is transporting the crops all the way to the markets where she sells them.  In time, she hopes to plant on her entire field in order to increase production.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she wants to make her payments on time because she wants to be able to access future loans to improve her business.  She knows that she’ll have the support and guidance of her communal bank because she is a very well-liked member.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy sacks of manure to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Jesus Boanerges

texts.es: Jesús siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador que disfruta de actividad económica.  Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado y leche, es una persona muy conocida por esta actividad. Tiene más de 2 años en esta actividad, su  experiencia le ha dado una gran ayuda para mantener a sus clientes, pues ha sido muy satisfactorio. Por lo que tenía que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de ganado y una gran cantidad de leche. Desea proporcionar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Jesús has always been a hardworking man that enjoys economic activity.  His business is buying and selling livestock and milk, and he is well-known for this activity.  He has been in this business for more than 2 years.  His experience has been a great help to keep his customers, thus it has been very satisfactory.  Jesús had to find a means of income for his family.  This loan is for the purchase of cattle and a large quantity of milk.  He would also like to provide home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and a large quantity of milk.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Mrs. Narin M. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chanthol Kao, live along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have no children yet.

Narin sells sugar palm, she buys sugar palm from Kampong Cham province for resale in her local market. In addition, she also raises ducks and chickens at home. He husband is an aide-de-camp. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to buy more sugar palm for resale. She will use a part of the loan to purchase more chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy sugar palm and chickens for resale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a hardworking married man with seven children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He takes care of the family with the help of his wife who is also a farmer. Their dream is to educate their children since they did not have a chance to attain an education. For four years, he has been into farming.  He grows maize and fruit and he has been able to reap very high yields. In a season, he would harvest two bags of maize but he can now harvest seven bags of maize per season. He has the challenge of price fluctuation of agricultural products and his dream is to become a mechanized farmer. Thomas needs the loan to prepare his land for growing maize.

loans.use: To prepare his land for growing maize

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est présidente du groupe d’affaire « Mutiifu», âgée de 33 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 4 enfants.  La cliente est entrepreneur d’un mini restaurant de l’auberge, situé tout proche du marché central Virunga. Environ quatre ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  50 $ de crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les aliments et recettes destinés à la cuisine de restaurant (1 sac de haricots,50 kg de pommes de terre,20 litres d’huile de table, les épices, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Mutiifu» est majoritairement féminin.
texts.en:
Kabuo, the client, is president of the business group “Mutiifu”. She is a 33-year-old woman living alone and is the mother of four children. The client is a businesswoman in a mini restaurant at the inn located close to the central Virunga market.

She has been practicing this activity for four years. She has completed 10 credit cycles with Hekima. She started her business with a USD 50 loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to get supplies for the food necessary in making the recipes and cooking at the restaurant (one bag of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liters of cooking oil, spices etc.)

In addition, she is planning on enlarging her business, send her children to school and build a house. The client thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women excluded from the classic banking system. We ought to point that the business group “Mufiitu” is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bag of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liteers of cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza y venta de productos de belleza, ella en un salón de belleza hace teñidos, ondulaciones y cortes de cabello, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza y el negocio de ventas de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes, tijeras y ruleros y también para comprar productos de belleza como lápices labiales, perfumes y cremas.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She is 40 years old and lives with her spouse; she has three children.

She alternates her daily chores with running a beauty salon and selling beauty products.  In the salon she does hair coloring, hair curling and hair cuts.  She works from 9am until 8pm and she is able to support her children through this business.  She would like to expand and improve the beauty salon business and the business selling beauty products.  She is asking for a loan to buy hair color, scissors and rollers and also to buy beauty products like lipstick, perfume and creams.

She is happy with the loan and committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to buy hair color, scissors and rollers and also to buy beauty supplies like lipsstick, perfume and creams.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, es comerciante, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, los dos trabajan y se apoyan, ella por su parte vende frutas y productos de belleza, inicio gracias al apoyo de una cuñada, este negocio le sirve como fuente permanente de ingreso.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas para el negocio, manzanas, kiwi, bananos, fresas, uvas, melocotón, melón y sandia, estos productos es su fuerte en el negocio, y a través de ellas obtiene ingresos, pues su clientela le demanda frutas frescas.
Con la inversión puede atender mejor a los clientes, aspirando siempre a mejorar y fortalecer el comercio, también el número de clientes y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is a businesswoman. She lives with her son and is single. The two of them work together and support each other. María sells fruit and beauty products, businesses she started with the support of a sister-in-law. The sales of these products provide a permanent income.

María is seeking a loan to buy fruit such as apples, kiwi, bananas, strawberries, grapes, peaches, melons, and watermelon for the business. These products are the backbone of the business and provide most of the income because her customers require fresh fruit.

With the loan money she will be able to provide better service to her customers. Her desire is always to improve and strengthen the business and increase both her customer base and her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, kiwi, bananas, strawberries, grapes, peaches, melons, and watermelon

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

Alaa owns a shop selling car tires. He sells and repairs tires and large machinery.  He has good experience in his field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventories (tires, accessories). He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more inventory

loans.name: Minandégo

texts.fr: Minandégo est âgé de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Minandégo est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Victorine et a quinze enfants à charge, dont seulement trois représentent ses propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Minandégo vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, Minandégo assure sans grande difficulté les besoins de sa famille. Minandégo n'a jamais été à l'école. Minandégo a appris le métier de vulcanisation. De façon secondaire, Minandégo vend des pneus, des chambres à air et également de l'acide dans son quartier. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de l'étendre par l'ouverture d'autres boutiques de ventes de ses produits, Minandégo sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été remboursé sans difficulté.
texts.en: Minandégo is 31 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a retailer named Victorine and has fifteen children in his care, of whom only three are his own. Among the children, some attend school. Minandégo lives together with his wife and children. Thanks to the income from his business, he is able to provide for his family without too much difficulty. Minandégo never attended school. He is trained in the field of vulcanization. On the side, Minandégo sells tires, inner tubes, and also battery acid in his area. With the goal of strengthening his business and extending it by opening other stores to sell his products, Minandégo is seeking his second loan through ALIDÉ. The first loan was repaid without difficulty.

loans.use: To buy inner tubes, tires, and battery acid.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en:
Fulgence has been a rice farmer for the past two years. He learned rice farming from his parents.

He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs for his rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs of his rice production

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 57 años vive en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad. Uno de ellos trabaja como pescador con quien también don Pedro trabajó por mucho tiempo.
El se dedica a la zapatería, tiene un puesto en el mercado de San Lorenzo, zona por la cual es muy conocido. Es destacado por su amabilidad con los clientes, como así también por el buen trabajo que realiza. Comenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo, ya que diariamente mucha gente se acerca a el para hacerle componer sus calzados. Su anhelo es poder brindar dentro de sus posibilidades el mayor bienestar posible a sus nietos, apoyarlos en sus gastos escolares y todo lo que requieran para una vida digna.
Él solicita el crédito para adquirir materia prima, como ser cuero, hilos de cera, agujas y otros para la confección de calzados que tiene por pedido; de esta forma cumplirá con sus clientes y estos a su vez lo seguirán recomendándolo con nuevos interesados.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is 57 years old and lives in the city of San Lorenzo. His children are grown. One of them works as a fisherman and has also worked with Don Pedro for a long time.

Pedro is a shoemaker. He has a stand at the market in San Lorenzo, an area that is well-known. Pedro is known for his friendliness to his customers and the good work that he performs. He says that he has plenty of work because people come to him every day and ask him to make shoes for them. His wish is to provide for the welfare of his grandchildren as much as possible, which includes paying for their school expenses and everything they need to have a decent life.

Pedro is requesting a loan to acquire raw materials such as leather, waxed thread, needles, and other items for making shoes that have been ordered. This will allow him to satisfy his customers so that they will recommend him to new people.

loans.use: to purchase leather, waxed thread, needles, and other items for making shoes.

loans.name: Martha Reina

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 50 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, ellas comerciante y sastre. Doña Martha inicio en la actividad de la costura hace 15 años  siendo este su primer negocio, luego se decidió poner una pulpería para tener ingresos extras desde entonces se ha  desempeñado ella sola en estos dos negocios que aunque no son tan grandes pero es una forma en la que se ayuda a mantener económicamente, se ha desempeñado con gran empeño y dedicación en sus labores del día a día.  
Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, carne, jabones, producto comestibles y materia prima como tela, botones, zipper, hilos para sus trabajos de costura. Esta inversión la ayudara a adquirir mejor materia prima para trabajar, ofrecer mejor servicio y calidad a sus clientes. Ella tiene metas como ampliar y mejorar su taller de costura y diversificar los productos de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha, age 50, lives in Granada city. She is married, has two children, and is a shopkeeper and a tailor. Martha started her tailor's business 15 years ago. This was her first business. Later, she decided to open a small grocery store in order to make an extra income. Since then, she has held down both businesses on her own. They are not very big, but this is how she helps maintain herself economically. She has worked with great determination and dedication in her day-to-day labour.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products such as basic grains, sugar, oil, meat, ham, other food items, and materials such as fabric, buttons, zippers and threads for her sewing work. This investment will help her to acquire better basic materials for her work, thus offering a better service and quality to her customers. She has goals such as expanding and improving her sewing workshop, and diversifying the products in her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products such as basic grains, sugar, oil, meat, ham, other food items, and materials such as fabric, buttons, zippers and thread for her sewing work.

loans.name: El Bocote Group

texts.es:
La señora Elvira  cuenta con 56 años de edad  es casada y tiene 4 hijos los dos menores dependen de ella, ellos estudian la secundaria y bachillerato, su esposo se llama Epifanio y se dedica al campo. 

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño negocio de frutas y legumbres el cual lo ha logrado mantener con la ayuda del préstamo ya que nos cuenta que le ha traído buenos beneficios en lo comercial y personal, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas como son: manzana, plátano, uvas, ciruelas, etc.

Ella pertenece al grupo llamado el bocote ellas le pusieron ese nombre porque en el lugar donde hacen la reunión esta un árbol llamado bocote, el grupo esta integrado por  12 miembros lo cual serán mencionados.

El Sr. Lidio se dedica a vender pollos descuartizados y en pluma, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas pollos.

La Sra. Josefina se dedica a la venta de dulces, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más dulces ya que salieron unos dulces nuevos.

La Sra. Fulgencia se dedica en la venta de comida, invirtió su préstamo en la compra de insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carnes, etc.

La Sra. Leticia se dedica al comercio, ella vendes dulces afuera de su casa, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de chicharres, sabritas, jugos, dulces.

El Sr. José se dedica al comercio de verduras el vende todo tipo de verduras, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras como son: manzana, jitomate, chile, cebolla, plátano, etc.

La Sra. Arcadia se dedica al comercio de verduras lo cual invirtió su préstamo en más verduras.

La Sra. Karina comercio de verduras el vende todo tipo de verduras, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: jitomate, chile, papa, zanahoria, etc.

El Sr. Margarito se dedica al comercio de maíz el compra el maíz y lo revende, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas maíz de temporada.

La Sra. Rosa se dedica al comercio de accesorios de mercería, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más accesorios.

El Sr. Gieovani se dedica al comercio de pan el vende pan, invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar el pan como son: aceite, harina, azúcar, etc.

La Sra. Oralia se dedica al comercio de tamales, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar los tamales como son: pollo, chile, jitomate, etc.
texts.en:
Señora Elvira is 56 years old, She is married and has 4 children, two of which of minors and dependent on her. They attend middle and high school. Her husband is called Epifanio and he works in the fields.

She has a small business selling fruit and vegetables which she has managed to maintain with the help of the loan. She tells us that it has brought her great benefits both personally and commercially. She invested her loan in the purchase of fruit such as: apples, bananas, grapes, plums, etc.

She belongs to the group called the Bocote. They named it this because there is a bocote tree at the place where they meet. The group consists of 12 members who are listed below:
Señor Lidio works selling live and quartered chickens. He invested his loan in the purchase of more chickens.
Señora Josefina sells sweets. She invested her loan in the purchase of more candy and new kinds of sweets.
Señora Fulgencia sells cooked food. She invested her loan in the purchase of the consumables she uses to make the food such as: oil, vegetables, meat, etc. 
Señora Leticia has a business selling sweets outside her house. She invested her loan in the purchase of peas, potato chips, juices and sweets.
Señor José works selling vegetables. He sells all kinds of vegetables. He invested his loan in the purchase of fruit and vegetables such as: apples, tomatoes, chillis, onions, bananas, etc.
Señora Arcadia is in the vegetable business. She invested her loan in the purchase of more vegetables.
Señora Karina works selling vegetables. She sells all kinds of vegetables. She invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables such as: tomatoes, chillis, potatoes, carrots, etc.
Señor Margarito is in the corn business. He buys corn and resells it. He invested his loan in the purchase of more corn this season.
Señora Rosa works in the business of haberdashery accessories. She invested her loan in the purchase of more accessories.
Señor Gieovani works in the bread business. He sells bread. He invested his loan in the purchase of consumables used to make the bread such as: oil, flour, sugar, etc.
Señora Oralia works making tamales. She invested her loan in the purchase of consumables used to make the tamales such as: chicken, chillis, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, bananas, grapes, plums etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and lives with his wife and his two children.

Mahmoud has owned a furniture gallery since 2005, selling bedrooms, dining tables, sitting rooms and kitchens. He has more than six years experience in this field and a good reputation, and there are a lot of potential customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a Chinese furniture-making machine. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a Chinese furniture-making machine.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Alfredo le esta haciendo falta la barda la rededor de ella 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es (Cemento, block, varilla, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora). 
Don Alfredo es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad que están estudiando y le preocupa la seguridad cuando están en la casa. 
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en un taller de herrería como soldador planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Inés se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y el patrimonio que sea para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfred’s home does not have a fence around it. He is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies (cement blocks, rods and sand) and he needs to pay the person doing the work.

Alfred is the father of two middle age children who are studying and he worries about their security when they are at home.

He plans to repay the loan with the money he receives from his welding job at a blacksmith shop. His wife Maria Inés takes care of the family expenses and pays for the children’s studies from what she earns.

They want to improve their quality of life and their estate for their children.

loans.use: to pay to build a fence around the house

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly is a 58-year-old from Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh City. Since her husband passed away, she is a responsible and hard working mother of two children. 

To pursue a better living, she is in the business of selling fish in mobile markets. She typically makes an income of about $5 USD each day from this business. One of her children, 28 and a single woman, also helps support the family by working as a garment factory worker in a local area.  She usually gets her salary in monthly payments. 

Currently, Mrs. Ly’s house was damaged partially by the weather. She plans to repair it with her savings, which are inadequate. She has requested a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, in the sum of $800 USD. She’ll use the loan to fix her house and will use the remaining funds as capital for buying more fish.

loans.use: to fix her house and use the remaining capital for buying more fish.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza needs another loan to pay for school fees for her children. The 53-year-old mother of five lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations and her dream is to become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 42, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. Sok and her husband are farmers. Her rice production is enough for her family, and she is able to also sell her rice to fulfill the market demand. Three of her children are employed at a garment factory in the city for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her son to provide transportation services. By doing so, she is able to generate more income for her family. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Sok appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Mo'taz

texts.en:
Mo'taz, age 21 and unmarried, is a farmer. He lives with his family, all of whom depend on agriculture for their living. 

Mo'taz and the family have a piece of land that needs to be restored to a state in which it can be optimized for planting and harvesting crops. Mo'taz intends to purchase agricultural supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers in order to prepare the land as well as possible for the growing season. Since Mo'taz and his family lack the money to pay for these agricultural necessities, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Mo'taz receives the loan proceeds, he will be able to pay for improvements and repairs to the family land. He and his family will benefit from growing, harvesting, and selling its products in the future to increase the family income and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers in order to prepare the land for the growing season

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель района Шахритус. Ему 28 лет. Он холост. Он живет вместе с матерью. Его мать домохозяйка. Сам Хуршед занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khurshed is a resident of Shahrituz region. He is 28 years old, single and lives with his mother. His mother is a home maker and Khurshed raises sheep. He has had his herd for the last two years and would like to take out this loan to purchase cows for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.
Margie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mahouna Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUNA est formé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Albertine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Albertine est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Grégoire. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Albertine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Albertine vend des liqueurs et des boissons sucrées dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Albertine vend des beignets de manioc et de blé à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Albertine achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Albertine et les autres membres du groupement MAHOUNA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Mahouna group is made up of 15 people who live in the same village and who all have income-generating activities. The representative of this group, whose name is Albertine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Abertine is 33 years old and married to a man called Grégoire. The couple has three children, all dependents, some of whom are at school. Albertine did not attend school and she now sells liqueurs and sugary drinks in her area. At the same time she sells cassava and wheat fritters from home. These activities allow her, together with her husband, to cover the various family expenses. Abertine buys her products in a village in Benin. This is the first time that she and the other members of the Mahouna group have requested a loan from Alidé. This loan will enable them to strengthen their activities and increase their turnover, so that they can respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cartons of liqueurs and wheat flour

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias.
La Sra Jacinta es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, nos comenta que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muy buena venta, por los productos de buena calidad que ofrece, y sumado a eso los buenos precios. Este trabajo es el medio de subsistencia de ella y de su familia, es por ello que le pone mucho empeño a lo que hace.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, y demás tipos de verduras, con lo cual podrá surtirse y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women called “Enterprising Women” is in its 1st loan cycle with the Paraguay Foundation's Enterprising Women Program. In addition to each member's independent work, they also develop activities together to collect funds to be able to have group capital to count on. At the same time, they provide mutual help to arrive at their main objective, which is to help their families.

Jacinta is one of the members. She sells vegetables, and she tells us that its going very well. She always has good sales of the high quality products she sells, in part because of her good prices. This work is the means of subsistence for Jacinta and her family, for whom she puts forth her efforts.

Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, locotes, onions, and other types of vegetables, to resupply her stock and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 27 to 38 years old. She describes herself as honest and innovative. 

She operates a retail store where she sells airtime vouchers and cards. She is an agent of Safaricom company. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a viable area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as sometimes getting insufficient float for customers from Safaricom company. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more airtime vouchers and cards. Lucy's business goal is to venture into and run a tailoring shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and safaricom cards.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Graciela y tiene 02 hijos pero vive en compañía de su esposo y uno de sus hijos en su casa propia. Rafael se dedica a la crianza de peces de la región y siembra de palma aceitera para eso tiene un terreno propio de 20 hectáreas de extensión. Se inicio hace más 04 años en ésta actividad, cuando logró posesionarse en esa zona contando con el apoyo  técnico de la empresa privada a la que vende toda su producción, llegando a contratar hasta 02 trabajadores. Le gusta su actividad pues cuenta con un oficio al cual dedicarse, así como también le gusta el trabajo de campo y los ingresos económicos que le genera. Al contrario, no le gusta  las plagas de afectan las plantaciones, por eso tiene que estar pendiente y alerta de cualquier brote. Además tiene planes de seguir creciendo y comprarse un vehiculo de carga pesada para el transporte de su producto. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 2500 , Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de comida para sus peces y abono orgánico para los cultivos de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Rafael, 48, is married to Graciela and has 2 children.  He lives with his wife and one of their children in his own home.  Rafael works in fish farming in the region, and he also cultivates palm oil.  To do this, he has 20 hectares of land that he owns.  He started in this work more than 4 years ago when he managed to acquire the land, relying on some technical support from a private company that buys all of his production.  He now has 2 employees.  

Rafael enjoys this work, because it gives him an occupation that he can rely on.  In addition, he likes working in the fields, and the income that it generates.  But on the other hand, he does not enjoy dealing with the pests that affect his crops.  He has to be vigilant and aware of any outbreaks that occur.  

Rafael has plans to continue to grow his business.  He plans to buy a heavy cargo vehicle to transport his products.  At this time, he is requesting a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles.  He hopes to have your support so that he can carry out his plans.  Also, he is committed to making his payments on time.  Rafael will invest the entire sum requested in fish food and in organic fertilizers for his palm oil crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and fish food

loans.name: Navrasta

texts.en: Navrasta is a hardworking woman. She has two children. The condition of her family is bad. She works at the Technical Training College as cooker. She has not her own home she lives in this collage’s hostel. She is ill and wants to treat herself. She loves her children. She is very kind and careful.  She hopes she will find support and became healthy. She needs money to buy medicine. She is asking for a loan of 5000 with this aim. She hopes with your help and mercy she can reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida has a business of soda and beer sales. She also sells items for the house and for woman, men and children. She has 35 years of experience in this business. When she was younger, Adelaida used to travel to the local markets to sell her goods. She is no longer able to go to the markets due to health problems with her legs. She now works out of her house every day from early morning to 11 at night. She sells her products on credit, with 30% paid up front and the remainder in weekly payments thereafter.

She needs the loan to stock up on beverages and buy the additional items she sells. She has pending orders but lacks the additional capital to fill them.

Adelaida is 50 years old. One of her 7 childen lives with her. He works for and supports himself. Adelaida is a single mother. She had to take on full responsibility for supporting and raising her family because her husband abandoned her. Her children worked to support themselves from the time they were very young. With a lot of effort and hard work, the family was able to buy the house where Adelaida now lives. Adelaida's dream is to maintain her business and continue to sell, because it is her business that entertains and sustains her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Adelaida tiene un negocio de venta de colas y cervezas. Ella también se dedica a vender artículos para: el hogar, damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene 35 años de experiencia en esto. Cuando era más joven salía a vender en los mercados pero se enfermo de las piernas y tuvo que dejarlo. Ahora atiende en su casa todo el día desde tempranas horas hasta las 11:00PM. Los artículos los vende a crédito 30% de entrada y el saldo en partes que cobra cada semana.

Ella necesita el préstamo para abastecerse en gaseosas y además comprar los artículos que ella coloca, tiene pedidos pero le hace falta un capital adicional.

Adelaida tiene 57 años, 7 hijos de los cuales sólo 1 vive con ella. Él trabaja y mantiene por sí solo. Ella es madre soltera. Ella tuvo que sacar adelante la familia porque su esposo la abandonó. Sus hijos trabajaron desde muy joven para mantenerse. Con mucho esfuerzo entre toda la familia pudieron comprar la casa donde ahora vive Adelaida. Su ilusión es que su negocio se mantenga y seguir vendiendo porque eso la entretiene y se sostiene.

loans.use: Buy more beverages and plastic houseware items to sell

loans.name: Aganee

texts.en: Mama M. sells cooking oil in gallons to her customers. She has been with KSF for a number of years now. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza sells groceries and vegetables in a shop that she has built in her house. She began this business when she lost her job and with a loan of $150.00 her brother gave to her. She began by selling to her neighbors and friends, offering products at economical prices and also fresh vegetables. She has noticed that her sales have increased over time. She has had to buy more merchandise due to the demand and because of the fact that she trusts her customers to pick out for themselves the products they want to buy.

With the loan she wants to achieve one of her goals, which is to sell more school supplies. She lives near a school and has noticed that there are few stationary stores in her area, which is why she is sure that she will be able to sell many of these items. She is sure that by increasing the amount of merchandise and by improving her business, she and he family will be able to improve their living conditions.

Lorenza is 35 years old, has a son who is studying, and her house is built of cane. She is sure that by improving her business she will be able to build one of cement, and thereby improve her family’s stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Lorenza vende abarrotes y legumbres en un local que ha acondicionado en su casa.
