Ella comenzo esta actividad cuando quedo desempleada y con un prestamo de $150 que hizo a un hermano logro comenzar su tiendita. Lorenza empezo por atender a su vecindad y amigos ofreciendo los productos a precios economicos y las hortalizas frescas debido a esto ella ha notado que sus ventas han aumentado conel pasar del tiempo. Actualmente ha visto la necesidad de comprar más mercaderia por la demanda que estas tienen y por la confianza que ella brinda a sus clientes de que ellos mismos escojan el producto que desean llevar. Con el prestamo ella espera cumplir con uno de sus objetivos que es de incrementar utiles escolares pues ella vive cerca de una escuela y ha notado que hay pocos papelerias en sus sector y por lo tanto esta segura que esos articulos tendran mucha salida en su negocio. Lorenza tiene la certeza de que con el incremento de mercaderia y el mejoramiento de su negocio ella y su familia podran mejorar sus condiciones de subsistencia. Ella tiene 35 años, un hijo que estudia, su casa es de caña, pero con el realce que le de a su negocio esta seguro que podra comenzar a construirla de cemento y asi mejorar su estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To  buy school supplies

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra N. is 51-year-old married woman who has two grown up children. She lives in Khoshchobanli village in Imihsli town, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Zohra has been running her farm since 2003, when she first purchased a cow. Zohra works very hard; she wakes up at 6 a.m. every day to milk a cow because her first clients come to buy some milk at 7 a.m. 
She also spends a lot of taking care of her cattle. From the first cow, Zohra sold milk and it brought her good income.  

Soon after Zohra purchased another cow and a calf.  Zohra has now decided to expand her business and purchase two calves for meat production and one cow for milk. Dairy products and meat are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Also, autumn is wedding season in Azerbaijan and dairy and meat products are in very high demand during this time.  Zohra is requesting a loan for 1200 USD; the estimated rate for a cow is 700 USD and for a calf is 200-400 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 700 USD and two calves each for 250 USD

loans.name: Amelia Judas

texts.pt:
Amelia lives and runs her business in Inhambe. She has a small grocery store. She lives with the father of her 3 children. She joined the program in 2006. She is now in the 5th stage. In her store, Amelia sells various products. She is now able to pay for the schooling of her children. If the business continues to do well, she plans on improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia vive em Inhambane e e la onde desenvolve o seu negocio. Ela tem uma pequena mercearia.Ela e mae de 3 filhos.Vive maritalmente com um homem que e o pai dos filhos..Amelia entrou para o programa em 2006.Agora esta no quinto ciclo.Ela vende produtos diversos.O negocio dela esta a prosperar.Ela ja consegue pagar sem dificuldades a escola dos seus filhos e comparticipar nas despesas da casa. Se o negocio continuar a correr bem ela pensa melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 48 years old and a widow.  Her husband died during the civil war in Sierra Leone and she was left to bring up her three children and two adopted children.  She sells palm oil, spices, plastic shoes and other items.  Fatmata sells her goods in the villages and at the border of the Republic of Guinea.  With her previous loans, she was able to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil a month.  She would like to expand the stock of her spices and is therefore requesting a loan of $375 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase her profits by purchasing additional spices and palm oil stock for sale

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is a widow and works on her rice paddy growing crops and can make only meagre money per day. Every cost expense in her family is mostly taken care of by her daughter who runs a stand selling grocery products, with her husband working as a recycler. The three family members work very hard day to day to generate their family’s income.  Mrs. Sang S. has requested for a loan to expand her daughter’s grocery stand to meet her growing customer demands and the remainder of the loan is to reinvest in her son-in-law recyclable business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her daughter to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche P. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1999, she has made a living selling food to the people of her community. She has been a LAPO member for three years, and has applied for a $200 loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mauricio José

texts.es:
Mauricio, 30, is a carpenter. His wife is a homemaker and their 2 children are in secondary school. They live in the "municipio" of Ticuantepe. Mauricio has been a carpenter for more than 5 years. He has a small workshop in his house where he makes doors, tables, chairs and other wood furniture, using skills that he's honed over the years. Most of his customers are from the city but a few are from nearby towns.

Mauricio's work has allowed him to pay the family's expenses and because his job is the only source of income for the family, he works every day, starting very early. The basic material for making his products is wood but he also need varnish which he uses to give his products the finished look that they need for sale. Mauricio is applying for a loan to buy the supplies he needs to maintain his carpentry business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Mauricio es Ebanista, tiene 30 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, sus 2 hijos estudian en secundaria, viven en una comarca del municipio de Ticuantepe, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a la carpintería, en su vivienda tiene su pequeño taller en donde trabaja elaborando puertas, mesas, sillas, muebles de madera, se ha perfeccionado en su trabajo a lo largo de los años, la mayoría de sus clientes son de la ciudad y algunos de las comunidades cercanas.

Con su trabajo es como ha podido afrontar todos los gastos familiares de su hogar, ya que su trabajo es con el único ingreso con que cuenta su familia, trabaja todo el día, desde muy temprano. El principal insumo para elaborar las diferentes piezas es la madera, así como también el barniz con el cual le da un terminado y acabado fino obteniendo de esta manera un producto final listo para comercializarlo. El señor necesita comprar materiales de trabajo para seguir elaborando sus piezas de madera.

loans.use: Buy supplies for carpentry business.

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Chérifatou K. was born on August 12, 1980 in Atakpamé, a town about 100 miles north of Lomé. She is married and has three children. Mrs. K. sells toothpaste and deodorant at Lomé’s main market, a business she has conducted since 2000. She wishes to use this loan of FCFA 500,000 to buy 24 cases of toothpaste and three cases of deodorant from a new shipment of merchandise in Ghana in order to supplement her stock and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Chérifatou est née le 12 août 1980 à Atakpamé, ville située à 165 km au nord de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Madame K. Chérifatou est revendeuse de pâtes dentifrices et de déodorants au grand marché de Lomé, activité qu’elle mène depuis l’année 2000. Elle désire avec ce crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter au Ghana vingt quatre quartons de pâtes dentifrices et trois cartons de déodorant d’un nouvel arrivage pour augmenter son stock et mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste and deodorant

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a very young man who already has the responsibility of supporting a family of four members who depend on his handcrafted work. He has been manufacturing carpets and blankets for the past 5 years. They have a lot demand and he commercializes them in the area where he lives. Due to the pressing needs that Víctor and his family are going through, has led him to offer his products in the capital of his country. He has noticed that the demand and the selling prices are higher in this city according to the innovation of his products. He has in mind to increase his working capital to obtain a bigger profit and to stabilize the economy of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor, es una persona muy joven que tiene ya la responsabilidad de mantener una familia de cuatro miembros los cuales dependen de su trabajo artesanal, desde hace 5 años viene dedicándose a la fabricación de tapices y mantas de mucha demanda y muy comercializadas en la zona que habita. Las duras necesidades que atraviesa Víctor en su familia lo ha llevado a tener que ofertar sus productos en la capital de su país, ha observado que la acogido y costo en esta ciudad se incrementa de acuerdo a la novedad de sus productos y tiene en mente incrementar su capital de trabajo para obtener mayores ganancias y estabilizar la economía de su querido hogar.

loans.use: Increase working capital to be able to increase his production.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is married and has three children. She began her business out of economic necessity since her husband's salary didn't allow them to get ahead and so she put herself to work. Four years ago, she began selling catalog cosmetics to her neighbors and family members until she began to work directly for an important worldwide cosmetics company.

Gloria needs a loan of US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and fulfill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio por necesidad economica dado que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para salir adelante y se puso a trabajar por su cuenta. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo entre sus vecinos y familiares, hasta trabajar directo para una importante empresa de cosmeticos a nivel mundial.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes, ademas de estucheros para venta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Zebonisso.

texts.ru:
Zebonisso K. lives in the town of Vakhsh. She is 40 years old, married, with four children. She has a secondary education. She buys and sells children's shoes, and has a small shop at the local market. She has over ten years experience in the field. At the moment, the client is supporting her whole family by herself, since at the moment her husband is not working. Zabonisso wants to buy summer shoes wholesale, and she needs money for this. That's why she's decided to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Курбонова Зебонисо жительница района Вахш.Возраст 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Занимается куплей продажей детской обуви.На местном рынке имеет небольшой магазин. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 10 лет. В данный момент клиентка содержит всю семью сама,так как муж в данный момент не работает.Зебониссо хочет закупить летнюю обувь у оптовых поставщиков, для чего ей нужны деньги.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase the variety of products sold.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí used to be a domestic employee, but she left this job and decided to start a store in her home. For 4 years, she has sold various products such as basic goods, groceries, clothing, and decorations. Noemí also likes to cook. For 10 years, she has cooked at events or parties where they hire her. She has used the loans she has requested to buy more of the merchandise that her business needs. She would like to expand her store and to start a clothing store in the middle of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Noemí era empleada doméstica, pero luego dejó esta actividad y decidió poner una bodega-bazar en su casa. Es así que desde hace 4 años, ella vende diversos productos, entre artículos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, ropa y adornos. Asimismo, a Noemí le gusta cocinar, por lo que desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a cocinar en eventos o fiestas donde la contratan. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado para aumentar la mercadería que su negocio necesita. A ella le gustaría agrandar más su bodega-bazar y poner una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.

loans.use: To buy more of the merchandise that her business needs

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa R., age 45, is married with 5 children (ages 22, 19, 15, 11, and 4). She has a general shop, which she started in 1996. She works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $130.

She hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum G., 58, a single woman living with her niece, sells various kinds of dessert outside of her home, earning a profit of about $2.50 per day. She works in her rice field as well. 

Sum is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her dessert-selling business as well as establish another business selling soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: To expand her dessert business and create another business selling drinks.

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí, el señor Asunción O. se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de refrescos y comida atendido en su propia casa de habitación. Sus inicios fueros muy duros por la razón de que vendía en pequeñas cantidades pero a medida que vino pasando el tiempo fue incrementando sus productos.

Hoy en día el señor Asunción atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir las bebidas y preparar los alimentos para su respectiva comercialización y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito y así continuar en el negocio que es su única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Within the Municipality of Condega in the city of Esteli, Asuncion O. has been selling food and drinks for the past three years from their home. The beginnings were very difficult because his sales were weak but slowly with the passage of time he began to increase the products he could offer.

In present day Asuncion sees the need to acquire drinks and prepare foods for sale, and due to this need he seeks the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan. With the loan he will be able to continue with his business, the only source of income he has to support his much beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and ingredients.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank.

Justina is 57 years old. She is separated and has four children. Justina travels to regional markets to sell vegetables and fruits, where she also buys cheese, meat, and trout to resell from a mobile cart in the city of Ayacucho. She also travels to other fairs to sell cheese and meat and buy grains to resell in the city of Ayacucho.

Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles (US$325) to buy wheat, cheese and meat.

Justina dreams of having a stable business in a fixed location that she herself owns, and of having her own capital to invest in her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Poder. Justina es separada, tiene 57 años y 4 hijos, Justina viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra quesos, trucha carne, productos que venD. D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también viaja a otras ferias a donD. lleva quesos, carnes y D. las ferias compra cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Justina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, queso y carne. Justina sueña con tener un negocio estable, con local propio y capital propio.

loans.use: Buy wheat, cheese and meat

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly tiene 39 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle San Lucas 702 sector Jerusalén, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó secundaria completa y continuó estudiando dos años de cosmetología. Se casó a la edad de 17 años y tiene 2 hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa y juguetes, los cuales lleva a diferentes partes de la sierra liberteña y vende en ferias y mercados. Actualmente está arreglando su casa para instalar una tienda y poder exhibir su mercadería.
El primer crédito de S/. 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en ropa para vender.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en ropa, golosinas y juguetes.
Julia sueña con tener su propia empresa y poner una tienda para su hija.
texts.en:
Julia Magaly is 39 years old is part of the Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza II. She lives at 702 San Lucas Street of the Jerusalem sector in La Esperanza district, in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad department of Peru.

She finished high school and went on to study 2 years of cosmetology. She married at 17 years of age and has two children, both are students. Her business comprises the sale of clothing and toys, which she takes to different parts of the mountains and sells at fairs and markets.

She is currently fixing up her house to instal a store where she can display her merchandise.

With her 1st loan of 300 soles (1 $US = 3 soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she invested in clothing to sell. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will invest in clothing, candy and toys. Julia dreams of owning her own business and having a store for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, candy and toys.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty F. est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de fruits  saisonniers (orange, mandarine, pastèque). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maty F. has been a member of the village association of Mbirdiam for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling seasonal fruit (oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelon). Her income helps her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seasonal fruit

loans.name: Rosana Elizabeth

texts.es:
ROSANA J. D. F., pertenece alo Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” bicada en el Jr. Ica Nº 126 en la ciudad D. Pucallpa del distrito D. Calleria, tiene 49 años D. edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es motokarrista, es socia D. manuela Ramos hace 06 años.

El primer prestamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró materiales para confeccionar adornos pequeños, los vendía ambulatoriamente, pues ellos crean solo para la salta tenia D. toda variedad, adquirió mucha clientela pues los detalles que los ponia eran muy exclusivos y llamativos especialmente para ambientar su sala.

Con este prestamo D. S/.2,800.00 Nuevos Soles, y compro 01 motokar, 01 moto lineal en mal estado, compro repuestos para cada uno D. ellos, arreglo sus asientos, toldera, pinto, ahora estan a la venta, se dedica a comprar y vender motocarros y motos, los repone y venD. con la compañía D. su esposo.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y el gran éxito que viene teniendo con su nuevo trabajo.
texts.en:
ROSANA JIMEMEZ D. F. is a member of the communal bank 'Mujeres Valientes' located in the Jr. Ica Number 126 in the city of Pucallpa in the Calleria district. She is 49 years old, has 4 children, her husband is a buggy driver, and she has been an associate of Manuela Ramos for 6 years. The first loan she received was of s/.300.00 New Soles, with which she bought materials for making small ornaments, which she sold on the street. Since she had a large variety of designs, she acquired a large clientele because of the detailed work she put in them, which maD. them very exclusive and decorative especially to decorate a room. With this 2,800.00 New Soles loan, she is buying a motorcar, a motorcycle in need of repair, parts for both vehicles, as well as fixing their seats, canopy, and other parts and put them for sale, as she now buys and sells motorcars and motorcycles, repairs them and sells them together with her husband. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her and for the great success she is having with her new line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara 01 motokar, 01 moto lineal en mal estado, comprar repuestos para cada uno de ellos, arreglo sus asientos, toldera, pinto, ahora estan a la venta, se dedica a comprar y vender motocarros y motos, los repone y vende con la compañía de su esposo.

loans.name: Tito Francisco

texts.en:
Tito Francisco is a young business owner who is very dedicated to his clients. He has a business where he makes and sells fast food (mostly pizza), and his business has done very well. He has always been a hard worker and when he was very young learned how to make bread at a bakery, an experience that has allowed him to now have his own business. 

Tito has two daughters, ages 3 and 5, and together with the support of his wife his family has been able to continue moving forward. Now, Tito needs capital to purchase a professional oven. With this oven he will be able to expand his business and increase his sales. He wants to give his wife and daughters a better life.


***********************************************************

Tito Francisco es un joven comerciante muy dedicado a sus clientes, actualmente tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de comida rápida (pizza) en el cual le ha ido muy bien.  Gracias a Dios durante su niñez aprendió a ser muy trabajador, y desde muy pequeño aprendió a hacer pan en una panadería, y por eso él ahora tiene su propio negocio.  Tito es padre de familia, tiene dos niñas de 3 y 5 años de edad, y con la ayuda de su esposa han podido salir juntos adelante.  Ahora él tiene la necesidad de contar con capital para comprar un horno profesional, de esta manera ampliar su negocio y poder incrementar sus ventas.  El desea darles una mejor vida a su esposa e hijas.

loans.use: To buy a professional oven for his pizza store

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Greetings from Byumba, Rwanda! Marie Louise N. grows and sells potatoes in the northern part of Rwanda, near the Ugandan border. She works daily from 7 a.m. to noon, which allows her to earn a profit of 15,000 Rwandan francs each month (approximately $30). She has been in business for five years, and currently employs five people to assist her with planting, harvesting, and selling her crops.

Marie Louise is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in the amount of 150,000 Rwandan francs. She would like to use the loan to buy more seeds for planting so that she can increase her crop yield. With the additional profits, she will pay school fees for her children and buy more food for her family. Marie Louise is 37 years old, married, and has five children, ages 10, nine, seven, six, and three.

loans.use: Buying more seeds for planting in order to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Teresa Dorila

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Dorila A. D. P. tiene 36 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito D. Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no tiene estudios debido a que su padre no la quiso enviar al colegio, tiene 07 hijos D. los cuales ninguno depenD. D. ella económicamente. 
Teresa se dedica a la venta D. ropa interior y mercería, al inicio vendía verdura los fines D. semana en las ferias D. Cartavio  y Chiclin, dejo su negocio debido a que sufrió un robo en su casa, luego se dedico a la venta D. utensilios D. cocina el que también abandono para dedicarse a la venta D. mercería y ropa interior negocio que desarrolla en el mercado El Cortijo. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra D. ropa interior. 
Con el crédito D. 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. ropa interior y mercería para surtir su negocio.
Teresa sueña con poder comprar su puesto en el mercado El Cortijo
texts.en:
Teresa Dorila A. D. P. is 36 years old and lives in El Cortijo in the district of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She did not study because her father did not want to send her to high school. She has seven children, none of whom depends on her financially. Teresa sells underwear and notions. Initially she sold vegetables on weekends at the markets of Cartavio and Chiclin but had to stop because her house was robbed. Later she sold cooking utensils but abandoned this business in favour of selling notions and underwear at the market of El Cortijo. With her first loan of 300 soles which she received as part of the community bank “Nuevo Perú”, she bought underwear for retail. With this loan of 500 soles which she will repay in four months, she will buy underwear and notions to stock her business. Teresa dreams of buying her stall in the market of El Cortijo.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear and notions (safety pins, enamels, combs and so on)

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en: Remelyn has been married for one year and she is blessed with an eight-month-old baby. Her husband works in a construction firm as a technician in Cebu City. She receives a monthly allowance for the family's needs. The family stays with her mother at Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She has been a Paglaum MPC member for more than a year and is now availing a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 for her fourth cycle. With regards to her previous loan accounts, they were paid thoroughly and without default. She has a sari-sari store in a location which she hopes will lead to success, with God's grace. She is doing it all for her baby's future. She was interested in Paglaum MPC because it has such good services and programs, especially on their insurance products.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store such as noodles, laundry items, and other inventory

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal   vive, en la avenida America,  de la zona Villa Bolívar de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es un joven trabajador dependiente en una empresa exportadora de muebles de calidad. Donde  se desempeña en el sector armado.
 

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales  para la continuidad de la construcción de su domicilio. 
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives on America Avenue in the Villa Bolívar area in the city of El Alto. He is a hardworking young man employed by a company that exports high-quality furniture. Cristóbal works in the department responsible for making the furniture items.

This loan will be used to purchase materials so that he can continue to build his home. This is his fourth loan with Impro. Impro evaluated his situation and approved his request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Mamunatu says some are in the junior high school while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Mamunatu is a petty trader. She sells onions. She sells on a table top in the market square. Mamunatu procures her onions from farmers in nearby communities at reasonable prices. She also sells plantains. Mamunatu has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables for resale

loans.name: Taki

texts.fr: Taki C., 60 ans est veuve avec 02 enfants  en charge. Son activité est la vente de denrées alimentaire. Elle compte acheter des légumes (carottes, choux, oignons), du jumbo et divers condiments pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Taki C., 60, is a widow raising two children. Her business is selling foodstuffs. She intends to buy vegetables (carrots, cabbage, onions) , Jumbo bouillon cubes, and various other condiments to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana tiene 46 años, es una vecina muy querida y respetada en su barrio, vive sola en su propia casa y anhela tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pasa sus días arreglando bicicletas viejas, las cuales luego de repararlas las vende en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca). El trabajo que realiza es muy bueno y las bicicletas quedan casi como nuevas, motivo por el cual su puesto es siempre muy concurrido. A Juliana le gusta mucho arreglar bicicletas, ya que se divierte bastante con ello, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que realizar todo a mano, lo cual hace que se demore mucho y que su trabajo sea más agotador. Para un futuro cercano, Juliana desea hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más repuestos de bicicletas para realizar mejores reparaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana is 46 and is a very well-loved and respected neighbor in her area. She lives alone in her own home and she hopes to have a better quality of life. She spends her days fixing old bicycles, which she later sells at the Explanada Laguna Temporal (a place where there are markets in Juliaca). The work she does is very good, and the bicycles end up almost like new. This is why her stand in the market is very frequented. Juliana likes fixing bicycles a lot since she has quite a bit of fun with it. She has done this work for 15 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is having to do everything by hand. It takes longer and makes her work exhausting. In the near future, Juliana hopes to grow her business and improve her economic income, for which she is willing to work very hard. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time. She is very happy with her communal bank, and she is is always joking with her fellow members. With the 500 PEN she is requesting, she plans to buy more bicycle parts to make better repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle parts

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, un grupo que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora tiene 57 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos ya mayores. También tiene 13 nietos. Tiene dos vacas lecheras. Ella ordeña a sus vacas, después hace cuajar a la leche y hace quesos, los cuales vende a negociantes. Hace más o menos 10 libras de queso por semana. Ella también tiene cultivos de maíz, pero es para el consumo de su familia y no para vender. 

Rosa Elena está pidiendo este préstamo para poner criaderos de pollos. Su meta para el futuro es poner un negocio de huevos y también comprar chanchos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Elena is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

Sra. Rosa Elena is 57 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. She also has 13 grandchildren. She owns 2 dairy cows that produce the milk she uses to make cheese, which she sells to dealers. Each week, she produces 10 pounds of cheese. She also grows corn, but it is strictly for family consumption and not for sale.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase chickens for breeding. Her future goals include starting a business selling eggs and acquiring some pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens for breeding

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha started her own cafe business selling food three years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings. She is a 29-year-old woman, married and the mother of one child, who is 1 year old. Beatha is a member of the Zawadi borrower group. 

This is Beatha's second loan from BRAC  Tanzania. She requested 250,000 in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Beatha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for a cafe

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a beauty salon called "Signorita" since 2004 and has nine years of experience in this field. Thanks to her business income, she has been able, with her father, to meet the family needs.

Today, Nahida is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additionA. tools to better satisfy the demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Mirmehti

texts.en: Mirmehti R.  owns a small parcel of land. He is 53 years old and has two loving children. Mirmehti dreams of building a good life for his family. He wants his children to graduate college because this will allow them to find better jobs in the future. His wife is a teacher. Together, they work very hard to sustain their family. Mirmehti is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides because this will definitely help him improve his yield.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu C. and Rebecca S., local entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone, who named their group Honest Group. This will be the fourth time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each in the group received a loan of Le 600,000.00, which had significant impact on their lives, enabling them to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re have also been able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu C. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of the group. Forty years of age and divorced, Kadiatu has two children, both attending schools, one is in class VI and the other is in class II. Kadiatu has been selling both soft and hard drinks for ten years now, and she will invest her Le 800,000 loan into her business. She will buy Star Bear (a local brand produced here, Le 40,000 for a crate), Stout (Le 66,000 for a crate), Heineken (Le 90,000 for a crate), Carlsberg (Le 95,000 for a crate) and Goodies (Le 82,000 for a crate).

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Fidelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Fidelina de  50 años de edad, es una mujer casada y con cinco hijos, su esposo es militar y apoya a sus hijos para que estudien y tengan un mejor porvenir, reside en el bario Villa Reconciliación  de Fenotex 2 c al sur, 2 c al este en la capital de Managua, su negocio es la venta de cosmético y ropa el cual desde hace cinco años vende, ventas que inicio con dinero propio en poca cantidad, lo cual opto para aumentar su inventario un financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que produjo clientes nuevos y mejores venta, este es su sexto ciclo y comprara ropa, cosmeticos,perfumenes para ofrecer  a sus clientes. Sus deseos es poder lograr tener una tienda
texts.en:
Doña Fidelina is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her husband is in the military and supports their children’s education so that they can have a better future. She lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación de Fenotex, which is in the southeast section of the capital city of Managua. Doña Fidelina has been selling clothing and cosmetics for the past 5 years. She started her business with her own money by purchasing in small quantities. Later she decided to increase her inventory by utilizing loans from AFODENIC. As a result, she has gained new customers and generated better sales.

This is Doña Fidelina’s sixth loan cycle and she will use the funds to buy clothing, cosmetics and perfumes to offer to her customers. She hopes to open a store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata T. est une marchante de légumes au marché de Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar.  Elle a plus que 5 ans d'expérience sur le marché et elle voudrait bien augmenter son fond de roulement pour élargir son marché.  Elle est marié avec des enfants.  

Madame T. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata T. is a retailer of vegetables at the market in Camberene, a suburb of Dakar. She has more than 5 years of experience in this field, and she would like to increase her working capital in order to enlarge her business. She is married and has children. Ms. T. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) and the Program for the Development of Children and Families (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community, and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can benefit from loans having more flexible terms, as compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in enlarging her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Solidarias " esta representada por el señor Milton y conformado por 13 miembros D. socios muy trabajadores como lo han demostrado en sus dos anteriores tres ciclos respondiendo a sus propias expectativas D. crecimiento y cumpliendo con sus obligaciones responsablemente. Cada una D. las integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios D. venta D. productos como la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida, electrodomésticos, cosméticos y servicios D. limpieza. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio no tienen la misma calidad D. producto que las socias ofrecen por lo que ya tiene una ventaja sobre sus competidores. El crédito esta destinado para surtir sus tiendas,  y compra D. insumos en mayor cantidad. Sus expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Las Solidarias Group, represented by Mr. Milton, is comprised of 13 hard-working members who have demonstrated their abilities in their 3 previous loan cycles. They have met their own expectations of growth and fulfilled their obligations responsibly. All the members run their own businesses, such as selling bread, provisions, fast food, home appliances, cosmetics, and providing cleaning services. They have plenty of competition in their neighborhood, but the competition does not offer the same quality as the group members do, which means that they have the advantage. This loan will be used to restock their shops and purchase supplies in bulk. They expect to obtain greater profits and to be more financially independent so that they can offer their families a better quality of life and a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase eighty sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 10 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, cuenta con estudios secundarios incompletos y se dedica a compra y venta de ropa.
Elsa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2500.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería de ropa.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio capital.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa has been a member of the Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo" (May 3 Community Bank) for 10 years in the Llave district in El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She did not finish high school and she buys and sells clothing. Señora Elsa says that her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles from Movimiento Manuela Ramos allowed her to increase her capital. She is now asking for a S/. 2500.00 loan, which she will use to buy more clothing. Her dream for the future is to raise her own capital. The things Señora Elsa likes most about her Banco Comunal are the savings and the meetings with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 46 years old. She is married and has four children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Hannah works hard to support her husband in providing for their family. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetables, such as tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs, etc. in the market square. She says that she buys her goods from nearby communities. Hannah has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk, so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, called a "ger". His three children all attend kindergarten.
Lhagvasuren owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. His wife used to operate a grocery trading business, but this stopped for a while. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to help his wife restart her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To restart his wife's grocery trading business

loans.name: Alayo

texts.en:
Alayo F. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and beans and is requesting a loan to stock onions, tomatoes and cassava to sell. Alayo is 30 years old and married to a driver. She has a child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions, tomatoes and cassava to sell

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina F. is 38 and married with 3 children (ages 1 - 5).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Rosina has 1 year of experience in this business.  Rosina needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Rosina joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Rosina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana, de 45 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos adultos, quienes son agricultores y la ayudan con los gastos del hogar.

Esta trabajadora mujer se ha dedicado desde muy pequeña a la agricultura, en la región sierra la mayoría de personas trabajan en el campo porque se aprenden de generación en generación. Cuando tuvo sus hijos continuó con estas labores y desde entonces siembra maíz y alverjas, ya que son productos que tienen un alto precio en el mercado nacional. En la actualidad, aunque no tiene a quien mantener, sigue sembrando. Sus hijos le propusieron que descansara después de tantos años de esfuerzo, pero a Maximiliana le gusta mucho trabajar la tierra, dice que ya está acostumbrada a despertarse todos los días al amanecer y cuidar de sus verdes campos. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes, entre ellos está su deseo de sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo la alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de este producto se mantiene muy bien en el mercado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando para salir adelante. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de alverja, ya que quiere continuar sembrando y debe asegurar sus tierras para siembras futuras.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 45 years old. She lives with her two adult children who are farmers and help her with household expenses. This hardworking woman has worked in agriculture since she was very small. In the mountain region, most people work in the field because they learn from generation to generation. When she had her children, she continued with this work and since then she has planted corn and peas. These are products that have a high price in the domestic market. At present, although she is not supporting anyone, she keeps planting. Her children suggested she should rest after so many years of work, but Maximiliana really likes to work the land. She says that she is used to waking up every day at dawn to care for her green fields. She has a lot of plans for the future. Among them is her wish to plant in greater quantities, especially peas, since she knows the price for that product is maintained in the market. This is the second loan that she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make it possible to be able to access credit that will allow her to continue working to get ahead. The money she is asking for she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and pea seed, since she wants to continue planting and she must secure her lands for future plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Roger Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Roger G. trabaja para una cooperativa de ahorro y crédito de electrodomésticos es gestor de cobro, es casado tiene un niño, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, cemento y mano de obra para la  reparación de un cuarto. Es el segundo crédito con nosotros y si le han servido de mucho los crédito que se le han otorgado ya que ha podido ir reparando su casa poco a poco y espera que siempre ceprodel le este financiando para seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Gomez works for a savings and loan cooperative for household appliances. He works in collections. He is married and has one child. The money he is asking for is for purchasing construction materials such as stone and cement as well as the labor costs for reparining a room. This is the second loan that he has had with us. The loans he has had with us have been very useful for him. He has been able to repair his home little by little and he hopes that Ceprodel will always finance him so that he can continue improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone and cement and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 32 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raymundo de 38 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días trabaja junto a su esposo en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra varios productos, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Principalmente siembra papa y alverja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un puesto de venta estable en el mercado, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Martha con MFP, siente que este crédito la ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. A su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old. She is a hardowrking and happy mother. She lives at home with her husband Raymundo who is 38 and her 4 children whom are the drive of her efforts.

Everyday she farms with her husband. With much work she has managed to develop productive land and now grows various products. She also knows all of her products will be of a good quality. They mainly grow potatoes and peas, since those products sell very well in the market. What she loves most about her job is protecting her crops from plagues that can harm them. She has been working in this job for 20 years and the most difficult part is transporting her products to the wholesale market in the city. For the future, she hopes to save up enough money to buy a stand in the market since currently she sells by foot.

This is Martha's seventh loan with MFP. She feels that this loan will help her develop her plans. In turn, she is proud to be a responsible member of her communal bank. The 3000 soles will be used to improve her crops by buying fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Fundo el Médano, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a la altura del kilometro 5 de la carretera Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, frutas, verduras y demás productos de uso diario en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la ubicación de la zona, que está bastante alejada tanto de la ciudad de Lambayeque como de Chiclayo, por lo que agenciarse de productos de primera necesidad es bastante complicado.

María trata de brindarle a sus clientes productos frescos, por ello viaja a la ciudad de Chiclayo dos veces por semana para comprar carnes y verduras frescas en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) esto ha hecho que su negocio vaya creciendo durante el tiempo que lleva funcionando. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y para ayudar a sostener a su familia.

Maria Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. María ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución ya demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the "Fundo el Médano" sector, in the rural area of the Lambayeque district, located 5 kilometers above the Chiclayo – Lambayeque road. For the past year she's been selling basic need items, groceries, fruit, vegetables, and other daily use products. She runs her small store out of her home. Her business does very well, given the zone's location, which is located far from the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo. The distance also makes products sales complicated. María tries to bring her customers fresh products, so she travels to the city of Chiclayo two times per week to buy meats and vegetables in the Moshoqueque market (the main marketplace). This has allowed her business to grow. She uses the income for personal expenses and to help support her family. María would like to expand her business by buying more products in order to be able to satisfy her customers' needs. She has requested this 1,000 PEN ($350) loan through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her objective. She is a hard working woman, dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue to work to provide a better quality of life for her family. María has worked with our institution in the past and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: Fundo El Médano, Carretera Chiclayo - Lambayeque,

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is 43 years old. She sells different types of vegetable from her rented kiosk at the busy local market. She sells to people who come to buy things for their cooking, and she usually generates about $5 each day. Mrs. P. is a good mother to her six children, who are all single. Two of them who are no longer in school work in the construction sector, while the other four attend school. She also relies on the income from the family's other earner – her husband who works as a building foreman.
Mrs. P. finds it hard traveling frequently. She has been planning to buy a vehicle for a long time, but is not able to even though she tries to save up her personal money. She has decided to take a loan of $800 to add to her money in order to buy a motorcycle to provide transport for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mr. Khon Mann Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people make a village bank loan and they live in Cheung Prey Bei village in Kandal province. Mr. Khon M. is the village bank president selected by all the members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Phorn Khoem, are farmers who own a half-hectare of land to grow rice to support their family. Their problem is that their rice field is not prepared on time to do farming. Therefore, to improve production, Mr. Khon M. is applying for a loan to farm in this current year. From this activity, the couple supports three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is an electrician, and the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou B.  jeune marié, 33 ans age père de 04 enfants il habite a grand yoff, un quartier non loin de la caisse membre depuis 2008 il est mécanicien de profession et sollicite son troisième prêt à la caisse pour acheter des motos d'occasion les retaper puis les revendre pour augmenter ses profits et éventuellement sa situation sociale
texts.en:
Mamadou B. is a young married man, who is 33 years old and father to four children. He lives in Grand Yoff, a district that is not far from the savings bank. He has been a member of this savings bank since 2008. He is a mechanic by profession and is requesting a third loan from the savings bank to buy second hand motorbikes to do up and then resell, in order to increase his profits and potentially his social situation.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vehicles and second-hand motorbikes to do up and resell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 43 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 14 y 18 años de edad en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La separación de su esposo le motivó a trabajar para ganarse el sustento de sus hijas. Se dedica principalmente a la comercialización de animales: todos los miércoles viaja hacia los caseríos de la zona y compra aves de corral (patos, pavos) que luego vende a los comerciantes de carne del mercado de la ciudad. Ella sacrifica a las aves y las vende listas para ser comercializadas. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de su familia.

De otro lado se dedica a la preparación y venta de vino. Empezó en este negocio hace dos años gracias a que una de sus hijas aprendió el oficio en el colegio donde estudiaba. Marcela fermenta la bebida en baldes de plástico y las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos.

Marcela ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Kiva y con el préstamo que se le otorgó anteriormente pudo hacer progresar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, ahora se mantiene viajando constantemente a los caseríos para adquirir animales y seguir comercializándolos. La necesidad de agenciarse de nuevos ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijas ha hecho que solicite nuevamente a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la adquisición de mas animales para ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias.

Ella es una madre que siempre da todo de sí para sacar a sus hijas adelante. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su dos hijas convertidas en profesionales exitosas. En el préstamo anterior ella ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Marcela is 43, separated and lives with her two daughters ages 14 and 18 in the San Martin area of the city of Lambayeque, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Separating from her husband drove her to to work to maintain her daughters. She makes a living mainly through selling animals. Every Wednesday she travels to the rural communities in the area and buys poultry (ducks, turkeys) that she then resells to the meat sellers in the city market. She butchers the animals herself and sells them ready for resale. This business is her main source of income. Another business is making and selling wine. She started this business two years ago thanks to the fact that her daughter learned the process in high school. Marcela ferments the beverage in plastic buckets and then sells it to neighbors and acquaintances. Marcela has worked with Kiva before, her last loan helped build her business and increase her sales. Today she travels constantly to the rural communities to buy animals and resell them. Her need to increase her income to help her daughters succeed is why she is requesting and loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles through Edpyme Alternativa, to invest in the purchase of more animals to increase her sales. She is mother who always gives everything to help her daughters succeed. Her greatest wish is to see her two daughters become successful professionals. She has shown punctuality and responsibility in the repayment of her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals for resale to the local market

loans.name: Motuli

texts.en:
Motuli L. is 38 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Motuli has two years of experience in this business.  Motuli needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Motuli joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Motuli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo, aged 73 years, is a married man with twenty children living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He grows tea which he has sold for thirty years. He has an established tea garden but faces problems of prolonged droughts which affect the expected growth of the cash crop. He wants to see all his children well educated.

He wants a loan to buy manure and herbicides for his tea plantation.

loans.use: To buy manure and herbicides for his tea plantation

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en: Khairullo is 36 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with three children who he must feed and educate. Over the years, he has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. It should be noted that, in the past, this man endured hard economic times for a while, but he's managed to come through thanks to the help provided by IMON International. IMON International has granted him loans that he has used to buy calves, which is the reason that he needs this loan now. The loan will greatly improve Khairullo’s income and his family's living standard. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more calves

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine Y. has been managing a clothing shop since 2009, ordering affordable clothing from the USA and Europe. Armine takes care of her pensioner mother. 

Armine has applied for this loan to purchase autumn clothing stock and pay the customs fees.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing stock

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David   se dedica a la elaboración de bolos ( productos que tienen una forma de refresquitos en  tubo) en la fabrica que se encuentra en su domicilio  cuyo propietario es su tío, el trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 17:00 y posteriormente se va a la universidad a realizar estudios, el cliente proviene de padres separados por tanto aprendio a ganar su propio dinero y de alguna manera  llegar a ser independiente. El dinero que esta solicitando necesita para la compra de una maquina embazadora para la elaboración de sus productos y de  alguna manera llegar a tener su propio dinero invertido, es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
David makes bolos (refreshments packaged in plastic tubes) in a factory located in his home which belongs to his uncle. He works from 8am until 5pm and then goes to his university classes. His parents were separated so he learned how to earn his own money and ways to be independent. The funds he’s asking for are to buy a packaging machine for his products and somehow have his own money invested. He is very hard working and very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a packing machine.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos el mayor de 14 años y el menor de 5 años, residen en el Cantón Corralito del departamento de Morazán; Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace dos años y la forma de vender es a través de catalogo en los cantones cercanos, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de tener ingresos para su familia.
Ella necesita invertir es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos por mayor como labiales, rímel, cremas  y distribuir a los clientes, esto ayudara a que María no pierda sus clientes sino por el contrario pueda ofrecerles variedad de productos de belleza.
Entre las aspiraciones de María están: ver que su negocio crezca, aumenten sus clientes, mejoren sus ingresos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old while her youngest is 5 years old. They reside in the canton of Corralito in the Department of Morazán. María has been selling cosmetics for two years and offers her products by catalog in the neighboring cantons. She started this business out of her own initiative so that she could generate income for her family.

María needs this loan so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk such as lipsticks, mascaras, and crèmes to distribute to her customers. This will keep María from losing customers because she will be able to offer them a variety of beauty products. Her aspirations include seeing her business grow, increasing her customer base, improving her income, and providing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, mascaras, and crèmes

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo H. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. He is 46 years old. Arturo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arturo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arturo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Arturo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Arturo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Luz's Group

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of Sigamok. She is 35 years old. Luz is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone defaults or is delinquent.

Luz is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried goods in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010 Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Liloy-Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cornelia is married and has 1 school-aged child. 

To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cornelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for nail salon business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 23 años y vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos. Hace más de 3 años empezó a elaborar por cuenta propia  fustanes y blusas con diseños típicos de su región, desde entonces trabaja todos los días en un taller que acondiciono en el interior de su casa, teniendo como herramienta de trabajo una maquina de coser. De esta manera es como ha desarrollado su actividad, le toma medio tiempo elaborar estos prendas, ya que le resto del día que le queda lo dedica al estudio; pero los fines de semana sale a vender lo que ha producido durante toda la semana. En todo este tiempo de trabajo, ha visto lo rentable que ha sido su negocio y por tal, espera tener mas adelante otra maquina de coser para que pueda aumentar la producción de estas prendas típicas. Es el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará materiales para la elaboración de blusas y fustanes.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and he lives in his parents' home with his parents and his siblings.  More than 3 years ago he began to make 'fustanes' (traditional skirts) and blouses with designs which are traditional in his region.  He works every day in a workshop which he created inside his home.  His main work tool is a sewing machine.  In this way he has developed his business activity.  He spends half his time making these garments then spends the rest of the day studying.  On weekends he goes out to sell what he has produced during the week.

Throughout his time working, Luis has seen how profitable his business has been and, in the future, he would like to buy another sewing machine so that he can increase his production of these traditional garments.

This is Luis' 3rd loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  He is also happy to be a part of his community bank because all the members are people who he knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  He would like to thank all the people who will fund his loan because it will be very useful to him in making progress in his business.  He will use his loan to buy material for making blouses and 'fustanes'.

loans.use: To buy material for making 'fustanes' (traditional skirts) and blouses

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 35 años, está casado con Delia, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cría y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Los principales tejidos de Juan se basa en tapices, mantas, gorras, ponchos. Desde que tenía 13 años, comenzó a descubrir las técnicas del tejido y bordados, los cuales gracias a su persistencia y creatividad, los comercializa a buen precio en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Los momentos que más le gusta a Juan, son los días que comercializa sus tejidos, pues ve cristalizado los días y las noches de esfuerzo y trabajo. Ahora esté emprendedor joven desea, proyectar sus ingresos en la ampliación de su taller, invirtiendo en la compra de más telares, con los que pueda aumentar la cantidad de sus tejidos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y como integrante nuevo de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho por el apoyo que le brindaron, comprometiéndose a no defraudarlos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 21 kilos de lana.
texts.en:
Juan, age 35, is married to 34 year old Delia.  They have five minor children.  They raise and educate their children in a rented house, which is located in San Pedro de Cajas.

Juan mainly weaves tapestries, blankets, caps, and ponchos.  When he was 13 years old he started to discover the techniques of weaving and embroidery.  Thanks to his persistence and creativity, he sells his products for a good price in the city of Huancayo, where he travels twice a month.

The times that Juan likes the most are the days that he sells his weavings.  This is when he sees that his days and nights of effort and work have materialized.  This young entrepreneur now wishes to invest his earnings to expand his shop.  He will buy more looms to be able to increase the number of weavings.  

This is his first loan with MFP.  As a new member of his communal bank he is satisfied with the support that is offered to him, and he promises not to disappoint.  He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy 21 kilos of wool.

loans.use: To buy 21 kilos of wool

loans.name: Ainura Abdieva's Group

texts.en:
