Ainura A. is the leader of this group. She is 39, married and has three sons and a daughter. Her first son studies at university and the other children are at school. In order to earn money, Ainura and her husband breed livestock. They resell livestock at a higher price after fattening. In this way the family earns 6,000 KGS per month. With this loan, Ainura wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she plans to celebrate the wedding of her first son.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more "African slippers"

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Pakpattan. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it for the past four years.
  
She is a widow. Her husband died suddenly a few years ago. This was a very difficult time for her, but she recovered her sense and started a cloth-selling business to survive financially. Her clients are mainly people from her community who give her regular orders.
  
She has a son who runs a small grocery store adjacent to his home. He earns income through his shop, which offers daily-use items like cooking oils, rice, and spices to his customers.
  
Sheema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his grocery store and increase his sales by fulfilling the demands of his customers. 
 
Sheema is confident that her son will get a better income from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sheema.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Monte Verde y se ubica en la localidad de Benito Juárez Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, se integra de cinco señoras  quien cada una se dedica a diferente actividad.

         La señora Blanca Adali M. Santo, es casada con el señor  José Verneden García V. y tiene una hija de nombre Dayli Rubí de tres años, ella invierte el préstamo e la compra de productos por catálogos  de la marca avon, en donde lleva  un año y once meses   y comenta que le va bien ya que  ha tenido buenos ingresos en su hogar.

         Inicio con esta actividad ya que la invitaron unas compañeras porque a ellas les daba buen resultado y fue como se animo a realizarlo,  hora ve que si es cierto lo que la habían dicho pues está logrando obtener buenos ingresos en su trabajo y hogar.

         De las ganancia que va  obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad y así  se valla incrementado día a con día y logre salir adelante con la ayuda de su esposo que también la poya aportando para que sea de manera puntual en sus pagos.

        Lo que ella desea  es que su con el tiempo logre tener más grande su negocio y con ello poder ahorrar y obtener mejores ingresos en su familia, que para ella  es lo más importante.

        Las personas que integran en el grupo san las siguientes:
Flor de Luz Vázquez Sánchez:   invierte el préstamo en la compra de ropas para luego venderlo en la misma localidad.

        María Celinda García Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.

        Victoria V. López:   invierte el préstamo en la  compra de pollos de rancho  para luego venderlo en la misma comunidad.

        Blanca Adali M. S.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de productos por cátalos de la marca avon.
    
        Guadalupe López García: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de  materiales para elaborar vestidos, blusas y faldas.
texts.en:
This group is called Monte Verde and is located in Benito Juárez, the municipal of Copainala in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. This group has 5 members, each one dedicated to a different activity. 

Mrs. Blanca Adali M. Santo is married to Mr. José Verneden García V. and has one 3 year-old daughter named Dayli Rubí. She is using the loan to buy catalog products from Avon. She has been doing this for one year and eleven months and says that she is doing well and earns a great income at home. 
         
She started this business and since has invited others to participate because she has gotten great results and her achievements are encouraging. Now she sees that if it's true what they said, she will make a good income in her work and home.

The money earned is invested in the business, thus increasing day after day and continues to grow with the help of her husband who also supports her, providing a way to make her payments.
         
She wants to have the time to grow her business and with it she would be able obtain a better income and save more money for her family, which for her is the most important thing. 
        
The following people make up this group:

        Flor de Luz Vázquez Sánchez:   using the loan to buy clothing to then sell in the area.

        María Celinda García Hernández: using the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

        Victoria V. López: using the loan to buy chicken to sell in the community.

        Blanca Adali M. S.: using the loan to buy products from the Avon catalog.
    
        Guadalupe López García: using the loan to buy materials to make dresses, blouses and skirts.

loans.use:
la compra de productos  de lamarca  avon, como son: perfumes, laviales, desodorantes, entre otros.

Purchase of Avon Products such as: Perfumes, Lipsticks, Deodorants, among others.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and lives with three family members. In 2008, Firas opened his own wholesale and retail business for selling chicken. He is well known in his area and has an excellent reputation.

Firas is working on expanding his business by renting the shop next door. He is requesting $2400 loan to pay the rent expenses. He is aiming to increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the rent expenses

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad. Clorinda se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella vende sus productos en las ferias de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Clorinda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas, abono y también para el gasto de los viajes.

Clorinda pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 36 years old and has two children. She was born in the city of Urubamba and still lives there. Clorinda has a business selling vegetables and offers her products at the fairs in the city of Puerto Maldonado. She has been this business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Clorinda is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy seeds and compost as well as pay for her travel expenses.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mainique” which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Clorinda is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and compost as well as pay for her travel expenses

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family currently live in rented flat. 

Boldbaatar used to travel to the countryside to buy raw cashmere from herders and sell it to cashmere processing factories. In 2010 he bought a cashmere knitting machine and started producing cashmere products such as jumpers, sweaters, hats, scarfs and so on. Currently he employs four workers and besides making products, he also does dry cleaning for cashmere products. 

Lately he started renting a stall inside the garment store and to sell his products to buyers directly. These kinds of products are very warm and light and they are in big demand in wintertime in Mongolia. 

Boldbaatar is requesting a loan to buy 14 kilos of cashmere thread to supply his production. A bundle of 1 kilo thread costs around 150 USDs.

loans.use: To buy 14 kilos of cashmere thread to produce clothing.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la mina del limón es una profesora de primaria  la cual tiene 27 años de impartir clase en este lugar y ella tiene 40 años de vivir en esta  localidad hoy se desempeña como directora del colegio Jose de Cruz Mena el crédito lo quiere para terminar de mejorar un cuarto a sus hijo con el fin de crearle mayor comodidad  ella solo tiene 2 hijo al que ha venido apoyando en la preparación academico hasta lograr coronar una carrera, esta señora es el primer financiamiento que esta  solicitando atraves del convenio que ella misma firmo por su posición de director del centro educativo jose de la cruz mena
texts.en:
This client is originally from La Mina del Limón. She is a primary school teacher with 27 years of teaching experience here. She has lived here for 40 years. Today she acts as the principal of the high school Jose de Cruz Mena.

She wants the loan to finish a room for her son, in order to make him more comfortable. She only has 2 children, whom she has supported in their academic pursuits until they found a career. This is the first loan that she has requested as part of the agreement that she signed in her position as principal of the Jose de la Cruz Mena school.

loans.use: to repair her house and buy tin roofing, rafters, sand and labor

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente 1 año Alejandra comenzó con su propio negocio fabricando y comercializando productos de joyería, labor que aprendió gracias al apoyo de su hermano quien le financió un curso de capacitación. Trabaja desde su casa fabricando y vendiendo estos productos y aunque no tiene un horario fijo es consiente que trabajando constantemente no sólo las ventas se van a aumentar si no que la producción va a crecer proporcionalmente.
 
Alejandra necesita capital para comprar insumos y materias primas y así tener un mayor inventario que le permita optimizar sus porcentajes de venta. A futuro desea tener un taller donde cree sus propios accesorios y pueda sacar nuevas colecciones; al mismo tiempo desea convertirse en proveedora de insumos de otras personas que realizan el mismo oficio.
texts.en:
About a year ago Alejandra started her own business making and commercializing jewelry. She learned this craft thanks to the support of her brother who paid for a training course. Alejandra works from home, making and selling these products, and, though she does not have a fixed schedule, she knows that if she works continuously, not only will the sales go up, but also the production will increase proportionally.

Alejandra needs capital in order to purchase supplies and raw materials which would allow her to have a larger inventory and optimize her sales margins. In the future, she would like to have a workshop where she could create her own accessories and new collections. At the same time, Alejandra is also hoping to become a supplier of raw materials to others in the jewelry business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans N. is a 35-year-old father of one. He is married to Ann Wafula. He runs an "Mpesa" money transfer service and has been in this business for the last three years. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET. He intends to use this loan to increase his float and use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

His dream is for his living standard to improve and to grow his businesses.

loans.use: To increase business float in his "Mpesa" (cellphone money transfer business).

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 35 years old and married with five children. All of them are very young and have not started their studies yet. She is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. 

Her husband is a loader by profession and operates a loading/unloading business. He provides his services from his donkey cart and delivers the goods to the designated places. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs to be replaced. He is the only earning person in the family and it is necessary that his business become established. He has been operating this business for the past four years and Nazeeran is hopeful that after the loan, it will start bringing him better profits.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for loading business

loans.name: Elieth

texts.es:
Elieth 
Operación 2011-138
594000 colones

Elieth, es una emprendedora y trabajadora madre de 45 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, maneja la actividad de venta por catálogo, ofreciendo ropa y artículos de primera necesidad a sus clientes, además cuenta con 3 maquinas de coser, con las que elabora ropa que vende entre sus familiares. Además participa en el patronato de la escuela donde estudian sus hijos, tiene el puesto de tesorera, el cual es ad honorem. Es recomendada por una clienta de trayectoria de Fundación Mujer. En las mañanas atiende a sus hijos y realiza las labores de la casa, por las tardes participa en las actividades de la escuela y aprovecha para vender sus productos
Vive en la zona de San Rafael de Heredia, en el Valle Central de Costa Rica, su esposo trabaja en una clínica ortopédica y ambos han sacado adelante el núcleo familiar y desean prosperar y mejorar su situación económica. Su actividad principal es la venta de catálogo, la clienta solicita este crédito para comprar mercadería de contado y poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor sistema de pagos y así incrementar su ingreso, ya que las empresas donde compra no le dan a ella este servicio, limitando sus compras al capital disponible.

Otra situación importante es el reactivar sus máquinas de coser, comprando materia prima para elaborar ropa intima, la cual vende a sus familiares, con esto desea ahorra y comprar una máquina, llamada cover, la cual le da un mejor acabado a la ropa.
El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar mercadería y apoyar a su familia que es de escasos recursos, su moral de pago se demuestra excelente según la revisión de sus antecedentes, y las recomendaciones que presenta la demuestran como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Elieth 
Operation 2011-138
594000 colones

Elieth is an enterprising, hard working, 45-year-old mother living with her husband and two minor children.  She sells clothes and basic need items via catalogue.  She also has two sewing machines that she uses to make clothes that she sells to her relatives.  In addition, she’s the Treasurer of her children’s school’s parent’s association, an unpaid position.  A longstanding client of Fundación Mujer recommended her.  She tends to her children in the morning and does her household chores and in the afternoons she tends to school-related activities and takes advantage of them to sell her products.

She lives in the San Rafael de Heredia zone in Costa Rica’s Central Valley.  Her husband works in an orthopedic clinic and they are both supporting the nuclear family and wish to prosper and improve their economic situation.

Her main activity consists in catalogue sales.  She is asking for this loan to pay cash for her merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better payment plan and increase her income this way because the firms she buys from don’t provide her with this service which forces her to purchase only what she has ready cash for. Another important situation is to reactivate her sewing machines buying raw materials to make lingerie that she sells to her relatives.  She hopes to buy a machine, called cover, that produces a better finishing on garments.

The impact of the loan is highly important because it gives her the opportunity to buy merchandise and support her family which is of limited resources.  According to her background check, her payment behavior is excellent and the recommendations she has show her to be an honest, hard working person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from her catalogues.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 30 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has five years of experience in operating the business.  Besides her shop, she also works as a teacher to earn extra income.  

Pauline has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has learned how to manage her business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  She has requested for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.use: to  buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco” ubicado en Centro Poblado Tahuaco, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 08 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales como ovinos, vacunos y porcinos, también se dedican a la chacra  como papa, habas.  Su préstamo anterior fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace catorce años.
Faustina solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cinco vacas para su respectivo engorD. por 3 ó 4 meses y luego venderlos en la localidad  D. Yunguyo.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que ahorran.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the community bank San Jan D. Tahuaco, located in the village of Tahuaco in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married, and has eight children, who are all independent adults.  She did not attend school.  

She and her husband work buying and selling animals such as sheep, cattle, and pigs.  They also farm potatoes and beans.  Her last loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and she invested the money in her business.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 14 years.  

Faustina is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase five cows that she will fatten for three to four months and then sell in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to improve her livestock and therefore increase her income.  The things she likes best about the community bank are the ease of getting a loan and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase five cows.

loans.name: Veromena

texts.en:
Veromena has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last two years.  She is 47 years old and the single mother of three school age children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Veromena hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 49 años, radica en su ciudad natal con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa que construyo a base de mucho esfuerzo. Aprendió por medio de un familiar a realizar costuras y por la necesidad apremiante de generarse ingresos para su hogar decide  implementar su propio taller. Desde hace 11 años continua elaborando mandiles para amas de casa, siendo su principal herramienta de trabajo, su maquina de coser. Es así que  todos los días trabaja en su taller, que tiene instalada en su misma casa. Su hermana la ayuda en la comercialización de sus mandiles, ya que una vez  terminados los lleva a distintos lugares de la ciudad. Esta forma de trabajar le ha traído buenas ganancias, eso recompensan las horas arduas de confeccionar. Es por eso que desea implementar con nuevas maquinas de coser, así como de otras herramientas para taller de costura. En su negocio siempre es necesario  el apoyo financiero de los proyectos que se propone, es por esta razón que siempre acude a MFP para concretar sus metas de las cuales esta muy agradecida por estos años de trabajo de las que hoy suman 8 oportunidades de crédito. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de telas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Antonia, 49, lives in the city of her birth with her husband and two children in the house she built with much effort.  She learned from a family member how to sew and due to the pressing need to generate household income she decided to set up her own workshop.

She has been making aprons for housewives for the last 11 years.  Her main work tool is her sewing machine.  This is how she heads to her shop that’s installed in her house every day.  Her sister helps her sell the aprons which she takes to various parts of the city once they are finished.  This way of working has produced good profits which reward her for the hard hours spent sewing.  She’d like to buy new sewing machines as well as other tools for her workshop.  

Her business always requires financial support to do the projects she proposes.  Because of this she always calls on MFP to reach her goals and she is very grateful for all the years of work together which to date add up to 8 opportunities for loans.  She will use the requested funds to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more fabric.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia, es casada con el señor Rey David y con quien procreo dos hijos quienes ya están casados.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  de cocos y venderle el agua, en la misma localidad en ello lleva  ocho años y ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello saco adelante a sus dos hijos que afortunadamente ya están casados.

    Lo que lo inspiro en  este tipo de negocio fue su familia para que mejorar su ingreso en su hogar y así también apoyar asu esposo quien es el que se encarga de vender en el pueblo, mientras ella vende tamales  así juntos  trabajar el préstamo y poder pagarlo puntualmente.

    Lo que más desea de su actividad es  que siga trabajando para tener ahorros y con ello depender en la compra de su medicamento que les receta el doctor e su trata miento.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia and her husband, Sr. Rey David, have two grown children, both married. 

Antonia is applying for a loan to buy coconuts for a drinks business.  She has operated the business in the same place for eight years and eight months.  She says that she's happy the business has been successful because her earnings have given her children a leg up in the world.

Antonia started the business for her family because they needed the extra income.  Her husband sells what they make in the town and she sells tamales.  They will work together to repay the loan.

Antonia wants to continue working and saving.  She needs money for medicines that her doctor has prescribed for an illness.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta 5to de educación primaria.
Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales como bordados, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados vacunos y ovinos.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años. 
Con su nuevo préstamo solicitado de S/. 2500.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de diez unidades de ovinos, bayetas y lanas de diferentes colores para matizar.  En el negocio le ayuda sus hijos y su esposo es maestro de obra  (albañil).
Su sueño es tener una casa propia  y que sus hijos sean profesionales.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad, el ahorro y las utilidades.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” ("Women of Juli Making Progress"), which is located in the district of Juli in Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 45 years old, is cohabiting, and has two children.  She studied through to the fifth level of primary education.

She invested her first loan of 300 New Soles in her business selling handicraft items such as embroidery.  She also works raising cattle and sheep.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last seven years.

With the new loan she is requesting for 2,500 New Soles, she will invest in the purchase of ten head of sheep, cloth, and wools of different colors that she can blend.  Her sons help her in her business and her husband is a foreman (construction).  Her dream is to have her own home, and for her children to become professionals.

What she likes most about the Communal Bank is the punctuality, responsibility, the savings, and the profits.

loans.use: to buy ten head of sheep, cloth and wool of different colors.

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora. María tiene 45 años, está separada de su marido pero de esta unión tiene 8 hijos, dos son casados e independientes, dos trabajan para sus gastos, dos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia y es fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio.

Doña María se dedica al cuidado de su familia y está encargada de cuidar a 4 nietos, como la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en casa también se dedica al a cría y venta  de animales como: cerdos, pavos, gansos, cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Nuestra socia se encuentra 4 años en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio como una picantería o un negocio de venta de comida rápida.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Luz y Vida' community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of El Valle parish.  This parish has beautiful landscape.  The locals are very kind and they maintain their parents' culture and traditions.

María is 45 years old and separated from her husband.  She has eight children from her marriage.  Two of her children are married and living independently, two are working to cover their expenses, two are in high school and her youngest son attends elementary school in the town.  María owns the home in which she lives.  It is the fruit of her work and sacrifice.

María looks after her family and also cares for four grandchildren.  As she spends most of her time at home, she also raises and sells animals such as pigs, turkeys, geese, guinea pigs and hens which she sells in her community.

María has been a member of her community bank for four years and she will invest her new loan in buying pigs and pig feed.

María's goal is to own a business such as a small restaurant or a fast food business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Benigna Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Pisaq, tiene 30 años de edad y tiene un hijo (Nil de 10 años de edad). Yolanda vive en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de maíz blanco, haba seca, quinua y trigo, ella desde muy joven se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. Su sueño de Yolanda es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Yolanda was born in the Valle Sagrado de los Incas in the city of Pisaq. She is 30 years old and has a son (Nil who is 10 years old). Yolanda lives in the city of Calca which is where she works. She sells white corn, dry beans, quinoa and wheat. She has been doing this work since she was very young and is doing very well. This time, she is asking for a loan to buy corn, Yolanda's dream is to open a shop where she can sell her products.

The communal bank “Milenium III” meets every thirty days in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist destination and commercial centre and for its festival Inti Raymi. It is also close to one of the seven wonders of the world “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a widow. Mary has a business selling g_nut, maizes and cassava in the hai mahad branch of yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for nine years.

Mary has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more maize and cassava for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more g-nut, maize and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Poima

texts.en:
Poima is 28 years of age and married with two children. Poima owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. 

Poima needs a loan of 1,500 tala to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2010, Poima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Poima's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business. She has three children who are currently studying. She wants to help all her children finish their education, despite the fact that her husband left her. This causes her to strive more and continue earning money through her business. 

She wants to add to her current business such as buying and selling of fruits and vegetables. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy two more hogs and feed. She is looking forward to earning a higher income to save for her dream business.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 33-year-old married woman with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is having her own house, expanding her business and educating her children.She has been selling clothes for the last three years and has earned profit. Her challenges have been seasonal customers and also defaulters. 

Judith needs the loan to buy bed covers, bedsheets, suitcases and women's outfits for resale as she targets the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bed covers, bedsheets, suitcases and women's outfits for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a farmer. She is single and the mother of one child aged 2. She has been in farming for 6 years in her home area of Litein South Rift Kenya. Her farm produces milk and tea for the local market. She says farming is her only source of income for the upkeep of herself and her child.

Joice has requested a loan of 20,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farming income and improve her standard of living. She is confident of this result from her experience in dairy farming for 6 years.

She says dairy farmers face great challenges during the dry season due to the high cost of feed.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 47-year-old married father of two children. He owns and runs a welding and painting garage in Bombolulu, Mombasa. The business has been in operation for two years.

This marks Alfred’s second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money he plans to purchase paint and new equipment for welding and painting. 

With the anticipated profits, he hopes to be able to repay back his KADET loan and to expand his business further. In the future, Alfred hopes to become a successful businessman in Mombasa and to have a happy family

loans.use: to purchase paint and new equipment for welding and painting

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a diligent woman who strives hard to meet her family's needs. She is 59 years old and married. Her husband, Edouardo, is also a farmer who raises crops. They have seven children. 

She wants to improve her farm, but she doesnt have the large capital which is required for supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer which she will use in her farming.

She hopes that the next harvest will be better so she will be able save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to use for farming.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 44 years old, lives in the Airport community, and is a widow.  She was educated up to 5th grade. For the past six years, she has been operating a table market where she sells peppers, rice by the cup, onions, salt, vita. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, vita for her business. Her plan is to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, vita for her business

loans.name: Titomagba Group

texts.fr: TITOMAGBA est un groupement composé de quinze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupement du nom de Bèkpon est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bèkpon est âgée de 53 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Bèkpon est une veuve ayant cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et trois restent à sa charge. Bèkpon vit seule avec les trois enfants encore à sa charge et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Bèkpon vend des produits vivriers (maïs, etc.) à son domicile et dans sa région. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux des enfants à charge. Bèkpon s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Bèkpon et aux autres membres du groupement TITOMAGBA, de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The Titomagba group is made up of 15 people who all live in the same village and are all involved in income-generating activities. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their business activities and better satisfy customer demand.

Bèkpon, the woman with her hand raised in the picture, is the group's representative. She is 53 years old and lives in a town in Benin. She is widowed and has 5 children, some of whom attend school. 3 of the children are still dependent on their mother. She lives alone with them and is the family's sole breadwinner.

For the past 30 years, Bèkpon has been selling agricultural products (corn etc.) from her home and in her local area. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. The income from her business allows her to take care of her needs and those of her children.

This loan will enable Bèkpon and the other members of the Titomagba group to increase their business activity and thereby their turnover and revenue.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn for resale.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: La señora Ninfa es costurera, realiza todo tipo de trabajos de confección. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de telas de distinta calidad y color para ofrecer a sus clientes y realizar su trabajo. Ninfa  es casada y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y también es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en una Institución financiera.
texts.en: Ninfa is a seamstress; she makes all kinds of clothes.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric of various qualities and colors to offer her customers and to do her work.  Ninfa is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with Kiva and also the first time she’s requested a loan from a financial institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 27-year-old single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells items such as Cutex, earrings, braids, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area and her primary customers are residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc. 

Hellen's business goal is to run at least five more such retail stores within five years.

loans.use: To buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be social woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit, such as mangoes, kales, potatoes, onions, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located along a commercial road and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, Cecilia runs a tailoring retail business where she makes and sells clothes to increase on her daily income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the businesses . She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy fabric for her tailoring retail business of making clothes for selling . Her business goal is to venture into the business of a boutique in her home town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the anticipated profits in educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric of  making clothes for selling.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Benna

texts.en:
Benna O. is a widow but not out of HIV/Aids. Her husband died of motor accident in 1988.

Benna cares for eight children. She has another relatives that she is taking care of. The total number of her family together with other dependants = 12 People. She started a small business to help her feed her children and take the to school. Village Enterprise gave her a grant money worth 100 dollars in the year 2003. She used the money well through the skills she got from the several trainings that she has received from Village Enterprise Fund.

She is capable of handling the loan money. Given a loan of 500 dollars, she will expand here business by buying the following items in large quantity: - millet, sorghum, rice, simsim, dry cassava, groundnuts.

She is very active bussiness lady with good customer relations. With her integrity, she will do her bussiness with the loan money successfully.

loans.use: Buying millet, sorghum, rice, and other cereals in bulk

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 44 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, where she started her business in the year 2002. Theresa specializes in the wholesale of rice and food ingredients to her community. She believes that US$800 will greatly help her in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
M. Shahin Jahangir oglu is a 24 year old wheel repair shop owner. He is just newly married and has one baby. He has this business for already two years. He has only very simple and old equipment to serve his clients. It is not sufficient based on his clients' demands. Clients would like to be served on time and in a short period of time. So, due to increased demand for professional services, Shahin decided to purchase some equipment for his business.

He applied to Agroinvest for credit of 1200 USD to invest in wheel repair equipment.

loans.use: Wheel repair equipment

loans.name: Khuy

texts.en: Mrs. Khuy K. is 40 years old and lives with her husband who is 47 in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Khuy K. currently earns $2.40 a day as a street vendor, whilst her husband earns $4 a day as a carpenter. Khuy K. has applied for this loan to improve her husband's business in two main ways. First, she would like to purchase a motorcycle so that he can keep up with current consumer demand more easily and also expand the area that he is able to work in. A motorcycle would also cut the family's expenditure on moto-taxis. She would also like to purchase more wood for the business so that he can expand and meet growing demand from his clients. An improvement in his business would mean additional income for the whole family.

loans.use: Mrs. Khim would like to purchase wood and a motorcycle for her husband's job.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.en:
Leandro is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his in-laws' home in the Sagrado Corazón de Jesús area of the city of La Paz .

Leandro owns a mini bus which generates the income necessary to support his family. He needs this loan to buy a new engine to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living.

He has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and his repayment record is very good. For this reason he is in good standing to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Leandro tiene 34 años de edad vive en casa de los suegros en la calle Juan Paniagua de la zona Sagrado Corazón de Jesús de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Leandro tiene un minibús con el cual trabaja y mantiene a su familia generando ingresos diarios; el crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor y mantener en buen estado la movilidad pues es su herramienta de trabajo, además de poner en orden los documentos de propiedad. Por su antecedente histórico con Impro puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y su record de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for mini bus

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos G. is 51 years old and married to Benicia Gonzalez. They have 6 children, three of them work in a nearby factory and the others are still in school. Carlos is the owner of a small store and butcher shop which he's had for 6 years. He counts on a solid customer base thanks to his good location near the main route into the city.

In addition to the shop, Carlos also has 10 hectares of land about 10 kilometers away from his house where he raises catttle. He is known in his area as a very hardworker. In the future, would like to grow his cattle business, providing the meat to the butcher shops in the area. For now, he is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise such as sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables, dairy products, sodas and sweets for his general store

El señor Carlos G. tiene 51 años, está casado con la sra. Benicia Gonzalez, de 45 años de edad, tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos trabajan en una fábrica de la zona y los otros tres aún están en edad escolar.

Carlos es dueño de una despensa y carnicería, hace ya 6 años. Cuenta con una clientela formada gracias a su buena ubicación, ya que el mismo se encuentra sobre la ruta de acceso principal a la ciudad.

Además de la despensa, Carlos posee una propiedad de 10 hectáreas, que queda a 10 kilómetros de su casa y en donde cría animales vacunos. Carlos es conocido en la zona, por ser una persona muy trabajadora.

Desea más adelante adquirir los elementos necesarios para fanear animales vacunos, y obtener mayores ingresos proveyendo de carne a las carnicerías d la zona. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, aceite, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, gaseosas, fideos, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HIS STORE SUCH AS SUGAR, OIL, FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, SODAS AND SWEETS.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is 57 years old and widowed. Having raised 6 children of her own, she now cares for her four orphaned grandchildren who have lost their parents - her children- to AIDS. Uganda is a nation with an entire generation lost to AIDS, so older people like Jovia are the only people left to care for their grandchildren. It is noticeable how few people there are here between the ages of 35-55. When AIDS hit hardest 20 years ago, it decimated the 15-25 age group, leaving a gap in the age demography for 35-55 year olds today .

Jovia runs a retail store where she sells dried staples such as maize flour, sugar, rice, etc. She has operated this store for the past 13 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past 4 years. She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy more such staples to boost sales.

loans.use: Jovia plans to use her Kiva loan to buy more dried goods for her store.

loans.name: Shell Ii 2085(D) Group

texts.en:
Prossy is 38 years old and divorced with four children. She also cares for one dependant. She has a business selling used clothes. Prossy intends to use the profits she earns to secure space in one of the arcades in town to use as a shop. Mary sells fresh foods in the market. Betty offers tailoring services. Safina is a poultry farmer. Winnie sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Kirangira East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lovisa N.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy chicken mash. Lovisa is 37 years old and is married. Her husband has a sugarcane growing business. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Lovisa makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Lovisa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Lovisa is joined in her small group by Rebecca B., Christine N., Base M., and Zaina M.. Rebecca B. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Christine N. is currently operating a farming business and wants a loan to add more capital. Base M. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to expand business. Zaina M. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
Mercedes and Sonia have been members of the Banco Comunal Firmeza for 4 months and 12 years respectively. In their Banco Comunal they have learned to become responsible, punctual and to save.

Mercedes lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 2 children. She sells food outside her house where there is a clothes market, something which she started doing 4 months ago.

Whereas Sonia is married, 37 years old with 3 childre. Sonia has a restaurant and an Internet shop, both businesses in rented premises. Furthermore, Sonia is opening a bookshop on the main avenue in Ayacucho city.

Mercedes and Sonia need loans of 400 soles and 1600 soles, money which they will invest in buying cutlery, plates, chairs, felts, presents, and painting the bookshop.

Mercedes and Sonia have hopes to give their children the very best, for their businesses to continue to grow, to have their own premises and to have successful, professional children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Firmeza hace 4 meses y 12 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende comida en la puerta de su casa donde se realiza la feria de ropas, actividad que realiza hace 4 meses.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Sonia tiene un restaurante y una cabina de Internet, ambos negocios en locales alquilados. Además Sonia esta aperturando una librería surtida en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mercedes y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cubiertos, platos, sillas, peluches, regalos y para pintar el local de la librería.

Los sueños de Mercedes y Sonia son brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, sus negocios sigan creciendo, tener locales propios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Mercedes and Sonia need loans of 400 soles and 1600 soles, money which they will invest in buying cutlery, plates, chairs, felts, presents, and painting the bookshop.

loans.name: Marlinda's Group

texts.es:
Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia have belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for 8, 8, and 4 months respectively.

Emilia is married, 49 years old and has 3 children. Emilia sells flowers in the Nery Garcia market. She acquires her products from the producers in the Muyurina valley.

On the other hand Marlinda is a single mother. She is 28 years old and has 2 children. Marlinda sells vegetables in a rented stall of the Nery Garcia Market.

Meanwhile Herminia is married, 38 years old and has 6 children. Herminia and her husband are dedicated to growing vegetables in the city of Andahuaylas. They carry out their sales in the same area.

Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia need a loan of 400 soles, 800 soles, and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of flowers, lemons, tomatoes, chili, onion, fertilizer and insecticides.

The dreams of Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia are to build their own houses, to have a store, to buy a stall and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 8, 8 , 4 meses respectivamente.

Emilia es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Emilia vende flores en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los adquiere de los productores en el valle de Muyurina.

Por otro lado Marlinda es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Marlinda vende verduras en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Herminia es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Herminia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras en la ciudad de Andahuaylas, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo terreno.

Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores, limones, tomates, ají, cebolla, abono y insecticidas.

Los sueños de Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia son construir su casa, tener una tienda, comprar un puesto y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy flowers, lemons, tomatoes, chili, onion, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Tutikhon

texts.en: Tutikhon A. is 52 years old and a widow. She has a son and a daughter. Tutikhon is a market vendor and she sells trousers and shirts for men in the local market. Her children help her in the business. Tutikhons’s daughter is pictured in the photo as Tutikhon had left that day for the neighboring city. Tutikhon has been in this business for eleven years already. During these years she has managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating the main income for her family. Tutikhon is trying to satisfy the needs of any client with various tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her daughter as she’s going to enter the university, Tutikhon is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase the new summer goods to sell. With this purpose Tutikhon requests $870 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Tutikhon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Tutikhon’s business.

loans.use: Tutikhon would like to purchase new goods to sell at her men's clothing stall.

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), 35 years old, is a dress maker. Her husband is a construction supervisor. They have two small children. They have taken out loans in the past, all repaid fully. She is applying for a loan of 2,006,000 VND to buy new sewing machine. Their average combined weekly income is 300,000 VND. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers except one.
  • Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035) applies for a loan to uy a sewing machine
  • Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
(This is a repost. This group has been posted [ID of 51516] with an error of Loan Type.)

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Anh chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Trước kia anh chị đã tương vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp và phát triển nông thôn huyện và đã trả hết. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiêm của chương trình nên đã tham gia. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy khâu về may quần áo bán. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là lớn hơn 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy khâu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán . Chị Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037), vay 1.534.000 VND để đi chợ. (Nhóm đã được đăng và có ID 51516 do Kiva cấp nhưng đã đăng nhầm là Loan Type của nhóm là Loan Type cá nhân. Nhóm được đăng lại với thông tin đầy đủ và chính xác).

loans.use: Various businesses

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa used to sell at the market but things didn’t go well. Therefore, four years ago she decided to establish a shop inside her house.

Maria Rosa had worked at a sewing workshop and she also does embroideries, according to the season. p> With the loan she will receive, she would like to buy more products to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María Rosa vendía en el mercado, pero no le fue bien, por lo que hace 4 años decidió poner una bodega en su casa.

María Rosa ha trabajado en un taller de costura, por lo que también se dedica a bordar, dependiendo la temporada. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido A ella le gustaría ampliar su tienda.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her shop

loans.name: Aiah S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. These teachers are: Aiah Saspo K., Zainab K. and Brima Ironnsky T.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,500,000.00. With this loan, Aiah will buy building materials to complete the building of a house he has begun constructing.

Zainab will invest her share of the loan in agriculture. She has been in agriculture for many years now. And Brima Ironnsky will use his to pay his childrens' school fees and other charges. Aiah is the leader of this group; he is now 52. He is married with 4 children. Aiah is today a senior teacher at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni and has been in the teaching profession for over 15 years now.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Sokhom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of eight members who all live in Chrey Bet Meas village in Kampong Cham province.  They each plan to use the loan for a different purpose.  For instance, Mrs. Sam S. is the village bank president and she owns a small field where she grows potatoes.  Since her plantation is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy potato seeds to grow on her field.  Mrs. Sam S. is a widow with three children, one of whom helps her in the field while another one is employed in a garment factory.  The remaining one owns a small restaurant that sells food to passengers.  Mrs. Sam S. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy potatoe seeds for cultivating her field.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.en: "Luz Divina" is a group made up of 10 hopeful entrepreneurs. They are all hoping to take out their first loan, and start to change their situations. Every member of the group is currently living in extreme poverty. None have a steady income. They are all looking to make a change, and want a better life. Diana is the group leader and representative, and says she feels ready to lead her friends in this new challenge. She is a hardworking mother, and wants to better not only her life but the life of her loved ones. She plans on opening a small food stand, and hopes to one day have her own thriving business, and possibly even her own restaurant. The whole group is ready to take this step, and better their lives. On behalf of Diana, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 46 años, ella y su esposo se dedican  a la venta de comida con el apoyo de sus 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad, en un inicio vendía como ambulante en la calles, pero hace 15 años atrás administró un lugar de recreo, ello le permitió contar con un capital y poder alquilar un local y poner su propio negocio  en su especialidad, con ello construyó su casa. Ahora, su local convertido en un restaurante denominado “Doña Cristi” prepara los potajes más exóticos de la selva, la bandeja esta a solo 12 soles, prepara 28 platos diferentes platos de lunes a viernes, y los fines de semana, se incrementa la cantidad, lo cual es más rentable para ella. Lo que es dificultoso es conseguir apoyo para la atención. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita esta vez comprará insumos como el arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. y algunas bebidas que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Gladis is 46 years old and, along with the help of her husband and three children, she dedicates herself to selling food. She has conducted this type of activity since she was very young, starting by selling food by foot on the streets. However, 15 years ago she managed a recreational space which permitted her to have capital and rent a location where she could set up her own business in her specialty. With it, she built her house. Currently, her site is converted to a restaurant called “Doña Cristi” where she prepares exotic jungle dishes. A platter costs only 12 soles, and she prepares 28 different dishes from Mondays to Fridays. She increases her quantities on weekends, which prove more profitable for her. What is difficult is finding help to tend to customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she has always been timely with her payments. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc., as well as some beverages that she is currently lacking.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng Y. is 27 years old and she lives in Trea village in Kandal Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Nut Piny, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Since they cannot support their household well, Mrs. Sokheng Y. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions. She has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Señor Mario  S. tiene 56 años de edad es soltero y vive en una de las  compañía de Carapeguá llamado  Espartillar.   
             Desde los 17 años de edad empezó con esta actividad que  consiste en salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producían con su mamá, después de 10 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a venderla  por las ciudades de Villarica, Caazapa y Yuty. Gracias al  ingreso que  le genera esta actividad  logró mandar  construir  una  pequeña  casa  en donde vive en compañía de su madre ya que  el  se  encarga de la manutención de la  misma . 
                Con el préstamo comprará sobrecamas, sabanas, hamaca.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario S. is 56 years old, single, and lives in one of the Carapeguá neighborhoods called Espartillar. Since he was 17 years old he has gone out to sell quilts made by his mother. After 10 years he became independent and started to work on his own. He brings artisan products from the area and sells them in the cities of Villarica, Caazapa, and Yuty. Thanks to the income that his work generates, Mario was able to have a small house built where he lives with his mother, since he is responsible for taking care of her. With the loan he will purchase bedspreads, sheets, and hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Mario Gabriel

texts.es:
Mario Gabriel Castañeada desea solo empezar con la construcción de un cuarto para ampliarse y tener mas espacio en su casa. Él solo cuenta con habitaciónes muy pequeñas en su vivienda su anhelo es darle comodidad a su familia. Solicita su contribución para comprar material y pagar la mano de obra.
Es un trabajador de maquiladora y es el único sostén de su casa, su mujer es ama de casa y se queda al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario Gabriel Castañeada wants to begin building a room to enlarge the space in his home. He only has a very small room in his home for accommodating his family. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials and pay for manual labor. He is a factory worker and the sole provider for his household. His wife oversees the home and cares for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Meena M. Gulzar Group

texts.en:
Meena baji is a 56 years old lady. She has been a citizen of the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband, M. G., is a farmer by profession. Meena baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver and drives a tractor in the fields. The next oldest son is involved in a milk selling business. Her daughters are single and do household work and taking care of the family. Meena baji belongs to a family of farmers, so she spends most of her time in the fields growing several types of crops. She successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her second son so that he will be able to earn good income from his milk selling business. 

She is a loan group leader of some of the women in her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy chickens to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (electric wires, neon lights and switches) for her electric shop. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan vive en la calle “ Jujuy ”  de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus hijos, ya que se encuentra separado de su esposa desde hace seis años,en la casa de uno de sus parientes como cuidador.
 
Trabaja como artesano en la elaboración de billeteras y monederos de cuero cuya materia prima extrae de prendas del mismo material que se encuentran en desuso y  adquiere a menor precio; los productos terminados los vende en un mercado de la ciudad de la Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materia prima y una maquina de costura. 
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro y el segundo que va vía KIVA, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Froilan lives on “Jujuy” Street in the San Jose area of Yunguyo in the city of El Alto. He lives with his children (he has been separated from his wife for six years), in the house of a relative who baby-sits the children.

He works as a craftsman in the production of leather wallets and change purses. He extracts his raw material from disused items and that he acquires at a cheaper price. The finished products are sold at a market in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy raw material and a sewing machine. This is his third loan with Impro and the second via Kiva. The assessment of Froilan qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of leather and a sewing machine for the production of his leather wallets and change purses.

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es: Martha Leonor E. tiene 30 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, su negocio no tiene ubicación ya que se desplaza de manera ambulante para ofrecer sus productos, Martha comenzó con capital propio el cual lo obtuvo de la venta de 6 cerdos y el dinero los invirtió en una pulpería pero debido a la difícil situación decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa. Los propósitos de Doña Martha son de incrementar sus ventas. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, bolsos y ropa para niños. El sueño de Martha es de establecer una tienda de repostería en su vivienda. la cantidad que solicita es de C$ 15.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Martha Leonor E. is 30 years old, married, and makes a living selling a variety of merchandise. She has worked as a travelling saleswoman for over 6 years.

Martha started her business with the capital she obtained from selling 6 pigs She invested this money in a small grocery store, but due to the difficult economic situation she decided to sell clothing instead.

Martha’s goal is to increase her sales. Now she’s requesting a loan to use as working capital to purchase merchandise like trousers, shirts, skirts, footwear, bags and children’s clothing.

Martha dreams of opening a bakery in her home. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ariyo

texts.en: Ariyo is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. She sells sarongs, lace, and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs, lace, and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, lace, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en su casa. Se dedica a la venta de chalinas y gorros de casa en casa desde hace 6 meses, reparte sus prendas todas las mañanas a sus clientes, y ofrece a todas las personas de las cuales pueda tener contacto frecuente, luego cobra día a día o semanal, según pacte con sus clientes, de esa manera tiene los ingresos necesarios para pagar sus cuentas. Deysi apoya a sus padres en el sostén económico de su casa y su deseo para más adelante es establecerse en un local comercial, donde pueda seguir trabajando de manera más estable. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy segura de compartir  buenos momentos de crecimiento personal al lado de sus compañeras de grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más chalinas y gorras, así como otras prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Deysi is 23 years old and lives at home with her parents. She makes a living selling scarfs and caps door to door, which she has been doing for the past six months. She delivers her clothing to her clients every morning and offers items to everybody she comes in frequent contact with, then charges them daily or weekly, depending on the agreement with the client. In this way she earns an income to pay her bills. Deysi supports her parents with the household finances and her goal is to set up a store later on where she can have more stable work. This is the first time she has a requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she is very comfortable sharing her personal growth with other members of the group. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase more scarfs and caps, along with other clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing items such as caps and scarfs

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Mrs. Criselda C., is 41 years old and resides in Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time a fisherman. 

Criselda engages in oyster (commonly known as "talaba") culture. During harvest she sells her cultured oysters in nearby restaurants and even Dakak Park and Beach Resort in Dapitan City. She also sells oyster in a stall along the street where many people pass by.

loans.use: To have additional capital for oyster culture for food.

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D., 45 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus. L’accès à ce prêt va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en tissus Khartoum et Wax pour  renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Diéba D., 45, is married and is raising 6 children. She sells fabrics. The access this loan will give her will allow her to stock up on fabrics of the Khartoum and Wax brands to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling fabrics

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Marié et père de 01 enfants, monsieur G. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons  de bois, étant un homme et exerçant un commerce  qui est souvent effectué par les femmes, il a une meilleure manière d’attirer et de conquérir sa clientèle. En ces temps où  il pleut beaucoup au Togo, la plus a détruit une partie de son stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois. C’est  avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. G. is married and the father of one child, and he sells charcoal. This is a business often run by women, and he has a better way of attracting his clientele. It is very rainy at this time in Togo, and the rain destroyed part of his stock. Thus, he would like to resupply and he is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. The income he gets from this business enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap B. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

In this plantation, she has some problems because her field is infertile and has a lot of insects causing damage to the crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. She would use the rest of loan to buy gasoline to pump water to support her crop.

Mrs. Pheap B. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Seang Thea, is a hard working man. He is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to buy gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
At only 24 years old, Liezel F. of Purok Kalubay, Palaka Norte, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental, is proud of her accomplishments in helping support her small family. Married with only one school-age child, Liezel is determined to provide for her family since her husband is unemployed.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago to start her business selling condiments and vegetables in her community. She is grateful that NWTF took a chance with her in spite of her age, and helped her start her business and guided her on how to handle her finances and how to plan on the expansion of her business. With the help of her husband, all her efforts and tireless determination have paid off as the business now earns PHP 10,000 per month - enough to support their family.

This new loan of PHP 20,000 is Liezel's 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and she plans to use it as rolling capital so that she could buy more produce from the farms to sell to her community.

Liezel is shown in the photo with boxes of farm-fresh tomatoes and onions ready for transport to her food stall in the market.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. sells palm oil and soup at Elmina near Ntsinman. Doris has received vocational school education. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a teacher.

Doris has been selling palm oil and soup since 2004. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fess and utility bills.

Doris’s loan will be used to buy more palm nuts for oil and to prepare soup. She hopes to use the new profits from the business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for oil and to prepare soup

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana D. is married. She has received schooling through senior high school.  Christiana sells groceries like Milo milk sugar ECT at Elmina near Broyinba, which she has been doing since 1989. Her husband is a saw miller.  Christiana uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and payment of apartment.  Christiana will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Christiana will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Bertha

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal San Antonio de Padua, es conviviente, tiene 42 años, 4 hijos de 20, 18 16, 14 años, los menores están estudiando en el escuela estatal
Sonia se inició vendiendo golosinas de forma ambulatoria, lo dejó por que se cansó de estar por las calles en medio de la lluvia y del frió, por ello se enfermaba mucho, despues empezó a trabajar en la puerta de una discoteca hasta las dos de la mañana, una amiga la animó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, Sonia ahora ofrece los productos a sus vecinas y amistades, ahora esta mas tranquila. 
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra  productos de belleza  en oferta.
El sueño de Sonia es vender ropa en el mercado, porque es un trabajo mas estable.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of Communal Bank San Antonio de Padua. She lives with her partner and is 42 years old and has four children of 20, 18, 16, and 14 years of age, the youngest ones are in a state school.

Sonia began selling snacks as a street vendor, but stopped as she was tired of being in the streets in the rain and cold and used to get sick frequently. Later she began working by the door of a nightclub until two in the morning, and a friend advised her to sell beauty products by catalog. Sonia offers her products to her neighbors and friends and is now more serene.

Sonia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy beauty products on sale.

Sonia’s dream is to sell clothing in the market because it is a more stable job.
