Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products on sale.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr: A. Prisca est née le 18 Janvier 1975 à Agblangandan à Sèmè-Podji,au Sud du Bénin. Prisca vit depuis vingt ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Prisca est mariée à OGOULOLA Félicien, un menuisier. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Prisca et Félicien vivent ensemble, mais seul Félicien assure les charges de la famille. Prisca a arrêté l'école au primaire et depuis sept ans, elle mène une activité commerciale. En effet, Prisca vend des tissus, des sacs et des chaussures qu'elle distribue à ses clients. Prisca s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomè, capitale du Togo pays voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Prisca sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Prisca envisage plus tard ouvrir sa propre boutique pour y vendre ses marchandises.
texts.en:
A. Prisca was born on January 18, 1975 in Agblangandan in Sèmè-Podji, in the south of Bénin. For twenty years, Prisca has been living in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Prisca is married to OGOULOLA Félicien, a carpenter. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school. Prisca and Félicien live together, but only Félicien supports the family.

Prisca had to stop going to school early on and for 7 years, she has been working as a merchant. In fact, Prisca sells cloth, handbags, and shoes which she distributes to her customers. She does her buying in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin, and in Lomè, the capital of Togo, a country which borders on Bénin.

Prisca is a long-time client of ALIDé's, having already received two loans that were correctly reimbursed. With a view to expanding her business and satisfying the needs of her ever-growing clientele, Prisca is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Prisca dreams of opening her own shop later on, where she can sell her merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 3 dozen pairs of shoes, a dozen bags, and 5 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 60 year married woman with three children between the ages of 37 and 40. None of her children go to school, but Christine pays the school fees for her grandchildren whose father passed away. She owns a four room house where she lives with six people. The family also owns rental houses from which Christine provides schooling for orphans. Christine also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from delivery vehicles which bring charcoal from Mubende, one of the villages in central Uganada, past her home in Busega. She owns a wooden store which sells charcoal in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Christine works seven days a week and sells both on the retail and wholesale markets. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. 

Christine's major business challenges include defaulters, the ever increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season which hinders her customers’ ability to reach out to her. Her monthly expenses include feeding her family, medication and water and electricity bills. She has been in this business for over two years and with MCDT for nine years. Christine is servicing her fifteenth loan and has been working with the same group of people. Christine joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because it was easy to work with them. She would like to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to sell only on the wholesale market one day.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: ELFIDA PAULINA B. M. TIENE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 14 AÑOS VENDIENDO TORTILLAS Y AGUAS GASEOSAS, SU NEGOCIO EMPEZO A CRECER Y COMENZO A VENDER GRANOS DE LA CANASTA BASICA, PORQUE SUS CLIENTES LE PEDIAN, ELLA VENDE MAIZ,AZUCAR, HUEVOS, GASEOSAS Y HELADOS, ELLA SOLICITA UN CREDITO YA QUE QUIERE APROVECHAR QUE EN ESTOS MESES ELLA PUEDE COMPRAR MAIZ EN GRANDES CANTIDADES, YA QUE LA GENTE COMPRA BASTANTE Y TAMBIEN LA VENTA DE GASEOSAS AUMENTA, SEMANALMENTE ELLA VIAJA A LA CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR EL MAIZ, AZUCAR Y HUEVOS, LAS GASEOSAS EL CAMION REPARTIDOR SE  LAS VENDE.  ELLA TIENE EL DESEO DE ARREGLAR UN CUARTO PARA ACOMODAR MEJOR LO QUE VENDE, PERO QUE LO HARA DESPUES YA QUE PREFIERE INVERTIR TODO SU CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA ELLA TIENE ENTRE SUS PLANES VER TERMINADA SU CASA Y SIGUE LUCHANDO PARA TENER UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Elfida Paulina B. M. is 52 years old and started her business 14 years ago selling tortillas and sodas. Her business started to grow and she began selling grains from the basic food basket because her customers were asking for them. She sells corn, sugar, eggs sodas and ice cream. She is requesting a loan because she wants to take advantage of the fact that in these past months she has been able to purchase greater quantities since people are buying a lot of corn and sodas. She travels weekly to the capital to buy corn, sugar and eggs; the sodas she can buy from a delivery truck. She wants to fix a room to better arrange what she sells, but she will do this later as she prefers to invest all her capital in the purchase of more goods. She also wishes to see her house completed and keeps striving to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
La familia A. están muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito su negocio ha crecido y han tenido muy buenas ventas.
Nueva mente están solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio ya que desean tener en sus ventas otro tipo de productos como es los lactaos y carnes frías.  Pero no quieren descapitalizar el negocio es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en estos nuevo productos ya que sus clientes se lo están demandando. 
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos a quines les quieren dar lo mejor. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es el señor Guillermo A. y su esposa la señora María Inés Esquivel quines son los que atiende el negocio.
texts.en:
The A. family is very appreciative for your cooperation with the previous loan. Their business has grown and they have had very good sales.

Once again, they are asking for loan to be able to stock their business since they want to have other products in their sales, such as dairy and cold meats. They don’t want to deplete the business, which is why they are requesting this loan to be able to invest in these new products that their customers are demanding from them.

They plan to repay the loan with part of the business earnings since they have three children to whom they want to give the best.

The individuals that appear in the photo are Guillermo A. and his wife, María Inés Esquivel, who attend to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Catherine works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside and also supplies to other retailers. Catherine buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en: Muhaiyo is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. Muhaiyo is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Muhaiyo’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and small cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra B. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Patinio, Brgy Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing, retailing water and fattening pigs. Sandra’s husband, Jerry, works as a fisherman and they have three children between the ages of 13 and 19. All of the children currently go to school and they also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores. Sandra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income with her pig fattening, fishing and water retailing businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of 33,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Sandra is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operation of her businesses and it had a positive impact on the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 12th loan of 19,500 PHP which she intends to use on her pig fattening, fishing and water retailing businesses. Sandra is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda J. faced the challenge of being a single parent to her only three-year-old son, RJ, for several years after being separated from her husband. Now she lives with her new-found partner and, with him, she hopes to face tomorrow’s adversities and give her child a better kind of life. 

Restarting life with her partner, Florinda wants to have a business that will provide them income. Since their town is famous and well-known for handicrafts, she wanted to have financial capital through a loan to start marketing these products to other regions and to the neighboring provinces, including tourist spots, such as Boracay, province of Aklan. 

Transporting products from the Island of Panay (where Antique province is located) is now easier than in the past years before they discovered “RORO" ("roll-on/roll-off"), which are ships (barges and ferries) that carry cars, trucks and buses, as well as passengers.

“RORO” started its operation fours years ago. People of low and middle economic status, businessman, and other tourists take this transportation for adventure and its cheaper fares. It is convenient for transporting products because a person can bring their car with them. Just like passenger buses, cars roll on the barge to cross the ocean and then roll off the barge and travel by land to their destination. The situation is repeated until each one reaches Manila as their final destination.

loans.use: To purchase mats and other handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Agustín Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Agustín C., es de oficio Albañil, tiene su domicilio en el Municipio de Nagarote, ha tenido tres préstamos con CEPRODEL, lo que han sido utilizados en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, la cual tenía paredes cubiertas de plástico.
Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: Cemento, Piedra Cantera, para levantar otra pared de su casa, tiene la ventaja que estas mejoras el mismo las realiza dado que su oficio es albañil.
Con este crédito mejora sus condiciones de vida y seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín C. is a bricklayer who lives in the Municipality of Nagarote. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL, which have been used to improve the conditions of his home, which had walls covered in plastic. Currently, he is requesting a new loan to use for the purchase of construction materials, such as cement and quarry stone, in order to put up another wall in his house. He has the advantage that he himself can perform these improvements since he works as a bricklayer. With this loan, he will improve the living conditions and security of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quarry stone and cement

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Monte Verde del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de tres años a labores de crianza y venta de animales, el usualmente cría cerdos y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Con las ganancias de esta actividad y con unos ahorros que había juntado de su trabajo anterior como peón agrícola logró adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Actualmente se vale de este vehículo para generarse ingresos extras. El ofrece el servicio de transporte en sus caserío y con los centros poblados aledaños. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades las utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

César se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de allimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus cerdos y también para brindarle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil.

El es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario. César ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
César is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Monte Verde annex of the village of Tranca Sasape. This community lies in a rural area within the District of Mórrope, Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

César has been raising and selling animals for more than three years. He usually raises pigs and sells them to merchants who visit the area on a regular basis. Using the earnings from this activity and some savings he accumulated from a previous job as a farm laborer, César was able to acquire a motorcycle taxi for transporting freight and passengers.

He currently uses this vehicle to generate extra income. He offers transportation services within his village and the surrounding areas. The income he earns from these activities help with covering his personal expenses and supporting his family. César is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN so that he can buy nutritional feed to improve the quality of his pigs and also pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

César is a responsible and hardworking young man. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman. He has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi & purchase feed for his pigs

location.town: Anexo Monte Verde - Tranca Sasape - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice travels to Edo State to buy yams and bags of gari (manioc grits) and transports them to Lagos State to sell. She has been in this business for the past 11 years and she is very happy with the nature of her business. She wants to open another shop close to the market so that she can increase her productivity and profitability.

She is married with 3 children and her husband is a businessman. She is 40 years of age and she's very determined to improve the family living standard. She hopes for the loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more yams and gari in a large quantity to sell. This will reduce the cost of travelling far always to purchase inventory and will increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and gari to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco P. de 62 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Su esposa le ayuda en la papelería ellos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad.

Francisco trabajaba en el Banco Central del Ecuador pero por la frustrante idea de ser independiente y tener su propio negocio decidió renunciar a su trabajo y con la liquidación compro unas cuantas vitrinas, arreglo un local para tener su negocio y compro cosas para  papelería.

En la actualidad el esta contento con su negocio porque le ha dado estabilidad económica pero no los ingresos suficientes para poder arreglar mejor su casa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento y piedra para poder construir mejor su casa y asegurar el futuro de el y de su esposa. 

En el futuro quiere mantenerse con el negocio y que pueda tener otras papelerías para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco P. is 62 years old and lives on the outskirts of town in Suburbio de Guayaquil. His house is of cement and has all the basic services. His wife helps him in the store they have. They have four grown children. Francisco worked in the Central Bank of Ecuador but due to the continuing idea of being independent and having his own business he decided to resign from his job and with the severance pay bought several display cases, set up a location for his business, and bought items for the store. Now he is pleased with his business because it has provided him with economic stability but not with sufficient income to be able to improve his house. With the loan he wants to buy blocks, cement, and stone to be able to improve his house and secure the future for himself and his wife. In the future he wants to maintain himself with the business and be able to have other stores for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blocks, cement, stone

loans.name: Lubele South Abanyo Nighty Group

texts.en:
A. Nighty is a hardworking businesswoman of 37. She is married with six children in school. She has dealt in the business of selling silver fish since the year 2000. 

She is using the loan to purchase silver fish and increase her stock. She is a courageous businesswoman who managed to struggle throughout the war period and now her dreams are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase silver fish to increase stock

loans.name: Nighat's Group

texts.en:
Nighat is a resident of Lahore, Pakistan, an area famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. She is the wife of S. K. and the mother of two kids. Nighat is 40 years old and is a very caring lady. She owns a house of four rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years. She and her daughter are both very active ladies, managing the household chores and cooking food for the family on time.  

Her husband and one of her sons are motor mechanics, together operating a motor workshop where they repair every type of vehicle. They have obtained a good reputation among their customers and have been doing this work for over ten years.  

Nighat has successfully completed two loans to Asasah and has now applied for the third time. She wants to invest the capital in her husband’s workshop so he can purchase the repairing tools necessary to expand his motor workshop. This will enable her husband and son to better serve their customers and generate good profit.

loans.use: Purchase repairing tools for motor workshop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year old married man with one new baby born from Lebanon. In 2006, he opened his own barber shop. Despite his young age, he has been working for severA. years in this type of job before opening his own business. He works hard to satisfy the needs of his new family; his story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business.
He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. He remains optimistic about the future and hopes that both his income and business productivity will be increased with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en: Edoh A. is a 50-year-old woman who works selling charcoal. She has two children and is married, but her husband doesn’t work. She started this business in 1995 and has been working hard to provide for her family ever since. Now, she has requested her first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Ete

texts.en: Ete V. is 29 and is married with one child. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Ete needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or approximately USD 213 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Ete joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza F. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Analiza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Analiza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Gracemary

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Gracemary.  She is married and has 3 children; one is working and the other 2 are in school. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her, because she wants them to assist her and to attend school.  In 2007, Gracemary established her pharmaceutical drugs business. She began her business because she needed to help her husband to provide basic needs for the family. She works 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. She earns about 1,723,200 SLL every month from this business. 

Gracemary would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to expand from a drug store to a full-time pharmacy. She hopes to help her grandchildren through school. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 516,960 SLL. 

In the future, Gracemary plans to become a qualified nurse to make her different from other proprietors of pharmaceutical drug businesses.  She believes a brighter future is in store for her and her business. The majority of her patients are little children from poor backgrounds. She plans to tear down the old store and open a new bigger one.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian, es una Ama de Casa que con la ayuda de su marido viene desarrollando la actividad de Venta de Carbón desde hace 2 años, los motivos que la llevaron a invertir en este negocio fueron debido a que en el lugar no existen distribuidores de este producto y hay una gran demanda de los restaurantes, churrasquerias, pensiones, etc. de la zona. Su esposo el Sr. Miguel, Contratista de ocupación, la ha venido apoyando de forma continua en esta actividad a tal punto que en las epocas de escacez de este producto el mismo opta por ir a buscar el carbón al Torno, Abapo u otros pueblos aledaños y cercanos a nuestra ciudad. Doña Mirian acudio a nuestro establecimiento debido a la inminente necesidad de ampliar su negocio necesita comprar carbon por cantidad para  proveer a sus clientes, esto por la gran demanda existente en la zona, y una vez realizada la investigación correspondiente se la acepto como cliente de nuestra institución. la Sra. Mirian cuenta con domicilio conocido en Zona Sureste de nuestra ciudad y ademas de aquello cuenta con un excelente Historial Crediticio a nivel general,esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindo.
texts.en:
Mirian is a housewife who, with her husband’s help, has been selling charcoal for two years. She invested in this business because there are no distributors of this product in her area and there is much demand for it from restaurants, churrasquerías (grilled meat restaurants), diners, etc. Her husband, Miguel, is a contractor by profession. He has been supporting her efforts continuously to such an extent that in times of scarcity of the product he himself goes to Torno, Abapo or other nearby towns to get it. Mirian came by our establishment due to the imminent need to enlarge her business. She needs to buy charcoal in quantity to supply her customers due to the large demand in the area. The customary investigation led to her being accepted as a client of our institution. Mirian lives at a well known address in the southeast part of our city. She also has an excellent general credit history. She is very grateful with the institution for the opportunity it granted her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal in quantity.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Humberto; el tiene 48  años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja como maestro de construcción en la municipalidad de Urubamba y su esposa vende artesanía en el distrito de Urubamba, el socio quiere tener un negocio de artesanía mas grande. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar mercadería de  artesanía para el negocio de su esposa. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Humberto, 48, is married and has two children. He works as a master builder in Urubamba and his wife sells crafts in Urubamba district. He wants to have a larger crafts business so is asking for funds to buy merchandise for his wife’s crafts business. He is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts for his wife's business.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly C., 38, is married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Santo Domingo within Quirino municipality, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Dolly runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Dolly has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Dolly joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dolly is requesting a new loan, her eighth from ASKI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arvie

texts.en:
Arvie A. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Arvie is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Arvie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling personal products such as bags and pouches in the local community. Arvie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arvie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora Q. is 46-years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Purok 5, Brgy. Malabuhan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Dioscora is borrowing PHP 49,500 so that she can increase her inventory. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 49,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dioscora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Jebralyn

texts.en:
Jebralyn L. is from the village of Brgy. Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old. Jebralyn is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Jebralyn owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jebralyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jebralyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jebralyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jebralyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal tiene 47 años, vive con su esposa y sus 7 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, así como también en la siembra de papa, habas y cereales. Esta actividad la desarrolla en compañía de su esposa e hijos, quienes en sus ratos libres, están dispuestos a llevar a pastear a los animales o de llevarles el alimento en el establo. Luego de varios meses, cuando los toros están gordos, ofrece un precio muy alto por su venta, asimismo sucede con los otros animales, como: ovejas y cerdos. Durante todos estos años, estas actividades agrícolas y ganaderas le han permitido sostener a su familia y por tal su deseo es incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Además agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siguiente siembra de papas y habas.
texts.en:
Vidal is 47 years old.  He lives with his wife and 7 children in his own home.  He has been raising and selling animals for 20 years.  He also grows potatoes, beans and cereals.  He carries out this business activity together with his wife and children who, in their free time, are prepared to take the animals out to graze or take their food out into their stable.  Then, after several months, when the bulls are fattened, he offers them for sale for a very high price.  He also does this with the other animals such as sheep and pigs.

Over all these years, these farming and livestock activities have enabled him to support his family.  For this reason, he would like to increase the quantity of animals which he has.

This is Vidal's first loan from MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  He is also grateful to all those people who will fund his loan since it will be very useful for him in making progress in his business.  He will invest his loan in buying sacks of fertilizer to use when he sows his next crop of potatoes and beans.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Betty

texts.es:
Ana tiene 43 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y tres hijos  de 12, 14, 20 años de edad, posee un negocio que es una mini-ferretería donde ofrece diversos artículos necesarios en el hogar como, lámparas, radios, herramientas; el horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 5:00pm, tiene 2 años de existir.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar artículos para la venta como Lámparas, ruedas para bicicletas, bombillos, carteras y accesorios eléctricos, con esta inversión ella espera tener mejores oportunidades para vender estos artículos, atraer a muchos clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio fuerte que ya no sea una mini ferretería sino al contrario sea una gran ferretería que ofrezca a las personas de la zona lo mejor en artículos para el hogar y herramientas, con la intención de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 43 years old and resides in Santiago de Maria, the department of Usulutan.  She lives with her husband and their three children of 12, 14, and 20 years of age.  For the past two years, she has owned a small hardware business where she sells a variety of necessary household items, such as lamps, radios, and tools.  She works there from 8am to 5pm.  She is applying for a loan in order to purchase more items to sell, such as lamps, bicycle wheels/tires, light bulbs, wallets, and electronic accessories.  With this loan she hopes to improve her chances of selling more items and attracting more customers.  She dreams of having a larger business so that it is no longer only a small hardware store, but a big one that offers the customers in her area the best products and tools available for their home, all in the hopes of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase items such as lamps, bicycle tires, and light bulbs.

loans.name: Maama

texts.en: Maama E. is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. She sells bags of charcoal, which she has been doing for the past four years. She helps her husband take care of the family.  Maama will use the loan to buy bags of charcoal to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a bigger store to keep her charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Leiny Cielo

texts.es:
Leiny L. de 35 años, tiene una casa de caña y vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 9, 2 años y uno que tiene recién 9 días de haber nacido. Ella hace 7 años comenzó a trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares con una copiadora que había comprado con nos ahorros. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo hasta que decidió comprar algunos utensilios para tener su propia papelería. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ubico su papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h30pm todos los días vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, láminas y sacando copias a color, blanco y negro. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir con su negocio por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo artículos para su papelería como cuadernos, plumas, grapas, hojas etc. 

Su objetivo es continuar con su negocio porque le ayuda económicamente a su familia y poderlo incrementar con mas mercadería para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leiny L. is 35 years old, has a thatch house, and lives with her husband and three children, ages nine, two, and her youngest child, born nine days old.

She began working seven years ago so that she could help her husband with the family expenses.  She works with a copy machine that they bought with their savings.  Little by little, she began increasing her working capital, until they decided to buy some items to start a paper goods store.

Living in a suburban zone, she placed her paper goods store in the front part of her home.  Now she works from 8:00 am to 11:30 pm, selling notebooks, pens, sheets of paper, and making color and black and white copies.  She has many aspirations to continue her business, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy articles, such as notebooks, pens, staples, sheets of paper, etc., for her store.

Her objective is to continue her business and increase its inventory because it helps her family financially.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Develop and promote its activity of shopkeeping

loans.name: Santiaguito Group

texts.es:
Grupo "Santiaguito" denominado así por que la comunidad en la que viven tiene el mismo nombre: Santiago Jicayan en el municipio de San Pedro Jicayan. A éste grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres humildes y de buenos sentimientos, todas son vecinas de esta localidad.
Todas se dedican comercio, la mayoria al bordado de servilletas y nahuas (vestidos),son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables.
La representante de este grupo se llama Lucia J. A. de 49 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Marcelino Garcia López quien tiene el oficio de policia, ellos tuvieron 8 hijos de los cuales tan solo 6 viven, ella estudio tan solo la primaria.
La señora Lucia solicita éste prestammo para comprar hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas, los hilos que utiliza son: hilo blanco, hilo de seda, dorsal, etc; además del bordado de servilletas ella vende pollo, así que otra parte del préstamo lo utilizá para comprar pollos.
La señora Lucia lleva 10 años realizando ésta actividad y aprendió a realizar los productos tomando un curso. Ella no tiene un local donde vender sus servilletas sino que sale a las comunidades cercanas a venderlas las servilletas que realiza, sus productos son de diferentes tamaños y varian su precio segun el tipo de hilo que utilizan y su tamaño, vende productos desde los 20 pesos hasta 200 pesos.
Anteriormente ella perteneció aun grupo que se llamó "Sangre India" en donde junto con otras mujeres elaboraban el tejido de las servilletas y había una persona que recolectaba sus productos y los vendian a nivel nacional,  pero conforme paso el tiempo el grupo se desintegró y cada quien vende sus productos.
Lucia con los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas lo invierte en un grupo musical que se llama "Santiago" en el cual su hijo el mas pequeño toca la bateria.
Su gran sueño de ella es que su trabajo sea reconocido mundialmente, que personas del extranjero compren sus productos, ya que con gran esfuerzo y dedicacion los realizan.
Ella se siente muy contenta por conseguir este prestamo y agradece a la fundacion por hacerles prestamos a personas como ellas.
Las mujeres que conforman este grupos son las siguientes:
Andrea M. A.: De 59 años de edad se dedica a la venta de Antojitos Regionales.
Carmen V. L.: De 41 años de edad se dedica  a la reposteria.
Cenorina L. X: De 40 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas.
Guadalupe J. X: De 41 años de edad se dedica a la venta de Antojitos Regionales.
Victoria J. L.: De 39 años de edad se dedic a a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Brigida J. A.: De 32 años de edad se dedica a la Alfareria.
Florentina C. Gracia: De 71 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas
Lucia J. A.: De 49 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas
Balvina Bartola A. L.: De 55 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas
Valeria Paula X: De 73 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracion de servilletas
texts.en:
The "Santiaguito" group is named this because the community in which they live has the same name: Santiago Jicayan, which is in the municipal of San Pedro Jicayan. This group is made up of 10 humble women with good intentions. All of them are neighbors in this area. They all work in trade, most embroider napkins and Nahua (dresses), and are hardworking and responsible women.

The representative of this group is Lucia J. A., 49 years old and married to Marcelino Garcia López who is a police officer. They have 8 children, 6 of which live with them. Lucia studied only through primary school. 

Lucia is requesting a loan to buy thread to make napkins. She uses the following: white linen, silk thread, cord, etc. In addition to embroidery she also sells chicken, so with the remainder of the loan she will buy chickens. 

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years and has learned to make the products from taking a course. She doesn't have a central spot where she sells the napkins, but she brings them to the surrounding communities to sell. Her products are different sizes and vary in price according to the type of thread she uses and the size. She sells products for any where from 20 pesos to 200 pesos. 

Previously she belonged to a group called "Sangre India" where together with other women they made the fabric of the napkins and had a person who collected and sold their products nationally, but as time went by the group broke up and now everyone sells their own products.

With the income she receives from sales, Lucia invests in a musical group called "Santiago" in which her youngest son plays the drums.

Her greatest dream is for her work to be recognized worldwide, that people from abroad will to buy her products, and with great effort and dedication she can achieve this. 

She feels very happy to receive this loan and thanks the foundation for providing people like her with loans.

The women that make up this group are the following:

Andrea M. A.: 59 years old and sells Regional Snacks.
Carmen V. L.: 41 years old and works making pastries.
Cenorina L. X: 40 years old and buys thread to make napkins.
Guadalupe J. X: 41 years old and sells Regional Snacks.
Victoria J. L.: 39 years old and purchases chicken for selling.
Brigida J. A.: 32 years old and works in pottery.
Florentina C. Gracia: 71 years old and buys thread to make napkins.
Lucia J. A.: 49 years old and buys thread to make napkins.
Balvina Bartola A. L.: 55 years old and buys thread to make napkins.
Valeria Paula X: 73 years old and buys thread to make napkins.

loans.use:
COMPRA DE HILOS PARA BORDAR

Purchase thread for embroidery

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 50 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Il y a de cela 11 ans, avec un capital de 60.000frs , elle se lance dans la vente des fruits de saison comme la banane, papaye, citron, ananas, orange , avocat, barbadine et tous les fruits qu’on trouve sur le territoire congolais.
Elle s'investit pleinement dans son business, par la qualité de ses fruits, dans le choix qu’elle opère, et les prix qu’elle fixe pour la vente de ses fruits.
Avec le prêt qu’elle va recevoir, elle compte s’approvisionner, faire des stocks des fruits, ouvrir un grand étalage pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Elle pense se prendre en charge et prendre soin de sa mère et soutenir les études de son fils unique.
texts.en: Pelagie S. T. is a 50 year old single mother of one child living in Brazaville Congo. 11 years ago, with 60,000 frs [apprxlilmately 66 USD], she began to sell seasonal fruits and vegetables such as bananas, papayas, lemons, pineapples, oranges, advocados, and other fruits that are native to the Congo. She has put a lot of effort into this business which can be seen by the quality of the fruit she has available, the choice she provides, and the price she fixes for each sale. She is asking for a loan in order to stock up on fruits and provide a large display case for her customers. She will use the profits to take care of herself, her mother and her son's education.

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fruits such as pineapples, papayas, oranges, lemons, bananas

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Emilio, tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Emilio trabaja en una empresa privada llamada “Cerámicas Seminario” donde se dedican a la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo cerámica artísticos, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros, él trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde de lunes a sábados. Ya son 8 años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor.  Emilio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal con el dinero desea comprar cosas para sus hijos. El sueño de Emilio es comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Emilio belongs to the community bank “Los Solidarios” (“The Supporters”) in the Association Arariwa, and he is grateful for the opportunity through this medium, and therefore he promises to make his repayments according to the schedule.

Emilio is 37 years old and he has two children.  He was born in the city Urubamba in the Department of Cusco, and he currently lives in the same city.  Emilio works in a private business called “Cerámicas Seminario” (“Ceramics School”) where he works making handicrafts like, for example, artistic items, decorative items, utilitarian items, jewelry, murals, sculptures, among others.  He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon from Friday to Saturday.  He has done this work for 8 years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  At the moment, Emilio needs a loan for personal use, with the money he wants to buy things for his children.  Emilio's dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy things for Emilio's children

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a fifty-one-year-old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He runs a retail shop and in three years he has been able to increase his inventory. He started with 500,000/= working capital and now it is worth 2,000,000/=. He dreams of owning a supermarket despite challenges in finances. Stephen needs the loan to buy rice, paraffin, and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, paraffin, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "TRIUNFADORAS LEALES D. MOTUPE"

Este grupo trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desD. el 2010 y esta formado por vecinas muy unidas quienes tienen un gran deseo D. triunfar en sus vidas, estan muy dedicadas en sus trabajos y en sus familias, cada una D. ellas tienen un estilo diferente D. ser pero al momento D. trabajar concuerdan en el empeño que dan, y L. motivacion que tienen es ser grandes.
Una D. ellas es Patricia, elL. se dedica en las mañanas a los quehaceres del hogar y a sus hijos, luego por las tardes se dedica a administrar el alquiler D. bicicletas, elL. aprovecho L. ubicacion D. su casa situada frente a un parque para dedicarse a este negocio, diariamente niños, adolescentes y algunas veces hasta adultos alquilan por horas sus bicicletas para ejercitar o solo disfrutar una tarD. paseando en elL., el esposo D. Patricia se dedica al mantenimiento D. las bicicletas, y tambien a L. reparacion D. otros objetos mecanicos o electricos.
Patricia esta contenta con su negocio y tambien algunas veces es elL. quien repara algunas bicicletas, dependiendo del daño que tengan.
ElL. sueña con tener un auto propio asi darlo como alquiler y asi tener mas ingresos para su hogar
texts.en:
Communal bank "The Loyal and Triumphant Women of Motupe"

This group has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad (Kiva Field Partner) since 2010 and it is maD. up of several unified neighbors who are very eager to succeed in their lives. They are very committed to their businesses and to their families. Each one has their own unique style but when it comes to their work they all work with the same level of effort and motivation to grow. 

One of the members is Patricia. In the mornings she takes care of the house work and her children but in the afternoons she manages her bicycle rental business. She took advantage of the location of their house, which is located in front of a park. On a daily basis, kids, teenagers,  and sometimes even adults rent bicycles by the hour to get some exercise or to simply to enjoy  an afternoon. Patricia's husband maintains the bicycles and he also repairs other mechanical or electric items.

Patricia is happy with her business and she even repairs bicycles sometimes, depending on the problem. 

She dreams of having her own car to be able to rent it out and to have another source of income for her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for bicycle repair and to purchase used bicycles

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica a la venta de artesanía, tiene tres hijos y trabaja vendiendo en las escuelas y colegios de San Miguel, pues el reside en esta ciudad por lo que se le hace accesible comercializar en la zona.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, poster, calcomanías, artículos para celulares, collares y pulseras, esta inversión le ayudara a diversificar la mercadería y agradar a los jóvenes estudiantes quiénes son sus clientes.
Sueña con algún día tener su propia vivienda, donde vivir con sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar's business is selling handicrafts.  He has three children and works selling his products in elementary schools and high schools in San Miguel.  He lives in this city and so it is easy for him to sell in the area.

Oscar is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise: posters, decals, cell phone accessories, necklaces and bracelets.  This investment will help him to diversify his stock and please the young students who are his customers.

Oscar dreams of some day owning his own home where he can live with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: posters, decals and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem K. sells various items from her own store in front of her home. She is 29 and married and has been blessed with two children; both are single. Her husband is a truck driver for a small company.

 Mrs. Chem K. is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business in order to earn money to help support her family. She will use part of this Kiva loan as capital to purchase more necessary items to sell. With the remainder of the loan she plans to buy some pig feed and piglets to raise. Mrs.Chem K. and her husband are in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell and buy some pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Otgonmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonmaa is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works for the public service. They live in their own family house which they built two years ago.

Since 2008, Otgonmaa has been running a window guard manufacturing business. She uses her backyard as a workshop. Her main customers are house owners. She buys metal and iron materials from a wholesale place at the market and makes different metal guards for windows with different designs. Her products helps house owners to protect their homes from intruders.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy different metal and iron materials to make metal guards for house windows.

loans.use: to buy different metal materials to make metal guards for house windows.

loans.name: Luz Teodora

texts.es: La Sra. Luz de 46 años de edad vive con su esposo e hijos. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pachacutec. La Sra. es propietaria de 2 vehículos station wagon. Además trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo Agrícola Chapi junto a su esposo. Ella alquila sus vehículos teniendo un ingreso diario. Requiere el crédito para hacerle un mantenimiento general a uno de los vehiculos. La Sra. Luz es una persona muy emprendedora que a logrado adquirir sus vehículos gracias a su trabajo. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos dar a trávez de este financiamiento
texts.en: Mrs. Luz is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has her own home that is located in the Pachacutec district. She is the owner of 2 station wagon vehicles and also works as a farm hand in the Agrícola Chapi farm with her husband. Mrs. Luz rents out her vehicles and gets a daily income out of them. She needs the loan to do general maintenance to one of her vehicles. Mrs. Luz is a very enterprising person that has been able to get her vehicles thanks to her work. She is very grateful for the support that we are able to give to her through this loan.

loans.use: make repairs to her car.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí es socia del banco comunal Las Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva recién 4 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y todo lo invierte en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su tienda de lubricantes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 baldes de aceite, 6 cámaras, 4 baterías, 6 llantas.
No es mucho el dinero que gana pero en algo le ayuda para comprar las cosas que le faltan; su esposo es empleado público y también le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Está contenta porque su negocio está mejorando cada día.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por las charlas que las promotoras dan a las socias, charlas como por ejemplo ¿cómo deben manejar sus negocios?.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the “Las Mujeres Del 2000” (The Women of 2000) Communal Bank in the Calleria district in the Ucayali department.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for four cycles.  She invests all of it in buying more merchandise to stock her lubricant store.  With her new loan for 2,000 soles she will buy three buckets of oil, six inner tubes, four batteries, and six tires.

She does not earn a lot of money, but it is something that helps her buy the things that she needs.  Her husband is a public employee, and he also helps her tend to her business.  She is happy because her business is improving every day.  

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the talks, like how you should manage your business, that are given to the members by the staff.

loans.use: to buy oil, inner tubes, and batteries.

loans.name: Nora Maria

texts.es: Nora Maria tiene la actividad de mercadería en general. Ella tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, Nora tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. A pesar de los problemas que ha obtenido como es su salud, siempre está pensando en mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes y en la calidad de los productos que ofrece.  Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, cosméticos, calzado y otras prendas de vestir. Su deseo es seguir trabajando para tener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Nora Maria works as a merchant.  She is 42 years old, and she is a happy woman who enjoys her work very much.  Nora has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time, because the loans have always been a great help to her.  Because of some health problems, she is always thinking of ways to improve the quality of the items she offers and the service she offers to her customers.

She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase women's clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and other clothing items.  Her dream is to continue working to earn an income that will allow her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and other items of clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last five years. He is 37 years old and married to Beth; they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow, which will supplement his other farm income.

In the future, David hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aguacatillo Group

texts.es:
El Aguacatillo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María quien vende pinol y verduras desde hace 5 años en el mercado. La venta de semanal de ella es de 2,250 aproximadamente. 
Con el crédito comprará maíz, cacao y verduras para el negocio.
Los otros integrantes son Teresa quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años y Ana realiza almohadas y vende semillas de marañón desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The 'El Aguacatillo' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  The group's coordinator is María who has been selling 'pinol' (flour made from toasted corn) and vegetables in the market for five years.  Her weekly sales total approximately 2,250 cordobas.

María will use her loan to buy corn, cacao and vegetables for her business.

The other members of this group are Teresa who has been selling fruit and vegetables for five years and Ana who has been making pillows and selling cashew nuts for five years.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Basilisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Bacilisa tiene la edad de 61 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Jaime que trabaja de Jornalero, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados, uno trabaja y la mas pequeña tiene 14 años y asiste a la secundaria.
Ellas nos platica que desde muy pequeña su madre el enseño a realizar la pasta del mole de cuatro años inicio a realizar su pasta de mole y a vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poso mas de dinero ya que la situacion economica cada dia esta peor y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella realiza su venta los dias lunes, martes y miercoles, tambien nos comenta que una vez a la semana realiza una venta de tamales.
Ella necesita esta credito para invertir en la compra de variedad de chiles, galletas, azucar, sal, semillas, platanos, chocolates, ajonjoli, aceite, tortillas, ajo, cebolla y tomates, para la elaboracion de la pasta del mole y posteriormente salir a venderlo. 
Doña Maria espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea poder dar mas educacion a su hija y poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Basilisa is 61.  She studied up to high school and is married to Jaime, who works as a newsagent.  They have 4 children, two of whom are already married; one other is working, and the youngest is a daughter of 14 who goes to high school.  

Her children tell us that from an early age, their mother taught them to make mole paste.  Four years ago, she started making her mole paste and selling it house to house to her friends and neighbors in the community to make a little extra money, since the economic situation gets worse every day, and this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesday, and she she also makes and sells tamales once a week.

Maria Basilisa needs this loan to invest in buying different types of chiles, biscuits, sugar, salt, pumpkin seeds, bananas, chocolates, sesame seeds, oil, tortillas, garlic, onions, and tomatoes to make the mole paste and then go out and sell it.

Doña Maria hopes this loan will help her business to prospser so she can support her daughter to get more education and so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: sell mole and tamales.

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive el Señor Luis, tiene 22 años de edad, está casado pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa. Lleva dos ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le b rinda la institución.

Nuestro amigo se dedica a la agricultura y los trabajos en el campo pero en la casa donde vive tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles, allí vende todo  tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.  Allí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa que es quien pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en el negocio ya que él tiene que dedicarse a la agricultura. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, sus sueños son tener una casa propia y una gran tienda bien surtida.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
The Ayacucho parish in the Santa Ana canton is known for its beautiful fresh water resorts.  They are a popular tourist attraction in the canton and the province.   This is where the communal bank Damas de Agua Fría meets monthly.  

This is also where Señor Luis lives.  He is 22 years old and married but doesn't have any children yet.  His wife attends to the household chores.  This is his second cycle with the communal bank.  He is pleased with the support the institution gives him.    

Our friend works in agriculture, but in the house where he lives he has a small grocery store.  There he sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.  His wife helps him in the store.  She is the one who spends the most time in the store since he has to work in the field.  He has been doing this for one year and things are going well.  His dreams are to have his own house and a large, well-stocked store.  

He will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, meats and other basic necessity products.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, meats and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock her tire repair and tire sales shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: La señora Maribel  pertenece a la alcancía comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras D. Micaela Bastidas conformada hace mas D. 4 años  y está integrada por 8 participantes, los cuales  son todos vecinos y radican en el distrito D. Ate, un grupo con características D. éxito y perseverancia en el desempeño D. sus negocios, muestra D. ello es la señora Maribel D. 42 años D. edad con tres  hijos menores D. edad  a su cuidado y dependen D. ella para su educación, alimentos y vestimenta. Ella diariamente se dedica a la venta D. zapatos, su stand tiene el nombre D. Marbel, tiene en este negocio 5 años comenzó a raíz D. un familiar que venD. lo mismo. Con el último  préstamo lo invertirá en compra  D. más calzados. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio  a dos stand más.
texts.en:
Maribel belongs to the "Mujeres Triunfadoras D. Micaela Bastidas" communal bank. It was formed four years ago, and is maD. up of eight participants, who are all neighbors in Ate district.  This is a group known for success and perseverance in running their businesses. 

The group's leader is Maribel. She is 42, with three minor children in her care, and they depend on her for their education, food, and clothing.  She works every day selling shoes. Her stand is called "Marbel". She has had the business for five years, and began it because of a family member who sells the same thing.  

She will use this latest loan to buy mO. shoes. In the future she would like to expand her business by adding two mO. stands.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a married woman with six children who are all grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Leila has been operating a food stall for the past three years.  In addition, she also sales charcoal. Her potential clients are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge in transporting charcoal. She dreams of expanding both her businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Leila wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to be able to expand her businesses.

loans.use: purchase charcoal

loans.name: Abriendo Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Abriendo Futuro”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de dulces, repostería, venta de ropa nueva y usada, además de artesanía y picadura de leña. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Johana integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la tercera fila, en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello está peinado hacia atrás. Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva, desde hace 2 años.
Las ventas, las realiza casa por casa a sus amigos y conocidos, también vende su mercadería en el living de su casa cuando junta un grupo de clientes. Su mercadería la compra en el barrio Meiggs, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará zapatillas y poleras para niños.  
Sus metas son expandir su negocio, para esto instalarse con un local establecido, en donde pueda ofrecer y vender su mercadería. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que quiere conseguir una estabilidad económica para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Johana vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 2 años de edad. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que a las demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal, las conocía anteriormente, por lo que existe una mayor cercanía. Respecto a las reuniones del banco comunal, comenta que también han sido un momento de distracción.  
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Abriendo Futuro” and has 18 enterprising members who are in different lines of work among which are candy sales, pastry making, new and used clothes sales, crafts and chopping wood for firewood.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

Johana is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the third row, first seat from left to right; her hair is pulled back.  She has been selling new clothes for the last two years.  Her sales are door to door among friends and acquaintances.  She also sells her wares in her living room when she gathers a group of customers together.  She buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood located in the city of Santiago.  She will use the loan to buy shoes and t-shirts for children.  Her goal is to expand the business to install herself in a fixed locale to display and sell her merchandise.  Her motivation to continue in business is that she wants to attain economic stability to provide a better quality of life for her family.  Johana lives with her mother and her two children who are 8 and 2 years old.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the she knew the other communal bank members previously so there’s closeness among them.  With respect to the communal bank meetings, she comments that they have been opportunities to pass the time pleasantly.

Temuco is the capita of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There is a series of lakeside resorts nearby (Pucón, Villarrica) and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous peoples of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy sandals and t-shirts for children.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
The Sari Mertha group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Pejarakan, North Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp.15,000,000, and each member will receive Rp.1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their second  loan with MUK.

Ni Luh is the head of the group. After her first loan, now she will use this loan to buy four more piglets. Ni Luh would like to help support her family with her pig raising business.   She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as meat.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to renovate her house

loans.use: To buy four more piglets.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single woman who is 40 years old and has two children. She lives in Mtito Andei in Kibwezi where her business is. She is a tailor and has been in this business for 14 years now. Pauline gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Pauline's third loan with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy a solar panel to be used for lighting her house and business at night. In the future, Pauline wants to open a school for dressmaking and tailoring.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to be used for lighting her house and business at night.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 44 years old and has four children, one of whom is in school. Benita is married.

Benita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Benita has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Benita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is applying for another loan to expand his poultry business, this time requesting 40,000 Kes for the purchase of chicken feed. In the future, he aspires to continue improving his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Samson has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed for his business.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is the facilitator of the Muungano group. Benjamin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benjamin takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Benjamin had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benjamin was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benjamin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benjaminn will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.
