In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Benjamin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dorethy

texts.en: Dorethy used to sell ladies jeans, but now sells cloth. She is married to a farmer and has 4 children. Dorethy uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. Dorethy will use her loan to purchase more cloth for sale. With the new profit Dorethy will acquire a shop for the sale of the cloth.

loans.use: purchase more cloth for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Kadiatu. She is married to a driver and has two children, ages 31 and 28 years old. Her parents gave her to an aunt at the age of 5 to be taken care of, but her aunt's husband would not allow a girl child to attend school. They were business people; therefore, they introduced her to business. After she fully matured, she got married and started working on her own business.

In 1991, Kadiatu established a rice and palm oil business. Her suppliers are located in Freetown and Makeni. She transports her items by public vehicle and she buys her stock twice a month. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,413,600 leones (SLL) every month from this business. Her challenges are limited capital to buy more stock and fluctuation in foreign currency. Competition is high, but what makes her different from her competitors is that those who keep their business with her store buy more from her. She serves ten customers each day. Her business is popular because of good customer service.  

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy the following items: Indian rice (15 bags @ 152,000 SLL) and American rice (11 bags @ 145,000 SLL). The remaining 125,000 SLL will be used for transport. Kadiatu hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 2,827,200 SLL. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a house for her children. She feels good about taking this loan, because she will earn more income. This loan will help her to improve the business. She will plough back her profits into the business. Kadiatu is planning to expand and this can be accomplished through adequate utilization of her capital. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Indian rice and American rice

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia, tiene la edad de 45 años, es casado, y vive con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar tijeras, cepillos , secadora de pelo, tintes para poder trabajar mas cómodo en su sala de Belleza, local que ya está acondicionado  para dicho fin, Tiene varios años que se dedica a ésta actividad . Su deseo es progresar  e invertir más para cumplir con las metas trazadas.  Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR, no ha realizado  préstamos en bancos estatales, pero  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus  hijos la educación necesaria para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en: Nidia is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their 3 children who are her first priority.  She wants to purchase scissors, brushes, a hair dryer, and dyes in order to work more comfortably in her beauty salon, which is already air conditioned for this reason.  She has worked many years in this business.  Her desire is to progress and invest more in order to accomplish her designated goals.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't taken out loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with better facilities and the interest rates are much lower.  She also has the desire to give her children the education necessary for them to be prepared for the future and be able to face life with more ease.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, brushes, a hair dryer, and dyes.

loans.name: Saira Cecilia

texts.es: Saira es una mujer de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó hace 6 años con pocas confitería sus principales clientes niños de la escuela llamada 12 de abril que están en la esquina de su casa, su trabajo lo hace con sus hijas se dedica a esta labor todo el día con la ayuda de sus hijas, no tiene dificultades. Su sueño más importante es tener una casa más grande y hacer departamentos de alquiler para los trabajadores de la empresa Nirsa empacadora de atún que esta cerca. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi poder comprar viveres como granos, aceites, enlatados, bebidas etc.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 44-year-old woman who very much wants her store to prosper in the coming years.  Her story began six years ago with a candy store.  Her main customers are children from the 12 de Abril school who are on the corner near her house.  She does this work with her daughters.  She works at this job all day long with the help of her daughters.  She has no problems.  She is single and has two children.

Her most important dream is to have a bigger house and to make rental apartments for the workers of the NIRSA tuna-packing business that is close by.  This is why she wants the loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase grains, oils, canned goods, and drinks

loans.name: Marsa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 07/02/2001. Il est composé par des femmes qui habitent le même village et les village environnants. Leurs principales activités restent le commerce et l'embouche. Les femmes sont solidaires et vivent dans une bonne entente. Marsa, assise à droite de la photo et portant un boubou vert, est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée, et mère de 8 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce.
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter 600kg d'arachide à 700f le kg, qu'elle va transformer en huile. Avec les 100kg d'arachide elle peut avoir 200 litres d'huile. Elle vend le litre à 1000f. Comme activité parallèle elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle va acheter 2 moutons à raison de 50000f l'un. Elle les élève et au bout de six mois les revend entre 100000f et 150 000f selon le flux du marché.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte ouvrir un compte d'épargne pour ses enfants afin d'assurer leur avenir. Elle participe aussi dans la bonne tenue de la maison et aide ses enfants en cas de besoins. Elle épargne aussi pour elle même.
texts.en:
This group of women is part of the village lending group that was created on February 7, 2001. It is made up of women who live in the same village and the neighboring villages. Their main businesses are trade and livestock fattening. The women are united and live in good agreement with one another. Marsa, seated at the right of the photo and wearing a green boubou, is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children, two of whom are boys. She works in trade. 

With the loan, she foresees buying 600kg of groundnuts at 700XOF per kg, which she will convert into groundnut oil. With 100kg of groundnuts she can create 200 liters of oil. She sells one liter for 1000XOF. Concurrently, she has a sheep fattening business. She is going to buy two sheep for 50,000XOF each. She is going to raise them and resell them after six months for between 100,000XOF and 150,000XOF, depending on the fluctuations of the market. With the profits, she foresees opening a savings account for her children in order to provide for their future. She also participates in the running of her home and helps her children in the case of need. She also saves for herself.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and two sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married with two children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a pub from the shop that she rents. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda,beer,local gin,spirits and boxes of mineral water.  She works seven days a week.  She is aspiring of building houses for rent. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy crates of soda,beer,local gin,spirits and boxes of mineral water.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 50 years old, married with seven children. Two of whom are in school.

Salvacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Salvacion has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, school uniform and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is married with six children. Moses has been a fish monger for the last five years.

. He is going to do continue doing fish mongering. He wants the loan money to expand his business such that if he goes to the lake he can buy the fish right from the fishermen. Right now he is doing the business in a smaller way because he goes to Tororo to buy fish from other fish mongers. He wants to rent a truck with his fellow businessman and buy the fish directly from the fishermen -- and cutting out the middle men.

He was given a boost of 100 dollars by Village Enterprise Fund in the year 2000. He has done wonderful training that was organised by Village Enterprise Fund on business skills.

Given a loan of 500 dollars, he plans to expand his business by buying various sizes of fish right from the fishers at the lake shores of lake Victoria in Busia District.

loans.use: Rent a truck to go to the lake

loans.name: Ruby Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ruby is married and mother of 3 little kids that are 5, 3, and 2 years old. She lives in Mérida, Yucatán. Four years ago, she started out helping her mother-in-law sell dairy products and sausage. Later on, with some money and her husband’s support, she decided to start her own business doing the same type of activity. As a result of her work and dedication, she currently has several stands in different markets. Her main goal has always been to help her husband with the family’s expenses, and to be able to offer her kids a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$200 to buy more products in bulk, and therefore to be able to offer better prices to her clients. That way, her sales and income will increase. The time has come to support Ruby and her family, they need you. Become an essential part of their achievements.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Ruby es casada y madre de 3 pequeños de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Hace 4 años se inició en la venta de lácteos y embutidos ayudando a su suegra y después con un poco de capital y el apoyo de su marido se decidió a emprender su negocio propio en la misma actividad. Hoy en día cuanta con varios puestos en diversos tianguis, fruto de su trabajo y dedicación. Su principal objetivo siempre ah sido poder ayudar en el gasto familiar a su esposo y poder brindarles a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS para poder comprar más producto al mayoreo y de esta forma estar en condiciones de ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes, incrementando así sus ventas e ingresos. Es momento de que te decidas a apoyar a Ruby y su familia, ellos te necesitan, vuélvete parte fundamental de sus logros.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mama Vic sells dry fish in her community. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Latafet

texts.en:
S. Latafet Eynulla kizi is a local farmer from Galagayin village in the Sabirabad region. She is 41 years old and she has three children. 
Latafet runs a very small business keeping calves for meat purposes and one cow for milking for family needs.  But she would like to extend her business by purchasing calves for meat production. So she applied for credit of 1200 USD to realize the idea and she choose Agroinvest through which to get this credit. She will spend this fund mostly to purchase 5 calves and mixed fodder for them.

loans.use: To purchase of calves for meat production

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy C. was married in 1986 and has 4 children. He started raising pigs in 2005. His wife is working at the garment factory in Phnom Penh. With the income from his pig raising business, he supports his children so they can attend school.

Mr C. is applying to MAXIMA for the first time. He is requesting a loan of $1,000. He will use this money to buy feed for the pigs and to construct the pig shed to expand his pig raising business. He wants to increase his business so that he can generate more income so his children can stay in school and receive higher educations.

loans.use: Purchasing feed for the pigs and constructing the pig shed to expand the business to generate more income

loans.name: Mariela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mariela de los Angeles is a hardworking woman who has labored from the time she was very young to give a dignified life to her four children. She has only has one child still in her charge, and he is student in primary school.

Her greatest pride is having helped her children become professional men and women, despite the difficult life she has had to endure.

Mariela started a small grocery store, in which she invested $55.00, approximately four years ago. However, thanks to her sacrifice and dedication, and the help of CEPRODEL, she has been able to expand her business and convert it into a small restaurant with daily sales totaling $40.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela de los Angeles es una mujer esforzada, que ha laborado desde muy joven para darle una vida digna a sus cuatro hijos. Hoy en dia solo tiene uno de sus hijos a su cargo, el cual es estudiante de primaria.

Su mayor orgullo es haber logrado hacer de sus hijos hombres y mujeres profesionales a pesar del nivel de vida dificil que la ha tocado sobrellevar.

Mariela comienza su negocio con una pequeña pulperia en la cual invierte US$55.00 hace aproximadamente 4 años, sin embargo gracias a su sacrificio, dedicacion y el apoyo de CEPRODEL, logro ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una comideria en la cual vende diario US$40.00.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica is a hardworking woman who tries to give the best to her children so they can get ahead and not suffer the lacks she is living through now. This is why she started selling shoes among her relatives and friends, and so is able to contribute money to her house to pay the school expenses for her four children, since what her husband makes as a house painter in housing developments is not enough to cover all the household expenses.

However, the winter season is about to arrive and this is when clients buy the most, for Christmas gifts, and so she is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise to have a larger variety of shoes that can be of interest to her clients. With your help, Veronica and her husband will be able to support their children to offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Verónica es una mujer trabajadora, que trata de darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que puedan salir adelante y no sufrir las carencias que ella está viviendo. Es por eso que comenzó a vender zapatos a sus familiares y amigos, y así poder aportar dinero a su casa para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus 4 hijos. Puesto que lo que gana su esposo, como pintor de casas en fraccionamientos, no les alcanza para todos los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo la temporada de invierno está por llegar y es cuándo más compran los clientes, para sus regalos de navidad, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para tener más variedad de zapatos que les pueda interesar a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda verónica y su esposo podrán sacar adelante a sus hijos para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to have a larger variety for the winter season (Comprar mercancía para tener más surtido en la temporada de invierno)

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig is a single man who lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1977. Natig sells foodstuffs (tea, sweets, butter, etc.) in his store.  Natig has run this business for the past 5 years.  Now this young man needs a loan of $950 to buy foodstuffs to increase his inventory and improve his income.

loans.use: To buy additional food to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an enterprising business owner from Pavlograd in central Ukraine. She owns two businesses in two very different areas. Much of her time is concentrated on her clothing sales business. She has a kiosk at a busy market in Pavlograd where she sells women’s clothing. As a side venture, Valentina coordinates a transportation business where she rents small buses called marshrutkas and helps people with their transportation needs. Part of this business involves transporting passengers in the summertime to the Black Sea, a popular vacation destination. In the future, Valentina hopes to invest further in her transportation business and buy her own vans rather than having to rent. Valentina is married with two children in their twenties. Her son is married and is soon to have Valentina’s second grandchild.

Valentina has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase warm winter coats to sell in her clothing business. She has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy to continue helping her with her businesses and look forward to seeing how they develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase cold weather inventory

loans.name: Kyerinda West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zainabu B.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Zainabu is 33 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Zainabu makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and boost business. Zainabu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zainabu is joined in her small group by Aliba F., Aminah N. and Harriet N.. Aliba F. has a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Aminah N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to add to the business and boost it. Harriet N. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand clothes business and increase profits

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has 5 children.  She has been selling firewood for the past 6 years.  Firewood is extremely important in rural villages, because it is often the only way to prepare hot meals.  She is requesting a loan of $425 to buy firewood in bulk so she can receive a discount. Ama is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy firewood in bulk so she can receive a discount.

loans.name: Margarita Micaela

texts.en:
Margarita Micaela V. G. sells and helps manufacture custom shoes and boots in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She works with her husband, who is a master cobbler. They can make any style shoe but prefer working with leather. Margarita and her husband specialize in top quality cowboy-style boots for men and women. They have taken orders and have exported custom boots to Paris and Miami.

Margarita is 70 years old, happily married, and has 9 children. She is in wonderful health and loves her work. She has a lifetime of experience making shoes and has many loyal customers. She loves running her business and helping her family. Many of her children help manufacture or sell their products.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Margarita is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN ($450) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy materials such as leather to manufacture more shoes and boots.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy materials such as leather to manufacture more shoes and boots.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer M. is a 34 year old man who raises livestock in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He started his business in 1988 and this is the only source of income for his family. He is married and has two children. As he is IDP he receives very small financial support from government, but it is about  less than $10 USD per person. So Azer pushes himself to work hard and improve his business. For this purpose he applied for $800 USD to purchase one milking cow.

loans.use: Azer would like to purchase one milking cow.

loans.name: Oihanet

texts.es:
Oihanet is from the Putina district. When she became a single parent, Oihanet decided to open her own business, selling bread, cheese, and meat at the Rinconada mine. The mine is frigid and far from her hometown, but Oihanet makes sacrifices to undergo constant long journeys to transport her merchandise to the people of Rinconada. This hard-working mom perseveres out of love for her son, and is prepared to dedicate all of her energy to the business. Oihanet is planning to increase her capital to invest in flour and other supplies to make her delicious bread. Oihanet hopes to appeal to your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Oihanet, es natural del distrito de Putina, desde que se convirtió en padre y madre de su hijo, decidió emprender su negocio de venta de pan, queso y carne en la mina Rinconada, lugar muy frígido y distante de su ciudad natal.Este trabajo le resulta muy sacrificado a Oihanet, porque constantemente tiene que emprender largos y pesados viajes para llevar su mercadería y ofrecerlos a los habitantes de dicha localidad, esta trabajadora madre por amor a su hijo está dispuesta a seguir adelante poniendo su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación en su negocio, para ello tiene planeado aumentar el monto de su capital, dinero que invertirá para adquirir harina e insumos para la preparación de sus delicioso panes. Oihanet espera sensibilizar tu generoso corazón.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production of bread.

loans.name: Sithouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithouk P., 40, and her husband, Mr. Kimhok Va, 42, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of her children are in the local school and the first daughter sells desserts at home.

Mrs. Sithouk has been a silk weaver for seventeen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor, while Mr. Kimhok is a mason and assists his wife to weave silk at home when he is free from his construction work. Sithouk sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Mollebamba Group

texts.es:
The community of Mollebamba is located approximately 15 minutes from Cangallo. A total of 30 families live in this community. Most of them are wheat and vegetable farmers. This community has access to the town fairs in Cangallo, Pampa and Ayacucho.

Catalina Oré buys wheat products and vegetables to sell in Ayacucho with the help of her son and her husband. She also has a restaurant in Huahua Puquio and a small grocery stO.. She buys her merchandise in Ayacucho and sells them at the local fairs in other communities nearby. Her children go to school in the city of Ayacucho. She would like for them to have a better future. She would like to save some money to proviD. a better education for her kids. She likes what she does and her family is doing fine but she would like to go to the city to proviD. a much better education for her children. Catalina is a new member with Finca Perú and would like to have some savings. She wants to learn how to love and value herself.

Felicitas T. has a small grocery stO., raises guinea pigs and she sells fruit in Pampa Cangallo where she buys cheese to sell in Huahua Puquio. Felicitas wishes to invest her savings in the college education of her only daughter and to one day own a business. Felicitas has learned the value of teamwork and to share daily challenges with the other members of the communal bank. She has learned how to confront daily problems and not to be afraid of the future.

Toribia has a small grocery stO.. She also buys wheat products and vegetables and sells them in Pisco. Toribia would like to buy a car so that she can travel to Ayacucho to sell her merchandise and therefO. improving her business. She never knew how to save until she joined Finca Perú, but now she has the opportunity and the knowledge to do it. She has learned how to love and to value herself and that she's as capable as a man to run her own business and to make as much money. She currently earns mO. than her husband and she's contributing mO. towards the montly bills.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad D. Mollebamba, esta ubicada aproximadamente a 15 minutos D. Cangallo, esta Comunidad cuenta con 30 familias aproximadamente que viven en la comunidad, los comuneros se dedican a la siembra D. cereales como trigo, cebada, maíz, arveja y tubérculos como papa y a las plantaciones D. Frutales, etc. La comunidad tiene un acceso a la feria D. Cangallo, Pampa cangallo y Ayacucho

Catalina Oré, compra todo tipo D. cereales, tubérculos y tara y los lleva a Ayacucho para comercializar, pero lo hace con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos. Catalina también tiene un restaurante en Huahua Puquío y una bodega, ella trae abarrotes D. Ayacucho y los lleva a las ferias D. las comunidades y/o anexos donD. la gente le compra sus productos. Sus hijos estudian en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Catalina quiere tener el orgullo D. que sean mejores que ella y su familia. Catalina, quiere mejorar su trabajo, hasta el momento les va bien pero quiere capitalizarse un poco mas y hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, pero para ello quiere salir a la ciudad para darles mejores oportunidades. Catalina recién empieza a trabajar con Finca Perú y le gustaría tener ahorros, tambien quererse y valorarse como persona.

Felicitas T., tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, también cría cuyes y lleva frutas a Pampa Cangallo D. donD. trae queso para venderlo en Huahua Puquío Felicitas desea invertir sus ahorros en los estudios D. su hija y también quiere poner su negocio propio. Felicitas desea que su única hija termine sus estudios universitarios. Felicitas ha aprendido que las personas estando juntas aprenden a tener mayores responsabilidades y ser muy puntuales, en su bancomunal aprendió a compartir sus cosas y problemas familiares, ahí encuentra una orientación D. como superarlos y no tener miedo D. las cosas que vienen al futuro.

Toribia T., tiene una tienda D. abarrotes. También compra y venD. tara, cereales y las lleva a Pisco. Toribia, quiere comprarse un carro para poder hacer mejor su negocio, antes D. entrar a Finca Perú no sabia ahorrar, ahora tiene la oportunidad D. hacerlo pensando en su futuro. Toribia con sus ahorros comprará un carro, para poder viajar a Ayacucho y llevar los cereales y así mejorar su negocio. En su bancomunal a aprendido a respetarse a si misma y también sabe que ella tiene las mismas facultades que los varones, en su caso ella trabaja bien en su negocio y tiene más dinero que su esposo, ella aporta más a la casa en los gastos.

loans.use: The members of the communal bank called "The Stars of Mollebamba" are requesting a loan to purchase wheat products and to invest in their own individual businesses.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh S. is 33 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, preserved foods and many others in his grocery store.

Farrukh is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Currently Farrukh has about US$ 1000 in inventory and his monthly net profit is about US$ 300-400. Today Farrukh is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 10 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Farrukh’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful businessmen. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods sold

loans.name: Olga Muñoz

texts.es: Esta Sra. inicio vendiendo ambulante  en todas las fiestas patronales del país,  así logro un pequeño capital, con el que inicio una pulpería en su casa de habitación, posteriormente nos visito y empezó a trabajar con créditos en adim comenzado con un monto de crédito pequeño, ya que había mucha demanda de clientela en el lugar, es conocida por su trato amable y muy luchadora ya que los fines de semana elabora comida para vender en el barrio; ella piensa invertir más en el negocio para obtener más ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores los que le ayudan en sus negocios Piensa obtener más créditos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga began as a walking saleswoman at all the national fiestas in her country, and in this way she accumulated a little capital, with which she set-up a convenience store in her home. Later she visited us and began to work with adim credits, beginning with a small loan, as there was already high customer demand in the place and she was known for her friendly demeanour and her fighting spirit, as on the weekends she makes food to sell in the area. She is thinking of investing more in the business to improve her earnings and make her business grow. She lives with her husband and her two eldest children who help her in the business. She is hoping to obtain more credits in order to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Melisa

texts.es: Melisa tiene 21 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en la casa de sus padres,  su negocio está en un local alquilado a dos cuadras de su casa. Hace 2 años trabajaba en una empresa minera, como secretaria. Ahora desde hace 8 meses tiene su propio negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet y centro de llamadas telefónicas, le esté yendo muy bien porque en su  zona no hay mucha competencia y por ello le es muy rentable. Esta actividad le agrada, le gusta brindar ayuda a los estudiantes que requieran temas para sus temas escolares. El locutorio de llamadas lo instaló hace un mes para captar más clientes. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita, nos dice, es la oportunidad para repotenciar la capacidad de almacenamiento de algunas computadoras, para que funcionen con mayor velocidad.
texts.en:
Melisa is 21 years old, a single mother, and lives with her daughter in her parents' house. Her business is a local shop two blocks from her house. She worked for 2 years at a mining business as a secretary. Eight months ago, she started her own internet cafe and call center. It has been going well so far because her neighborhood does not have much competition, making it a very profitable business. She appreciates her job and would like to support students who require books for their school subjects. She recently installed a telephone booth in order to attract more customers. This is her first loan with MFP. The requested money is her opportunity to increase the data storage capacity of her computers so that they function at higher speeds.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase data storage capacity of computers in her internet cafe

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Kodjo est né le 31 décembre 1971 à Agoè, le quartier au nord de Lomé ou il habite toujours. Il est célibataire avec deux enfants et a pour activité la vente des pièces détachées dans son quartier. Il est un revendeur, et il achète ses produits à la grande marche de Lomé. 
Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 2 moteurs pour revendre et gagner un profit.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo G. was born on December 31, 1971 in Agoè, the neighborhood north of Lomé where he still lives. He is single raising two children, and his business is selling spare parts in his neighborhood. He buys the parts he re-sells in the big open-air market of Lomé.

He has received one loan from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that he is requesting will permit him to buy 2 motors to re-sell and make a profit from.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Señor Cristobal C. de 50 años de edad es separado con dos hijos ya mayores que culminaron sus estudios secundarios y vive en casa propia en el Barrio Pacu Cua hace mas de 25 años.

Cabe destacar que es propietario de una gomería que funciona hace mas de 5 años en el ramo y que realiza su vez servicios de parches y ventas de cubiertas para todo tipo de vehículos por la zona de Encarnación y por la zona de las colonias.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de cubiertas usadas que le ofertaron y quiere aprovechar la oferta de la misma para así poder tener mejor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristobal C. is 50 years old, separated, and has two adult children who finished secondary school. He has lived in his own home in the Pacu Cua neighborhood for more than 25 years.

Cabe notes that he is the owner of a tire store that has been open for more than 5 years in the field. He performs tire-patching services and sells covers for all kinds of vehicles in the Encarnación and the Las Colonias zones.

The loan he is requesting is to buy used covers that were offered to him and that he wants to take advantage of selling himself so that he can make a good earnings margin.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used automobile covers

loans.name: Amélé Agathe

texts.fr: Houngbati amélé habite le quartier d’agoè tellessou , elle a pour activité le commerce de charbons , maïs et haricots en gros et en détail et aussi par distribution, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007 dans son son quartier, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit de 150000F pour s’approvisionner en sacs de charbons de bois et de sacs de haricots. Elle est mariée avec un monsieur du nom de DOVI komlavi qui exerce dans la maçonnerie, ensemble ils ont eu quatre enfants. Elle espère rentabiliser son commerce pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Amélé Houngbati lives in the Agoè Tellessou district and does commerce in charcoal, corn, and beans wholesale and retail and also by distribution. She has been in this business since 2007 in her district but has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. She is requesting this initial loan of 150,000 francs CFA for supplies of charcoal and beans. Ms. Houngbati is married to a gentleman by the name of Komlavi DOVI, who is a mason. Together they have four children. She hopes to make her commerce profitable to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and charcoal

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr: Mr A. Messan Jean –Marié est jeune homme de trente–deux (32) ans qui n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études faute de moyens financier. Très tôt, il s’est épris de passion pour le métier de photographe qu’il a appris auprès d’un oncle. Aujourd’hui, il évolue pour son propre compte dans ce métier mais il ne dispose pas de matériels nécessaires pour exercer convenablement son métier. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour acheter un appareil photo de qualité et une caméra pour ses reportages vidéo. Ce financement lui permettra de se professionnaliser comme un véritable photographe et d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Messan Jean-Marié A. is a young man of 32 who did not have a chance to pursue his studies due to lack of financial means. Very early on, he became passionate about photography, a skill he learned from his uncle. Today he is working independently in this sphere, but he does not have the necessary materials to pursue his work correctly. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan to buy a good camera and a video-camera.This loan will permit him to become a true professional photographer and also to increase his earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a good camera and also a video-camera

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La sra. Lorenza, es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

Lorenza tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 18, 14 años, la socia se dedica a la agricultura (cultivo de papa, habas, verduras) y a la ganaderías (compra de vacas lecheras y engorde de las mismas), Ella también vende verduras y sus productos en el mercado local; ella camina 1 hora desde su comunidad hasta un puente que conecta su comunidad con otro poblado, dónde ella puede tomar un trasporte local y así dirigirse a la pueblo de Ocongate.

Esta socia agradece el préstamo otorgado, ella sabe muy bien que su comunidad no tiene libre acceso a una banca financiera, por lo que se compromete a hacer buen uso de ese préstamo y cumplir con los pagos establecidos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old, married, with 3 children who are 19, 18 and 14 years old. She earns a living by farming (she grows potatoes, peas and other vegetables) and raising animals (she buys cows for milking and fattens them up). She sells her vegetables and products at the local market. She walks for one hour from her village to a bridge that connects the area with another village, where she can use public transportation to get to the town of Ocongate. She is grateful for the loan—she knows very well that her community does not have easy access to a financial institution—and she is committed to using the loan in a good way and making the established payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Azamchon

texts.ru: Аъзамчон не имеет специальной профессии и поэтому после окончания школы стал работать в колхозе. Ему 41 год, женат  и имеет 5 детей. Жена нигде не работает. Аъзамчон кроме основной работы занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местных рынках. Это приносит ему основной доход. Аъзамчон собирается получить займ для развития своего маленького бизнеса и подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Azamchon does not have a profession and after he graduated from school he began to work in a collective farm. He is 41 years old, married and has five children. His wife is not working. Besides his main job Azamchon also buys and resells cattle on the local markets. This gives him main income. Azamchon plans to get a loan to expand his small business and has applied for it at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola J. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She hopes to have more children in the future. Bola sells sarongs; her customers are mainly married women and young girls. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Mr. Agapito P. maintains two hectares of farmland in his village. He needs additional working capital to proceed with manual planting of corn and rice crops. Agapito is a 50-year old man, married to Elena. They are blessed with one child, Agiecel, who is 31-years old and a college graduate. Despite his degree, Agiecel is helping his father on their family farm due to a lack of job opportunities in the area. They presently reside in Barangay San Isidro Quirino, Isabela, which is a small rural village in the northern part of Quirino, Isabela.

Agapito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to sustain his farming business and to make it grow. He will be purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, diesel and seeds which are the major requirements to sustain his farming. He is hoping to have a good harvest to be able to earn more profit. “Giving my family what they need is my responsibility,” says Agapito. This belief serves as his motivation as he struggles with the many challenges of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and manioc

loans.name: Vissè

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de Vokpossito, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce chaussures, elle exerce son activité de façon ambulante. Elle vend parfois à crédit et récupère l’argent dans huit jours voire une semaine. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.  Cette activité est très bénéfique pour elle car elle en tire énormément de bénéfices. Elle voudrait agrandir son stock afin de mieux vendre et réaliser plus de profit.
Avec le profit tiré de son commerce, elle aide son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Vokpossito neighborhood. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She works selling shoes, door-to-door. She sometimes sells on credit and recuperates her money after a week or so. She has been in this business since 2005 and stocks up at the big open-air market of Lomé. This business is very beneficial for her since she makes a lot of profit from it. She wants to expand her inventory so as to make more sales and thus more profit.

With the profit from her business, she helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luís tiene la edad de 53 años, casado su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian, reside en el bario Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, tiene una pulpería que administra junto a su esposa la cual tienen diez años en las venta el cual iniciaron con prestamos financieros en Afodenic, este es su doce avo crédito y da las gracias por el apoyo para invertir mas en su negocio, y las mejoras de su vivienda. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos. Aceite, productos de carne, pollo y lácteos, ya que son los productos básicos y consumibles para los clientes. Sus planes es poder vender otros productos que sean de sastifaccion para el cliente en la vida cotidiana. Su objetivo es apoyar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Luis is 53 years old. He and his wife have two children who are students. He lives in the Lauerles Sur neighborhood in Managua, the capitol. With his wife her runs a grocery store that he started ten years ago with loans from AFODENIC. This is his 12th loan and he is grateful for the support that has allowed him to invest more in his business and to improve his home. With this credit he will invest in the purchase of basic grains, oil, meat products, chicken, and milk products since these are the basic consumable products for his clients. His plans include being able to sell other products that would be satisfying to his clients in their daily life. His objective is to support his three children so they can complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, chicken, and other products

loans.name: La Superacion Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina A. is new to Esperanza, but has heard about the successes of the program from some of her neighbors. She earns a living by selling used clothes from her home, and she began to realize she was having a difficult time growing her business in any substantial way. At the same time, she saw her neighbors who were using Esperanza were able to invest a significant amount of money in their businesses and they were seeing them flourish.

Currently, Miguelina is only able to purchase a limited amount of clothing, which prevents her from taK. any large steps in successful development. It may come as a surprise to some, but the business of selling used clothes is a huge business. Thousands if not millions of Dominicans rely on used clothes for the clothes on their back. This is one of the reasons Miguelina believes she will be successful with a loan to grow her business.

Miguelina hopes that in the future she will succeed with this first loan, and she will be able to move on with no end in sight. Her dream is to someday own her own store, selling not used clothes but new, fashionable clothes. She sees Esperanza as the only way she can get on this path.

loans.use: the purchase of more used clothes to be sold throughout her neighborhood.

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businessman. He runs a food shop at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam selling a variety of food crop products including cereal and leguminous crop products such as wheat flour, maize flour, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), cooking oil and sugar.

Chacha purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops and sometimes direct from the producers. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more business goods

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. of Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental, is a 62-year-old widow with six grown children. She has been sewing clothes for a living for almost 40 years and at present nets a profit of PHP 3,000 per month.

Despite her senior citizenship, Julieta says that she is grateful that the Lord God still gives her the strength to continue her tailoring business. And through the help and guidance of  NWTF-Project Dungganon, which she considers as her second home because of the support and trust that the people there give her in spite of her age, she is confident that she can still contribute to the community by sewing clothes for her neighbors, and in turn stay independent by earning her own living.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 9,500 for her 10th loan cycle from NWTF so that she could buy fabrics and other sewing materials for her business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 03 hijos (solo uno esta a su cargo), estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado mayor para venderlo en las ferias zonales.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen B. D. de 38 años de edad reside en el occidente del país exactamente en el departamento de Morazán. María es madre soltera de tres niños menores de edad,  Nidia de 16 años, Richi de 12 años y Kevin de 8 años de edad; todos estudiantes, con ella también vive su madre Doña Saira de 72 años quien apoya a su hija en el cuido de sus nietos. María no recibe ayuda económica de nadie, solo su negocio es el único ingreso con el cual María soluciona los gastos familiares. María posee una venta de pupusas y tortillas, negocio con el cual logra mantener a su familia, pero en esta oportunidad ella solicita este crédito, ya que desea comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar la producción,  para lograr aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumentar su producción

loans.name: Avad

texts.es: Avad tiene ya sus 40 años de edad, actualmente está casado pero en esta nueva operación de crédito no participo su esposa porque estaba de viaje.  Tiene varios hijos pero solo 2 dependen de él y uno ya está por ingresar a la universidad. Vive en su casa propia pero aun no han salido sus papeles, su hogar esta a 9 km. De la ciudad en una zona en expansión. Avad trabaja hace muchos años en una empresa  como chofer y auxiliar y su esposa vende tamales y café. Con estos ingresos mantienen a su familia. Actualmente esta solicitando un crédito para comprar algunos bienes que le faltan en su hogar. También tiene un pequeño crédito en otra institución y es muy responsable en los pagos. Avad es un buen cliente de Agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad.

loans.use: COMPRA DE BIENES PARA EL HOGAR

loans.name: Siny

texts.fr:
Madame Siny S.  est vendeuse de légumes et de produits divers. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. A cause de l évolution de son activité  elle s active toujours de 8h a 19h le soir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs et ambitionne de renforcer son activité. Avec ce prêt elle espère augmenter ses revenus  mensuels de 50 000 frs. Cela fait plus de dix ans que  Siny  évolue dans ce domaine.

Madame Siny S. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF)  Seydina  Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parents de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Siny S. sells vegetables and various other products.  She is married and the mother of three children.  As a result of the growth of her business, she always works from 8 AM to 7 PM.  She is requesting a loan of FCFA 100,000 and hopes to further strengthen her business.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her monthly income by FCFA 50,000.  Siny has been active in this sector for over ten years.

Mrs. Siny S. is a beneficiary of an agreement between U-IMCEC and the Program for the Development of Children and Families (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  The PDEF works to reduce poverty within the community and protect the children of disadvantaged families.  Thanks to this partnership, the parents of the children have access to loans with more flexible conditions than regular loans.  Since the launch of the partnership in December 2008, 120 parents have received loans between FCFA 50,000 and FCFA 100,000.

loans.use: renforcer son activite

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She is 56 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia LUZMILA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos. 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella ayuda a su esposo con la fabricación de muebles y con la venta de los mismos. La socia tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Mercamueble Communal Bank and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

Luzmila divides her time between her household activities and manufacturing furniture such as desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, beds, and other pieces. She helps her husband with making and selling furniture. Luzmila also has a furniture vending post at the Mercamuebles Market, located at the main bus stop in San Sebastián District of the Province of Cusco. She has been in business for a number of years and has done very well due to her hard work and determination.

Luzmila is requesting a loan to increase her business capital for manufacturing and selling furniture. The materials she needs to buy include wood, paint thinner, lacquer, sandpaper, carpenter’s glue, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim O., 32, is married to 34-year-old Choun Hon, and they have two children who are students and dependent on their parents’ income. This couple relies on making and selling rattan cupboards. They weave at least ten sets of rattan before they start selling using their old horse and cart.

Recently, their existing horse became too old and can’t continue to work for their business and this affects their current income. Hence, Khim O. would like to seek a Kiva loan through HKL in order to replace her old horse.

loans.use: To replace her old horse

loans.name: Mrs. Chreb Hing Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people, all living in Krang Chamraeun village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Chreb H. is the village bank president who has been selecting the members and they will all use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chreb H. is a silk weaver.  She wants to expand her weaving and has decided to request a loan to buy more raw materials to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Ek Phun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chreb H. is 39 years-old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor E. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes and bags of onions to sell. Ayor is 36 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tomatoes and bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Anasthasie

texts.fr: K. Anasthasie est née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Anasthasie s’est installée depuis 17 ans environs, à la Zone des Ambassades à Cotonou. Mariée à AFFOGNON Rémi, un mécanicien auto, Anasthasie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Anasthasie n’a pas été à l’école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Anasthasie vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs) à son domicile. Anasthasie vend également du riz, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Anasthasie s’approvisionne, et elle mène cette activité depuis trois ans. Anasthasie a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Anasthasie s’accroît au jour le jour et Anasthasie n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous les besoins. C’est pour renforcer son capital et élever le niveau de son activité que Anasthasie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Anasthasie was born in 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Anasthasie has lived for about seventeen years in the Zone des Ambassades in Cotonou. Married to AFFOGNON Rémi, an auto mechanic, Anasthasie is the mother of four children, all in school. All of the children live with their parents. The couple supports the family together. Anasthasie has never been to school. In order to help her husband, Anasthasie sells porridge (made from corn) from her home. Anasthasie also sells rice, which allows her to have several sources of income. Anasthasie gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin, and she has been in this business for three years. Anasthasie has already received three loans from ALIDé, loans which she has fully repaid. Anasthasie's clientele grows every day, and she is no longer able to satisfy everyone's needs. In order to increase her working capital and raise the level of her business, Anasthasie is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Elsie Ratiza Group

texts.en:
Elsie R. is from the village of Bato, Plaridel. She is 43 years old. Elsie is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elsie R..

Elsie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón Sandí B., tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. No tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ramón también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramón Sandí B., 66, is married and lives with his wife. He has no children. He wants funding to assist his farm, especially his coffee crops. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizers. He wants to provide his plants with adecuate care so that his coffee crop will be of the best possible quality in order to command the best possible sale price at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offerend. Ramón has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to provide his family with better living conditions and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue developing as a person and as a grower.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Concern Group

texts.en:
These are members of the ‘Concern’ group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesspeople who are applying for their second SMT/Kiva loan. Previously, each in the group received SLL 500,000 and that loan made a very significant impact on their lives. 

Having repaid that loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of SLL 800,000 for each. Sahid M. I., pictured on the right is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old is married and has two children. For six years now, Sahid has been running a bar. With his share of this loan, he will expand his business by buying more cartons/crates of both soft and hard drinks.

loans.use: Buy cartons/crates of both soft and hard drinks

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CAROLINA ES SOLTERA  LLEVA MAS DE 6 AÑOS EN EL OFICIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA EN SU DOMICILIO EN LA CUAL LA SEÑORA ES BASTANTE CONOCIDA POR LA ESQUISITES DE SUS PLATOS QUE PREPARA, ELLA EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE COCINA, CON UNA DE SUS TIAS QUE TENIA UNA PENSION, ELLA TRABAJO BASTANTE AHORRANDOSE DINERO PARA ASI PODER TENER SU PROPIA PENSION. ELLA VIVE CON SU HERMANO QUE ESTA ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MESA Y SILLAS  Y ASI PODER POTER TENER MAS INGRESOS Y MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE ELLA Y DE SU HERMANO. UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES DE CONTINUAR ESTUDIANDO Y SALIR PROFESIONAL ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carolina is single and has sold food in her house for over 6 years. She is quite well known thanks to her tasty preparations. She started out as a kitchen helper with an aunt, who had an eatery; she worked hard and saved money to have her own business. She lives with her brother, who is a university student The funds will be used to buy tables and chairs so that she can increase her earnings thus providing a better quality of life for herself and her brother. One of her wishes is to continue her own schooling and have a profession. She is very hard-working and very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Vicenta es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Vicenta tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, brinda diversos servicios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles.
El sueño de Vicenta son seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Alianza (Alliance) Communal Bank. She is married, 44 years old, and has 3 children. Vicenta operates a printing shop in a rental space located in the city center. She offers diverse services, and does so every day. Vicenta needs a loan of 1,000 sols, which will be invested in purchasing various printing papers. Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRINTING PAPER FOR HER PRINT SHOP

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Mr. Yet S., 43, is a divorced father blessed with three children who all attend school.  He is currently a professional language teacher in a private school. He started his job in 2000 and is able to generate a daily income of $9 to help control his family's financial problems. S. is taking out this loan to repair his existing motorcycle, which often breaks down when he rides it to class and other places. With any remaining cash from the loan, S. will buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: To repair his existing motorcycle

loans.name: Bech

texts.en: Mr. Bech B. is a villager in Preaek Svay village in Kandal province and he is 44 years old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. He is a fisherman too. His problem is that his field has infertile soil and it is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mr. Bech B. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. His wife, Mrs. Khieng Say, is a chef. He is the father of four children. All of the children are studying in the local public school. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married man with one child from Lebanon. In 2003, he opened a gadget shop as his own business which included balloons, gifts and games after he had worked at such a store for 10 years and found that the business brought happiness to the hearts of the children. He’s very thankful for his business; it allows him to improve his life situation. 
He is now asking for his second loan of $1,500 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to increase his purchases for the upcoming summer season.  And he hopes that his diverse selection of gadgets will continue to generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further. He expects his productivity and income to increase in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Ivon De Jesus

texts.es:
En su labor de licenciada en Biología y química y con el apoyo de su esposo contador independiente, Ivon C. P. logro reunir un dinero para emprender  el negocio  de  fabricación de muebles de madera, Muebles J. y A. que hoy es apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace mas de 3 años, organización  a la que hoy solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 COP, para comprar materias primas como láminas de madera MDF prensada, para fabricar multimuebles encargados y pagar la mano de obra. 
Al principio Ivon cuenta, que se dedicó  solo a la comercialización de multimuebles y otros productos en madera y que poco a poco su rentabilidad la hizo pensar en una mejor alternativa como hoy lo hace, pues ella  diseña el mueble requerido, compra la materia prima, las lleva a talleres donde  paga   la mano de obra, entregándoles un anticipo de dinero, para que  inicien la producción  y cuando el producto está ya elaborado,  ella paga el saldo pendiente. De esta manera comercializa su producto terminado con clientes que ella consigue directamente, a través de su esposo o por referidos. Antes de entrar a la Fundación ella tenia problemas de liquidez que gradualmente ha superado y   porque su capital se encontraba en las cuentas por cobrar de los clientes, estaba en ese entonces su negocio estancado, pero con los créditos pudo despegar, así fue como al   recibir su segundo financiamiento,  logro activar su comercialización y consiguió nuevas posibilidades de inversión. En la actualidad rota sus cuentas por cobrar entre 12 y 30 meses y su cónyuge se dedica por completo a la administración del negocio, mientras ella como es educadora lo apoya parte del tiempo en ello.
A nivel familiar su meta principal es  continuar apoyado la educación de sus hijos y abrir un punto de venta para ser atendido también por su esposo. Su desafío  mas importante  se presenta,   cuando da largos plazos a los pagos de  sus clientes  y se han presentado algunos problemas  en su recuperación pero se asegura de recupera por o menos la inversión.
Ivon su cónyuge y su familia son personas muy felices ; su negocio esta ubicado en el centro del municipio de  Malambo a dos calles del parque de la cultura;   donde es muy común utilizar el sistema de crédito puerta a puerta como ellos lo hacen.
texts.en:
In her work as a teacher of biology and chemistry, and with help from her husband, Ivon C. P., an independent accountant, she has gotten together enough money to set up a business making wood furniture, Muebles J. y A. The Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has helped the business for over three years. She is now requesting a loan from the Fundación for $2,000,000 COP. The loan is to buy raw materials like medium density fiber boards to make ordered modular furniture and to pay for the labor. Ivon says that at first she only worked at selling the modular furniture and other wood products. Little by little its profitability made her think of a better alternative. Now she designs the requested furniture. She buys the raw material and takes it to shops where she pays for the labor. She gives them a down payment so that they start the work. When the product is done, she pays the remaining balance. This way she sells her final product to customers she gets directly from her husband or from referrals. Before working with the Fundación, she had liquidity problems which she has gradually overcome. She also encountered problems with the customers’ bills. At that time her business was stalled. But, with the loans she was able to take off. Upon receiving her second loan, her sales were stimulated, and she got new investment possibilities. She rotates her accounts charging between 12 and 30 months. Her husband devotes himself completely to the administration of the business. Meanwhile, as a teacher, she helps him with the business part of the time. On the family level, her goal is to continue supporting her children’s education, and to open a spot where her husband can sell also. Her most important challenge is when she gives customers a long time to pay. There have been problems with payment, but she is sure to at least recuperate her investment. Ivon, her husband and their family are very happy people. Her business is located in the center of the Malambo municipality two streets from the culture park. It is very common there to sell door to door using the credit system like they do.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials like medium density fiber boards to make ordered modular furniture and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Lalotea

texts.en:
Lalotea S. is 48 and is married with six children aged from 8 to 26. She owns a business venture catching and selling ocean-caught fish and has two years of experience in this business.

Lalotea needs a loan of WST 1,400 to purchase additional fish to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or approximately USD 175 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Lalotea joined SPBD in the year 2009 and this is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join  SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children. One is still attending school. She has been working as a baker for over 10 years. Her freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. She is requesting to borrow $1200 to renovate her bakery and add new decor because she is planning to expand her business and make more space to receive more clients. She is planning to continue expansion of her business and she is positive about the coming year.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: renovate her bakery and add new decor

loans.name: Geraida

texts.en: Geraida is widowed with four children, none of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She owns a stall at her home in Mengo Mackay, selling rice. She wants to use this loan of 800,000 UGX to buy more bags of rice. She has been in this rice business for many years. She buys bags of rice from Kamuli district and uses public transport to and from Kamuli. Besides the rice business, she also gets additional income from rental rooms. She sells to all categories of people for retail and works six days a week. She depends on this job for a living, and her main business challenge is the transportation of bags of rice from Kamuli to her home in Mengo Mackay. She aspires to own a delivery van and also to start selling on wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT because they are cooperative and work with poor women. Geraida resides in and owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix nacido el 14 de Enero, tiene 2 hijos y vive con La Sra. Seberina de 50 años, ellos son de Cochabamba. Hace 7 años que se compraron una parcela de 3 hectareas para trabajar en la agricultura en Quebrada de Horno que se encuentra a 8 km de la localidad de Limoncito y también se dedican a la fabricación de escobas.

Hace 4 años que viene trabajando con Emprender, es muy trabajador y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, estas escobas que realiza son artesanales hechas de paja  y muchas personas las utilizan principalmente en los mercados campesinos, pero su actividad principal es la siembra de maiz y el dinero solicitado es para contratacion d emano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y compra de semillas, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Felix was born on the 14th of January, has 2 children, and lives with Seberina who is 50 years old. They are from Cochabamba. Some 7 years ago, they bought a 3 hectare parcel of agricultural land to work in Quebrada de Horno, about 8 kilometers from Limoncito. They also make brooms. They have been working with Emprender for the last 4 years. Felix is very hard working and responsible in making his loan payments. The brooms they make are artisan, made of straw, and many people use them, principally in country markets. But Felix's main activity is growing corn, so he is requesting this loan to hire workers to sow his land and to buy seeds. Felix is very grateful to this institution for the opportunity it offers him.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Broom-making and sowing corn

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna P. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 59 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a business selling vegetables. Luna has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Luna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.
