Luna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Luna from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For corn production

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is single and makes a living selling spices at her town's central food market. She went into business about a year ago because unemployment is high and jobs are in short supply where she lives. Today, she enjoys being self employed and is making plans to expand her business. To help make this expansion possible, she is applying for a loan for 10,000 Grivnas to increase her supply of working capital and maintain a large assortment of spices because this is key to attracting new customers.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bread Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Bread Sellers” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Jariatu K.. Jariatu was born in Waterloo, twenty-six years ago. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and her child is attending primary school.

Jariatu sells cooked rice, palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), uncooked 'foofoo' (food made out of cassava roots), etc. Jariatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients, palm oil, 'foofoo', etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients, palm oil, 'foofoo', etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Yolanda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
41-year-old Yolanda T. is a two-year member of ASHI, a KIVA field partner in the Philippines. She resides in a municipality of Binangonan in Rizal province with her husband and their children, who range in age from 10 to 21.  

Her loan from ASHI was used to start up a business she can manage herself so she can have her own income to support her family's needs, especially that of her children. Presently, Yolanda’s income through her sewing business is not yet enough to support her dream of giving her children the best things in life. Her husband’s income is sporadic and insufficient for their support. Therefore, she wanted to request a much larger loan from ASHI to grow her business. With ASHI and KIVA, Yolanda believes that there are a lot of things she can do for her family through her business.

Her long-term goals are for her children to complete college, for the expansion of her sewing business, and to buy more sewing machines for better output. She is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her venture.

loans.use: to support her sewing business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. mistura (es un material hecho a base D. papel que se utiliza en fiestas) y luego los distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden la mistura, al socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como papeles D. colores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "MANOS JUNTAS" ["Hands Together"]. The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Angelica. She is 52 years old and is married with two children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling "mistura" (a material maD. mostly of paper that is used at parties), and then she distributes it to the different stores that sell the "mistura". She wants to grow her business. She asks for this loan to buy materials such as colored paper.

The partner is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this means. She promises to follow through with the payment of her dues in the established location.

loans.use: To buy materials such as colored papers.

loans.name: Rosa Giovanna

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su madre en el sector La Zaranda, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y la crianza de animales, la zona en donde vive queda ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría ovejas y chivos al aire libre, en un potrero que posee, allí ellos se alimentan de algarroba (fruto del árbol algarrobo, abundante en la zona) y diversas hierbas. Cuando alcanzan su grado máximo de desarrollo ella los ofrece en venta al público en general en el Mercado Moshoqueque, esta actividad es la única que le provee de ingresos económicos, por lo que da lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio.

Rosa desea adquirir alimento balanceado para complementar su nutrición y de esta manera percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000  nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo y satisfacer a la demanda que suele incrementarse por estas fechas navideñas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, is single and lives with her mother in the La Zaranda sector, a rural zone in Pítipo district, Ferreñafe province.  Her main activities are farming and animal raising.  The zone where she lives is 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last three years she has been raising small farm animals to sell.  She raises sheep and goat outdoors in a pasture she has.  There they feed on algarroba (fruit of the carob tree which is abundant in the area) and various grasses.  When they reach their maximum level of development she sells them to the general public at the Moshoqueque Market.  This activity is her only source of income so she does her best to maintain her business.

Rosa wants to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed to complement their nutrition so that she will get higher earnings at the time they are sold.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan with which to reach this goal and meet customer demand which tends to increase during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. She sells smoked fish at Takoradi market. Efua assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Efua will use the loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia, de 27 años, vive con su esposo  Mauth (30)  y tienen cuatro hijos con los que vive en su casa propia en el distrito de Quimbiri.Olimpia, es muy empeñosa en sus quehaceres y con ese optimismo decidió instalar su negocio de venta de ropa, hace  20 años, y esta muy satisfecha por los buenos resultados. Para ella es muy útil tener su negocio cerca de su casa porque le ahorra el tiempo para realizar otras actividades antes de abrir y poder ofrecer su mercadería. Considera que lo dificultoso es que no obtiene la ayuda necesaria de su pareja, porque él realiza otras labores que son impedimento para poder apoyarla. Según ella lo provechoso del negocio  es que cuenta con varios clientes que llegan a su negocio por que les brinda una buena atención y a buenos precios  las prendas, y por esta razón desea invertir en cantidad de mercadería; porque sus clientes  le realizan muchos pedidos.Es el  séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, ya que su banco comunal le es de mucha utilidad para seguir progresando.Olimpia tiene planeado invertir  el dinero que solicita en surtir con mayor cantidad de  mercadería en ropa,  al gusto de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que sus compradores queden satisfechos con sus pedidos, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 27 years old.  She lives with her husband Mauth (30) and has four children with whom she lives in her own home in Quimbiri district.

Olimpia is very hard working and, with that optimism, she decided to set up a business selling clothes 20 years ago.  She is very satisfied with the good results that she has obtained.  It is very useful for her to have her business near her home because it saves her time and means she can do other things before she opens up and starts selling her merchandise.  She considers that the difficult part of her work is that she doesn't receive the help she needs from her partner because he does other tasks which are an obstacle to him supporting her.  She says that the good thing about her business is that she has several customers who come to buy from her because she provides them with good customer service and good prices on her clothes.  She would like to invest in a quantity of merchandise because her customers make a lot of orders.

This is Olimpia's seventh loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since her community bank is of great help to her in making progress in her business.  Olimpia plans to invest the money she is requesting in stocking her business with a larger quantity of merchandise (clothes) that are to her customers' taste.  Her goal is for her customers to be satisfied with their orders.  In this way she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa K. sells fruits in Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a fruit shop.

loans.use: Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 40 years old and married with a school-aged child. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business that provides manicures and pedicures in her local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Delia joined ASKI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase materials and expand her services. Delia is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase business materials. This will be her third loan. Delia plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to pay her child’s school tuition fees. 


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. is 42 years old. He is a widower from the Usenge area who has six school-aged children. Michael is a tailor and is known in his neighborhood for making nice clothes. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Michael wants to buy material to sell and also to make into clothes. He will use his profits to expand his business

Michael’s desire is to expand his business and open a tailoring school. He also wants to buy land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy material to sell and tailor

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es:
Fausta, tiene 73 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. unión tiene cinco hijos D. las cuales todos son independientes, ella nació en la ciudad Urubamba y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco. 

Fausta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene una cabina D. internet. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Fausta en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento D. las computadoras. 

Fausta pertenece al banco comunal “Sol D. Oro” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fausta is 73 years old. She is married and as a result of this union has five children. All her children are financially independent. She was born in Urubamba. Today she lives in the same city of Cusco.

Fausta is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns an Internet café. She has been in this business for four years now. It has gone very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. At this time Fausta needs this loan to do computer maintenance.

Fausta belongs to the Sol D. Oro (Golden Sun) communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity this program offers her. She promises to make all repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To do computer maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working as a wood painter for five years. He works on a freelance basis. He is good at his job and has many customers asking for his services. With his business income, he is able to satisfy his needs. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools. These purchases will allow him to present better quality services to the clients. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Sabina Del Socorro

texts.es: En el departamento de Managua, la señora Sabina M. se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y proveer siempre el sustento a su casa de habitación. Debido a que ha requerido llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir cada una de las necesidades, acudió a solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda. Entre los materiales que comprará se encuentran cerámica y cemento. Su sueño ha sido mejorar su vivienda y gracias a este crédito lo logrará y así beneficiará a sus hijos que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en: In the state of Managua, Mrs. Sabrina M. is known for being very hardworking and always providing for her household. Due to the desire to maintain her home and supply it with the necessary, she has asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials for her home. Among other things, she will purchase ceramic tile and cement. Her dream has been to improve her home and thanks to this loan she will accomplish that dream, and be able to support her children who count on her.

loans.use: to buy materials such as ceramic tile and cement to improve her home.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A., who is married to a driver and has five dependents, attended school through junior high. For the past 10 years, Afia has been a baker who also sells provisions at Mfuom, which is near Abura.  Her income assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home, and she will use this loan as additional capital with which to fill her shop with more goods for sale. Afia would like to use the new profits to eventually establish another shop at a different location.

loans.use: as additional capital to enable her to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Oira

texts.en: Here we see Oira C. E.. He is 32 years old, single and makes a living by distributing bread to retail shops and hotels. He has been in the business for ten years and now has two employees. In addition to his bread business, he also works as a farmer. He has made good use of his membership in Faulu Kenya to grow both businesses, and he also hopes to open a bakery in the future. He is applying for a loan for 80,000 Kes to buy more loaves of bread to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Sisian with her husband and their two children. She works in Torunik village, where she is engaged in the agriculture business.

Gayane would like to cultivate land, but she does not have sufficient financial means to do so. As a result, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds. In turn, she hopes to cultivate the land, which would help to increase her income. In the future, she hopes that additional revenue generated as a result of the loan proceeds will allow her to purchase a house in Sisian and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Francisca Genoveva

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 58 años D. edad, ella vive con su esposo y su menor hijo en casa propia en el distrito D. Chiclayo, en una comunidad urbana que cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Francisca se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y productos D. higiene personal en un local D. su propiedad. Francisca tiene 6 años vendiendo estos productos en su surtida bodega y este negocio le ha traído buenos ingresos y satisfacciones. Por ello desea seguir invirtiendo en el.

Francisca solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar productos que han mostrado demanda y con los que ella, actualmente, no cuenta. Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar su capital D. trabajo y por lo tanto sus ventas.

Francisca es una cliente recurrente D. nuestra entidad y goza D. buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias pues ha cancelado puntual y responsablemente los créditos que se le han brindado.

Ella estaría sumamente agradecida D. concedérsele el préstamo pues le ayudaría a crecer en su actividad.
texts.en:
Francisca is 58 years old and lives with her husband and their young son in their own home in the district of Chiclayo, in an urban community that has basic utilities. 

Francisca works selling groceries, snacks, beverages, and personal hygiene products in a store on her property.  She has sold these products for six years from her stocked store, and this business has maD. her a good income and satisfaction, so she wants to continue investing in it.

Francisca has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase products that are in demand and that she does not currently have.  This investment will allow her to increase her working capital and her sales.

Francisca is a recurring client at our bank, and has good personal, work, and credit reference, and has maD. all of her payments on time and responsibly for the past loans she has been given.  

She would be very thankful to receive this loan because it would help her grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
La señora Danilza es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del Distrito Calleria Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva 5 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega, que hace pocos meses  abrió y funciona en su misma casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 soles comprara: 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 1 paquete D. fideos tallarín, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. mermelada en sache, 1 caja D. mayonesa, 1  docena D. jabón en barra, 1 docena D. jaboncillo, ½ saco D. azúcar, ½ saco D. arroz, 1 paquete D. harina, 1 caja D. mantequilla.
Más adelante hará otro préstamo D. mayor monto, cuando se sienta capaz D. poder pagarlo sin ningún problema.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos podrá tener un negocio propio y más adelante no depender D. nadie más que D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
Danilza is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias [Supportive Women] community bank of the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 59 years old. She is married and has one son.  She has worked for 5 years with loans from Manuela Ramos. She has a small store which she opened a few months ago from her own home.  

With this new loan of S/. 1,500.00 soles, she will buy: 3 packages of toilet paper, 1 package of noodles, 1 box of oil, 1 box of milk, 1 box of jam in bags, 1 box of mayonnaise, 1 dozen packs of soap, 1/2 sack of sugar, 1/2 sack of rice, 1 package of flour, 1 box of butter.  

In the future, she will take out a larger loan when she feels abot to pay it off with any trouble. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she will be able to have her own business and in the future not have to depend on anyone for work.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, pasta, rice, etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 39 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Elvira de 33 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Manejando su motocarro, Fredy mantiene a sus hijos, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ellos, puesto que tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Es una persona muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, lo cual ha hecho que las personas que lo conocen prefieran subir a su motocarro que al de la competencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, ya que así hace más amenos sus largos viajes. Lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar otra moto, ya que sueña con tener una empresa de transporte. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes asimismo afirma que cumplirá  con sus pagos. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un nuevo motocarro, para ello esta dispuesto a completarlo con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Fredy is 39 and is a very friendly and hard-working man.  He lives in his parents’ home with his wife, Elvira, who is 33, and their 6 beloved children, to whom he wants to offer a better standard of living.  By driving his motorcycle rickshaw, Freddy supports his children.  He knows that he has a lot of responsibility with them and has to watch over them.  He is a very happy person and always receives his customers with a smile on his lips, which makes people that know him prefer his motorcycle rickshaw over that of the competition.  What he likes most about his job is conversing with his passengers, since that always makes his long trips more enjoyable.

He has done this job for 17 years.  He thinks that working late at night is the most difficult part of his job.  With time, he hopes to be able to buy another motorcycle since he dreams about having a transportation company.  This will be his eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he is hoping for your support and is committed to make his payments on time.  With the 2,000 PEN requested along with money from his savings, he will buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Abdusami

texts.en:
Abdusami is a responsible husband and the loving father of two children. He lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. His wife sells fabric and educates children. Since 2005 Abdusami has been running a business of selling dried fruits in the market of Isfara. He purchases fruits. and after processing he sells them at the market for an affordable price. This will be his 6th cycle loan, and he has a good credit history. He wants to increase his working capital, and for this reason he requested a loan of 10,000 TJS. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for processing.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia tiene 60 años de edad, ella es madre de cuatro hijos tres casados y una soltera. Teodosia vive con su esposo en el distrito de Catacaos en es departamento de Piura, su comunidad es mediana y cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y luz 

Teodosia se dedica a la producción y comercialización de artículos de artesanía  en general además se dedica a la venta de gaseosas golosinas y otros como productos de belleza, para esto ella ha instalado su negocio en su domicilio. Teodosia cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con clientela ya establecida y fidelizada en la zona.

Teodosia esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en incremento de productos de belleza y gaseosa así como también materia prima para realizar sus artesanías 

Teodosia es una mujer responsable  con muy buenas referencias, las personas que la conocen le tiene mucha estima y la describen como una persona tranquila y trabajadora..
texts.en:
Teodosia is 60 years old.  She is the mother of four children; three are married and one is single.  Teodosia lives with her husband in the district of Catacaos, department of Piura.  It is an average community and has basic water and electricity services. 

Generally, Teodosia makes and sells artisanal crafts.  In addition, she sells soft drinks, candy, and other items such as beauty products.  Her business is installed in her home.  Teodosia has several years of experience in the business and already has established and loyal customers in the area.  

Teodisia is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the increase of beauty products and soft drinks as well as raw material to make her artisanal crafts.  

Teodesia is a responsible woman with many good references.   People who know her have a high regard for her and describe her as calm and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make artisanal crafts, and to buy beauty products and other items such as soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta tiene 28 años de edad esta casada y tiene 3 niños una niño de 8 años una niña de 5 años y un pequeño de un año, ella es originaria de una localidad rica en pinos donde la gente de la región cuidan y protegen de los talamontes ya que la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías de Ocoshal donde la materia prima la obtienen de los árboles de encino. Ella se dedica a realizar artesanías de Ocoshal y al cultivo de aguacate desde hace 7 años, dice que en tiempo de cosecha ella y su esposo cortan el fruto y lo sacan a vender a la ciudad de Toluca en la central de abastos ya que ahí se lo compran a muy buen precio y así le pueden dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella esta pidiendo  un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos e insecticidas para que salgan fruto de una buena calidad. La meta que tiene Crisanta es sacar adelante a sus hijos que tengan estudio por que dice ella “quiero que mis hijos estudien por que el trabajo en el campo es muy pesado y no quiero sufran, quiero echarle muchas ganas para terminarles de hacer su casa de concreto por que cuando vivíamos en la  casa de madera se me enfermaban mucho por que le entraba el frío”.
texts.en: Crisanta, 28, is married and has three children, an 8-year-old boy, a 5-year-old girl and a 1-year-old boy.  She is from a place where there are many pine trees and local people take care to protect them from illegal loggers.  Most of the population makes Ocoshal crafts and use the shrub pine as raw material.  For seven years she has been making Ocoshal crafts and growing avocados.  At harvest time she and her husband cut down the fruit and take it to the city of Toluca for sale at the wholesale market.  There they can get a very good price for their produce, which lets them give their children a better quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides so the fruit will be of good quality.  Crisanta's goal is to help her children get an education.  She says "I want my children to study because farm work is very hard and I don't want them to suffer.  I want to work hard to finish building a concrete house because when we lived in the wood house they used to get sick because of the cold.".

loans.use: To grow avocados and make Ocoshal crafts.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 31 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Mylen works very hard to provide for them.

Mylen runs a ready-to-wear sandals and clothes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more products.

Mylen has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Mylen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es: Benjamín vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, el posee una venta de dulces tradicionales de forma ambulante y en una de las principales calles cercanas a donde reside, vende dulces de todo tipo cocada, dulce de leche, de tamarindo, de nance entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues los dulces que prepara benjamín son únicos, tienen un sabor inigualable, son de muy buena calidad a precio cómodo y con un servicio excelente; Benjamín es un hombre trabajador y le encanta endulzar el paladar de sus clientes con los deliciosos dulces que prepara, para él lo mas importante en el trabajo es la dedicación y constancia porque eso te permite alcanzar los objetivos en un futuro, quiere extender el negocio produciendo mas mercadería es por eso que le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar coco, leche, tamarindo, nances, azúcar, etc. Benjamín tiene confianza que su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benjamín lives with his life companion and children in his own house.  He’s a street vendor of traditional candies on one of the main streets near where he lives.  He sells all types of candy like macaroons, caramels, tamarind and nance [a small, yellowish fruit], among others.  He has acquired quite a large clientele because the candies Benjamín makes are unique.  They have an incomparable taste, are of very good quality, affordable price and with excellent customer service.  

Benjamín is a hardworking man who loves to sweeten his customers’ palates with the delicious candy he makes.  For him, what’s most important in work is dedication and constancy because that allows him to reach his future goals.  He wants to expand the business making more merchandise and this is why he asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy coconut, milk, tamarind, nances, sugar, etc.  Benjamín trusts that his efforts will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coconut, tamarind, nance and sugar.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de 24 años es una joven madre de familia. Ella convive desde hace 5 años junto a Crispin, su esposo, con quien tiene una hija: Sandy. A la que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Desde joven tuvo que asumir muchas responsabilidades; ello le impulsó a salir adelante junto a su familia. Todos los jueves, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de queso en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta compra queso por moldes a los ganaderos de la zona, quienes comercializan el producto a un menor precio; por lo que ella vende a un precio mayor, ganando así un dinero extra. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es negociar sus cosechas en el mercado de su ciudad. Ahora está pareja, tiene pensado juntar dinero suficiente para poder comprar una casa propia en la ciudad y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de movilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar todos sus objetivos. Sabe que con el apoyo de todos ustedes lo logrará, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marlene, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios moldes de queso para su negocio de compra y venta; asimismo en adquirir varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en:
Marlene, 24, is a young mother.  She has been living with Crispín, her husband, for the last five years.  They have a daughter, Sandy, who they care for in their own house located in Cayan.  From a very young age she had to take on quite a few responsibilities.  This pushed her to get ahead with her family.  Every Thursday she sells cheese at the market that takes place in the city of Tarma.  According to what she tells us, she buys whole cheeses from local farmers who sell the product at better prices so she can resell it at a higher price earning extra money that way.  Besides, she gets help from her husband, who grows all varieties of potatoes and has five years’ experience doing so and who enjoys negotiating for his crops in the market in their city.

Now, this couple is planning to save up enough money to buy a house of their own in the city to reduce transportation costs.  She’s a member of the “Progreso Cayan” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan where she plans to reach all her objectives.  She knows that with help from all of you she’ll do so.  Besides, she promises to be very punctual with her repayments.  

If Marlene were to receive your support, she will invest the money requested in the purchase of several whole cheeses for her retail operation and will also acquire several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her crops of “Yungay” potatoes.

loans.use: to buy cheese and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man with one school-going child. His wife is a cook who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees his child. 

He has operated a café for the past one year; in addition to this, he is also employed. His potential clients are the local community members. He faces a major challenge of transportation of food from the market to his cafe. He dreams of establishing a hotel shop in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase seats and foodstuff for his café. He decided to join Yehu because of the good loan products.

loans.use: To purchase seats and foodstuff for his café.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La Sra. Aurelia es  una  persona trabajadora  y  muy responsable, que   se  preocupa  por  el acondicionamiento  de  su  vivienda,  en esta ocasión  ella  y su  distinguido esposo  desean  realizar  la construcción de  una   barda  en su  domicilio,  ve en el  crédito al posibilidad  de  ofrecer a  su  familia una  excelente  calidad de  vida  contando con la posibilidad  de  tener   mayor  seguridad en su  domicilio,  agradece el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurelia is a hardworking and responsible person. She is concerned about the condition of her home. On this occasion, she and her distinguished husband want to build a security wall around their home. She sees this loan as a possibility of offering her family an excellent quality of life and greater security for her home.

Aurelia is grateful for the support that has been provided so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 31 years old and married with 4 children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergents and other miscellaneous items.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling used clothing.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie has a senior high level of education.  She is married and has seven children.  Auntie sells provisions from the shop in which she is standing, located in Elmina, Ghana.  Her business is about fifteen years old.  Auntie helps her spouse to take care of her children. 

Auntie requests a loan that will be used to buy more provisions to sell in the shop.  She hopes to use the new profits to buy a land.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Améyo est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un  vulcanisateur.  Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 05 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Améyo travaille comme revendeuse de gâteau ( aliment fait à base de farine de blé) depuis 2008. Elle sert ses clients à la maison.
Améyo a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de blé, de l’huile.
Dans les prochaines années, Améyo voudrait diversifier l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Améyo is a thirty-year-old woman. She is married to a tire repairman.  She has two children, one of whom attends school. The oldest is 5 years old, the youngest is two.   

Améyo has been selling cakes (a food made from wheat flour) since 2008. She delivers to her customers at home.

Améyo has requested a second loan from WAGES to buy wheat flour and oil.

In the coming years, Améyo would like to diversify her business. She says that with the profits she will provide for the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and oil.

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadeq, age 62, is a pensioner. He and his wife have raised four sons and seven daughters, and one of his sons is a worker with a decent salary. 

Sadeq wants to improve the conditions of his house. Preparations for the winter season must be made, such as replacing the windows and purchasing a new space heater.  He does not have the necessary funds for these necessities, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. With the loan proceeds, he will prepare his house thoroughly for the winter season, allowing his family to experience better living conditions.

loans.use: to make essential preparations to the family home for the winter months, such as replacing the windows and purchasing a new space heater

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato started to cultivate a hectare plot of land since he was 18. He grows rice to sell. The income from this business helps provide needs of his younger sister still in her studies. He has sacrificed not to enter into college anymore in giving way for his sister. Renato is now 21 years old. Though he only finished high school, he finds a way to help his parents gain an income.

He had an insufficient fund now so he would like to ask for P25,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers. He would like to improve his corn production so that he can really help educate his sister.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  is a kenkey (dumplings) seller at Besease near Elmina.  Adjoa has been in this business for 12 years.  Her husband is a farmer, and they have nine dependents.  She assists her husband in caring for their children. Adjoa will use her loan to puchase bulk maize for the preparation of kenkey.  With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is a married with two children aged 10 to15 that are in school and live at home. For the past nineteen years she has been selling sugar, peanuts, and rice in the market. She makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and peanuts for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house and shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es: José, debido a la necesidad  de mejorar su vivienda y por la buena atención de nuestra institución se ha decidido a solicitar otro préstamo, esta vez para reparar su vivienda la cual necesita comprar: cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro y de esa forma podrá tener mejor seguridad para su familia. El préstamo anterior le ayudo pudo comprar mas mercaderia de ropa y de esa forma su familia vive en mejores condiciones de vida que anteriormente.
texts.en: Owing to his need to improve his home and the good service he has received from our institution, José has decided to request another loan.  This loan will be used to repair his home.  He needs to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron.  This will enable him to provide better security for his family.  His previous loan helped him to buy more merchandise (clothing) and his family are living in better conditions than they were before.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jimmy Omar

texts.es:
Jimmy Omar tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el hermano y la madre en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jimmy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y además cría animales como pollos y cerdos para después venderlos, Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para poder arrendar terrenos para sembrar un poco más y comprar semillas,  abonos agrícolas y líquidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar productos agrícolas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para tener más.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Jimmy Omar, 19, is single and has no children.  He lives with his brother and his mother in Ventanas in Los Rios province.

He is a member of the communal bank "La Union," which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank are farmers who specialize in short-cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans.

Jimmy is a farmer who cultivates corn and also raises animals to later sell, such as chickens and pigs.  He purchases his supplies and sells his agricultural products in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to rent some land so that he can cultivate more crops, and also to buy seeds, organic fertilizer and liquid weed-killer.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy these agricultural supplies.  His dream is to continue to work so that he can have more. 

In his spare time, Jimmy likes to go out for a walk.

loans.use: to rent some land so that he can cultivate more crops, and also to buy seeds, organic fertilizer and liquid weed-killer

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Juan Carlos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 2 años Juan Carlos trabaja brindando servicios de transporte como chofer de mototaxi, adicionalmente también trabaja apoyando a su pareja en la venta de artículos para el hogar, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juan Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como mezas de centros, floreros, planchadores, esquineros, etc.; de esta manera Juan Carlos tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia, y así desea poder lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación a sus pequeños.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería, tales como mezas de centros, floreros, planchadores, esquineros, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 51-year-old man, a veteran of a thousand battles, who works on his mixed farm. Daniel is humble and he wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on his farm. He is fully dedicated to his farm work and thinks only of progressing. 

Daniel resides in the Kesogon, Kitale area of Kenya, which is a remote village with poor living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. He is happily married and, together with his wife, has a lovely family. Daniel's primary sources of income are milk and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet. He has managed to take care of his family with his income from selling different varieties of food crops. The Kitale area has conditions that favor poultry farming. 

Daniel has always wanted to start poultry farming, but the lack of capital has prevented him. He is seeking a loan to buy poultry. With this loan he will be able to satisfy the ready market in his region. Demand for poultry in the Kitale area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Daniel is going to comfortably meet the demand. 

His increased income will allow Daniel to provide a secure future for his school-going children by paying their tuition fees. He believes that education is the gateway to success. His vision is to be a leading supplier of Poultry to major hotels and households in his region. You can be part of Daniel dreams with a loan that will help him achieve all that he wants. Help him out so that he can maintain his big smile.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizers, pesticides, more seedlings and a hand pump

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha started her own business 7 years ago; she sells jewelry. She needed to help her husband, who was going through a difficult financial moment because his salary was very low and not enough to cover their children’s needs. With her family’s love and her great sense of responsibility, Bertha continues to this day with the project, and has been able to provide her kids with what they need, and help her husband that way.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$1000, which she plans to pay off in 6-12 months. With this money, she will buy more supplies, so she will increase her sales, and therefore her family’s well-being. Help Bertha, she and her family need your generosity. Don’t hesitate any longer, go ahead and support her.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha hace 7 años comenzó con su propio negocio, la venta de joyería, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, quien estaba atravesando por momentos difíciles económicamente, puesto que su sueldo es muy bajo y no con ello no se alcanzaba para hacer frente a todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Gracias al apoyo moral de su familia y a su gran sentido de responsabilidad, Bertha aún continúa con su proyecto y ha logrado darles a sus hijos lo necesario, ayudando así a su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1000 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un periodo de 6-12 meses. Con dicha cantidad comprará más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma poder incrementar sus ganancias y por ende el bienestar de su familia. Ayuda a Bertha, ella y su familia necesitando e tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Manuel Jorge

texts.en:
Manuel Jorge Marta D. S., 47 years old, native of Mopeia, Province of Zambezia, grew up with his parents. His family's situation did not proviD. him opportunities for studying.

In 1998, he started to work with commercial activities and he took charge of the management of his family's business. At the start of 2007, through friends, he learned about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and approached them for more information. After getting information, he decided to present his loan request, with the goal of expanding the volume of his business, improving the quality of customer service and increasing revenue. His activity has a greater impact on the community, because in addition to providing a job for himself, he employs one additional person and providens high quality meals to everyone who visit the Massaca District, which has great tourist potential, since it is located near Barragem dos Pequenos Libombos.

Translated by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Massaca - Boane Cliente: Manuel Jorge Marta D. S. Sector D. ActividaD.: Serviços Valor D. Empréstimo: 13.000,00 MT (520.00US$) Aplicação do Empréstimo: Venda D. Refeições Início: 10/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2007 Manuel Jorge Marta D. S. D. 47 anos D. idaD., Natural D. Mopeia Província D. Zambezia, cresceu sob a responsabilidaD. dos seus Pais, a situação financeira da sua família não lhe criou oportunidades para estudar. Em 1998 começou a trabalhar com a actividaD. Comercial e vem assumindo na integra a gestão D. negocio da família e conta hoje com uma instalação social. Nos princípios D. 2007 por indicação D. alguns amigos, teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-DSEMA tendo se aproximado para obter informações. Depois D. se informar, decidiu apresentar o seu pedido D. empréstimo cujo objectivo é ampliar o seu volume D. negócio, melhorar a qualidaD. D. serviços ao cliente e aumentar os rendimentos. A sua actividaD. tem um impacto maior na comunidaD. porque alem D. proporcionar emprego para ele próprio, emprega mais uma pessoa e providencia refeições D. qualidaD. para todos os que visitam o Bairro da Massaca com um granD. potencial turístico, pois localiza-se nas proximidades da Barragem dos Pequenos Libombos.

loans.use: To increase stock for his restaurant

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: G. Mehman Alikram oglu is an animal husbandry farmer from Galagayin village of the Sabirabad region. He has big family of 6 members. He has a small business, and now he would like to extend his business so he applied to Agroinvest for 900 USD credit.

loans.use: Extend his business

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhourn H. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap Province, where they work together making and selling traditional musical instruments. They earn $5 a day from this activity. Of their 4 children, 2 sell souvenir products to the tourists, and 2 are students. They are applying for this loan so that they can build a fence around their house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Senitima

texts.en: Senitima T. is a widowed lady and one of the oldest members of Samatau 4 Center. She has two children that work, and Senitima herself has joined the SPBD loan program and is the owner of a small business: she has been running a canteen for the past three years. During weekdays, Senitima sells food to school children. On hollidays and weekends, she weaves small Samoan fans. These fans can be sold for 5-10 tala (US$2-4) each, depending on the size and the materials used. If she can sell twenty fans a week, Senitima earns US$40, plus US$160 from the canteen. She will use the current loan of US$700 to purchase inventory for her canteen, so that she is able to pay for her children’s school fees and her family’s home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory to restock a canteen

loans.name: Marina Susana

texts.es:
Doña Marina is a very talented woman in the kitchen, and she is always attentive to serving the neighbors the various stews that she offers in her humble restaurant, which she has lovingly named “Carmencita.” She has had the restaurant for the last two years, but began her sales in the street, serving in Tupperware. With time, her income grew and now she is one of the most enterprising women in the neighborhood, going forward every day with her daily menus. She also provides room and board at modest prices to those who request it. With her everyday exceptional service and her good taste, her loyal customers continually gather to enjoy her rich stews. She wishes to open another restaurant as a second branch in order to continue to grow, motivated by her desire to bring her children the best in education. She is asking for a loan that she will invest in purchasing ingredients for the preparation of her daily dishes. Your support of Doña Marina will be of great help and her children are grateful for your brotherly and unselfish support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marina, es una mujer muy talentosa en la cocina y siempre está muy atenta a servir a sus vecinos con los variados potajes que ofrece en su humilde restaurante al cual ha llamado con mucho cariño, Carmencita. Desde hace doce años tiene este restaurante, comenzó vendiendo comida en la calle ofreciéndolos en tapers, con el tiempo capitalizó sus ganancias y ahora es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras de su barrio y cada día sale adelante con la venta de menús y también da pensión a precios muy módicos a todo aquel que lo solicite.Con la buena atención que ofrece cada día y la buena sazón, tiene clientes fieles que siempre acuden a consumir sus ricos potajes. Ella desea abrir otro restaurante como sucursal y seguir creciendo y esto es porque está motivada a brindar a sus dos hijos lo mejor para su formación académica.solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus menús. Recuerda tu apoyo para Doña Marina será de mucha ayuda y sus hijos te agradecen por tu solidaria y desinteresada ayuda.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of non-perishable goods to continue preparing her delicious food

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel works providing services in auto body repair/ painting of private and public vehicles. His wife is a fruit merchant and with both incomes they provide for their 5 children - the two oldest being 15 & 17 years old help their father in his work. They live in the area of Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto. This is the second credit KIVA they are requesting. The previous loan was repaid prior to its original maturity date. His new loan will be applied to the purchase of a work tool "oxygen tank" so that he can improve his workshop and generate more income for his family. It is the second loan through Impro, which he's allowed due to his good behavior in paying the first one off.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel presta servicios de chaperia y repintado de vehículos particulares y públicos; la esposa es comerciante ambulante de frutas y de esta manera ellos consiguen sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a sus cinco hijos, los dos mayores de 15 y 17 años de edad son los ayudantes del padre. Viven en la zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crédito con KIVA; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado con anticipación a su vencimiento original. Su microempresa paulatinamente se va reactivando y este nuevo préstamo lo aplicara en la compra de herramienta de trabajo “tanque de oxigeno” de esa forma podrá mejorar su taller y generar mayores ingresos para la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase an oxygen tank for his auto body shop. (Compra de tanque de oxigeno para su taller de chaperia y pintado de autos)

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham lives in a store rented under an *anticretico contract. The store is on Canonigo Ayllon street in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. He works selling office/school supplies and also has photocopiers with which he generates revenue to cover maintanence. He is asking for the loan to buy supplies since it is back-to-school time. He has no previous history with Impro but he qualifies to apply for a loan. *anticretico- contract in Bolivia in which the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the beginning in lieu of montly rent

Translated by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Abraham vive en anticrético en una tienda en la calle Canónigo Ayllón de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la venta de material de escritorio y también tiene fotocopiadoras con las cuales genera sus ingresos para su manutención. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material ya que es la temporada de inicio de clases en los colegios y escuelas. No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para acceder a un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy office/school supplies (notebooks, pencils, pens, etc)

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria L. is a very dedicated and hardworking woman. She sells groceries at her home, in the city of Chinandenga. As she was going through a very difficult economic situation and could not find a job, Maria L. decided to invest her savings (370 USD) to buy groceries and sell them for a profit.

Being a very laborious person, she wakes up very early to open the doors of her business to her loyal clients. It is important to mention that Maria L. has been a constant client of Ceprodel, taking loans to buy more products in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria L. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en su casa de habitación. Por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros (Siete mil córdobas) en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Como toda mujer trabajadora, ella desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para atender a su fiel clientela. Es necesario destacar que desde hace un año ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir más sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her groceries store

loans.name: Okouromi

texts.en: Okouromi I.is 45 years old, married and has a kid. He resides in Benin-City, Nigeria. He uses motorcycle to move people from place to place. He needs a loan of $625 to enable him replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Bihusi

texts.en:
Bihusi is 25 years old and is married with two children. Bihusi has been selling fruit since 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Bihusi now hopes for a loan to buy more mangoes, bananas and oranges for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase a Microscope and additional Drugs

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia never imagined that she would be able to earn a good income through her wine selling business. It all started a few years ago when this diligent mother decided to travel for a few days to the city of Tacna, Peru. On the way back to her hometown of Juliaca, Peru, she decided to purchase some wines in order to offer them to her family and neighbors. From that day forward this business has allowed her to provide post-secondary education to her two adorable children, for whom she feels very proud and satisfied as a mother. Each weekend she offers her wines in her hometown market. Her clients come regularly to purchase Lucrecia’s pleasant wines. On week days Lucrecia helps her husband in his noble labor as a tailor in order to further assist with family finances. Lucrecia and her husband are no longer responsible economically for their children, but they want to continue to improve their income. For this reason, they need generous hearts that will offer them the opportunity to increase their investment capital

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucrecia, nunca imaginó que con su negocio de venta de vino podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos, todo empezó cuando hace algunos años esta diligente madre decidió viajar por algunos días a la ciudad de Tacna, al retornar a su ciudad natal, Juliaca, decidió comprar vinos para ofrecerlos a sus familiares y vecinos, desde entonces hasta la fecha este negocio le ha permitido brindar estudios superiores a sus 2 adorables hijos por quienes se siente muy orgullosa y realizada como madre.Cada fin de semana oferta sus vinos en el mercado dominical de su ciudad natal, lugar a donde sus asiduos clientes se aproximan para adquirir sus agradables vinos, los días laborables para seguir colaborando con los ingresos económicos de la familia doña Lucrecia apoya activamente a su esposo en su noble labor de sastre.Doña Lucrecia y su esposo ya no tienen ninguna responsabilidad económica con sus hijos, pero desean mejorar sus ingresos, para ello requieren de corazones generosos que le brinden la oportunidad de mejorar su capital de inversión.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her wine-selling business

loans.name: Limanta

texts.fr:
Born around 1979 in Agblangandan in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Limanta B. retails corn, dried beans, and condiments. She is married and the mother of three children for whom she is no longer responsible. To increase her capacity for distribution of goods and bolster her business, she is requesting her third loan in the amount of 150,000 francs (US$ 375).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1979 à Agblangandan dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame B. Limanta est revendeuse de maïs, du haricot et des condiments. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Pour accroître sa capacité de distribution et renforcer son activité, elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit une somme de 150 000 francs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 3 sacks of corn and 2 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 3 sacs de maïs et de 2 sacs de haricot.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Née vers 1973 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au BENIN, dame D. Euphrasie est mariée et mère de quatre enfants: Euphrem, Didier, Nicole et Eric encore à sa charge. Gérante d'un mini supermarché, elle est en position de monopole dans son quartier et réalise un chiffre d'affaire journalier non négligeable. Elle éprouve des difficultés d'approvisionnement dans sa quête de satisfaction de la clientèle. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à ALIDé afin de s'approvisionner en produits  nouveaux afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Adjohoun, in the county of Ouémé in BENIN, Ms. Euphrasie D. is married and the mother of four children: Euphrem, Didier, Nicole, and Eric still in her care. As the manager of a mini-supermarket, she has a monopoly in her district and produces significant sales figures each day. She is experiencing supply problems in her quest to satisfy her customers. She is requesting her first loan with Alidé to supply herself with new products in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of sugar, 6 boxes of couscous, 10 boxes of insecticide, and 2 sacks of flour

loans.name: Rizki's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Riziki H. M. is married with a two-year-old child. She has been selling clothes since early 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Riziki now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with Mgeni K. J., who also has a shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Floripe

texts.es:
La señora Floripe pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Mz. A Lt. 7 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, uno mayor de edad y 3 menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo  trabaja como mecánico de carros de empresas de transportes. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Vende en las tardes de 4:30 p.m. hasta las 10 p.m. en diferentes eventos o fiestas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 cajetillas de cigarros de diferentes marcas, 4 cajas de galletas, 5 bolsas de caramelos, 3 cajas de chocolates, etc.

Floripe agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado. Tiene el deseo de triunfar en la vida por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Floripe belongs to the communal bank Las Flores the Nuevo Edén (“The Flowers of New Eden”), located in Nuevo Edén, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children; one is grown, and the other three are still minors and dependent on her. She is married and her husband works as a car mechanic at a transportation business. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of regional foods. She has been working with the communal bank for three years.

Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of candies. She sells in the afternoons from 4:30 pm until 10:00 pm at different events or parties.

With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will purchase 10 cartons of cigars of different makes, 4 boxes of cookies, 5 bags of caramels, 3 boxes of chocolates, etc.

Floripe thanks Manuela Ramos for the support it provides. She has the wish to triumph in life, for the well-being of her family.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of cigars, 4 boxes of cookies, 5 bags of caramels, 5 boxes of chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Ablawa Ikubinin

texts.fr:
Madame W. Ablawa est née le  09 décembre 2008 à Bassar, une ville au nord du Togo ; elle réside à Agoè et est divorcé de son mari qui est militaire et ont eu trois (03) enfants qu’elle a à charge. Elle pratique le commerce en gros et détail des produits d’alimentation générale, elle vend une partie de son stock à la maison.
Madame W. demande un crédit de 300000F dont elle voudrait se servir pour acquérir cinq (5) sacs de riz,  dix (10) cartons de spaghetti, cinq (5) bidons d’huile et neuf (9) cartons de tomates.
texts.en:
Ms. Ablawa W., born on December 9, 2008 in Bassar, a city north of Togo. She resides in Agoè and is divorced from her husband, a soldier, and they had three children. She does commerce in grocery items at the wholesale and retail levels. A portion of her stock is sold out of her house. She is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs for acquiring 5 sacks of rice, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 5 drums of oil, and 9 boxes of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grocery items

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con Soriana Cabral, quien le ayuda en los quehaceres domesticos, tienen 5 cinco hijos, dos de los cuales ya son profesionales, y los otros trabajan con él. Andrés se dedica a la producción y comercialización del carbón.
Andres  heredó la profesión de su padre con quien estuvo trabajando desde muy joven.
Empieza a las 5:00 am repartiendo sus productos en  una motocicleta en las principales despensas de su comunidad.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de materia prima (leñas).
texts.en:
Andres is 55 years old and married to Soriana Cabral who helps with the household chores. They have 5 children, 2 of whom have careers and the others work with him. Andrés makes and sells charcoal. Andrés inherited the business from his father with whom he worked from a very young age. He starts work at 5:00 A.M. delivering his products by motorcycle to the main grocery stores of his community. He needs the loan in order to buy raw materials (wood).

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (wood) to make charcoal.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de su familia con sus hijos; Melisa de 13 años, Mónica de 6 y Víctor Raúl de 4, su pareja los abandonó. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica netamente a su actividad, al no poder acceder a estudios secundarios ha trabajado desde muy temprana edad, incursionando en variedad de oficios los cuales le han permitido mantener a su familia ella sola. Actualmente Feliciana ha comprado dos motocarros y un triciclo, los cuales alquila por día obteniendo muy buenos ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que reparar muchas veces las averías que ocasionan los jóvenes que alquilan sus motos y su triciclo, ya que algunos suelen ser irresponsables no los cuidan. Feliciana se enteró de los préstamos de Microfinanzas Prisma y accedió a uno, y es su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, además se ha comprometido a ser muy puntual en los pagos. Ella con el dinero solicitado refaccionará sus motocarros y triciclo, si es posible comprará un triciclo más para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 28 years old, lives at her family's house with her children: Melisa-13 years old, Monica-6 years old and Victor Raul-4 years old. Her partner abandoned them. She is a hard working woman and entirely dedicates herself to her activity. Being unable to get access to secondary education, she has worked since early age, doing a variety of trades that had allowed her to sustain her family by herself.

At the present time, Feliciana has bought two motocars and a tricycle which she rents on a daily basis getting very good earnings. The most difficult part of her job is repairing the damages that the drivers that rent her motos and tricycle caused. Some of them are not very responsible and don't take good care of them.

Feliciana learned about the Microfinanzas Prisma loans and applied for one. It is her first experience with a communal bank and she has committed to be on time with the payments. With the money that she is asking for, she will repair her motocars and tricycle and if possible, she will buy another tricycle to increase her earnings more.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her motocars and possibly buying another tricycle.

loans.name: Amistad 4 Group

texts.en:
The Amistad Bank of Hope is now starting its 8th loan cycle with Esperanza International. Ana F. is the group coordinator for these five ladies. Ana is a single mother of 3 children. Her business consists of making hair products; shampoo, conditioner and anti-frizz serum, as well as disinfectant for floors and home surfaces. Ana purchases chemical products from local distributors to make her products and packs them for distribution. Her finished products are sold in small grocery stores and in her own home.

She hopes to see her children become professionals, which is one reason why she invests so much time and energy into her small business: to produce profits to allow her to proviD. a good education for her children. She also set a goal of buying a pickup truck a year from now to sell her products in other communities and outsiD. her province to expand her clientele. 

She thinks Esperanza International´s support through loans will help her achieve her dreams. On behalf of these entrepreneurs and Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: purchase chemicals to make hair products and cleaning products

loans.name: Koffi Edem

texts.fr: Monsieur koffi edem habite  le quartier d’agbalépédo, il est un jeune  célibataire et dynamique qui lutte pour gagner sa vie. Etant à sa propre charge il a crée depuis 2007 un cafétéria   dans le quartier de tokoin à lomé. Ce commerce est rentable à Lomé. Actuellement les produits de première nécessité qu’il utilise pour la cuisson sont épuisés, il demande à wages un prêt pour pouvoir acheter 05 bidons d’huile, 05 cartons de tomates et 10 cartons de spaghetti.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi Edem lives in the Agbalépédo district. He is a young, dynamic, unmarried man who is struggling to earn his living. Being on his own, he established a cafeteria in 2007 in the Tokoin district of Lomé. This field of commerce is worthwhile in Lomé. Right now, the supply of essential ingredients he uses for cooking is exhausted. He is asking WAGES for a loan to buy five drums of oil, five boxes of tomatoes, and ten boxes of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the ingredients necessary for cooking

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice M. sells shoes in Cape Coast, which he has been doing since 1993. He received his senior high school degree and is married with a child. His wife works as a trader. He is responsible for paying rent, school fees and utilities. He will use his loan to buy more shoes to sell and hopes to use the new profits from his business to construct a building.

Behind him and on the floor are the kins of shoes he trades in.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alicia Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Alicia  Petronila H. D. Calderón tiene 51 años, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 5to D. primaria, abandono los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola y se dedicó a trabajar, tiene 08 hijos y ninguno depenD. D. ella económicamente.
Alicia se dedica a la venta D. menú y cerveza, iniciò su negocio hace 8 años con la venta D. menú (comida) al principio no tenia muchas ventas pero se hizo D. clientes al poco tiempo.  Hace 1 año inicio la venta D. cerveza que le ha sido muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Ella es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, con el crédito D. 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. cerveza.
Alicia tiene el sueño D. construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia Petronila H. D. Calderón, 51, lives in Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province , La Libertad department, Perú. She finished the 5th graD., but she left school and went to work because her parents did not have the economic means to keep supporting her. She has 8 children who are economically independent of her. Alicia sells menu item type food and beer. She started her business 8 years ago selling food. At first she did not have many sales, but in a short amount of time she got customers. A year ago she started selling beer, and that has been very profitable for her. She runs her business in her own home. She is a member of “Las Auroras en Acción II” community bank. With a loan of 300 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy beer. Alicia dreams of building her house. She belongs to the mothers’ club in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg R. is 53 years old and married. Her family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband, Purevdagva, is a professional carpenter. They have run a furniture business together since 2000. They make many types of home furniture, including beds, chairs, closets, and tables.

The family’s living conditions have improved as a result of the success of their business. Their working capital has increased from 30,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1400 MNT) to 200,000 tugrugs.

Erdenechimeg is requesting a loan to purchase wood for the business. She says "with our future profit, I and my husband are planning to buy our own vehicle."

loans.use: Purchase wood for making furniture
